story:
Our Story

Hello world! 

We are The Soulflower Group and we need your help rebuilding the mind and spirit of a community and region ravaged particularly hard by the pain of our nation's economic downturn. We want to build on our past efforts and include our new ideas. Our next step on this journey is to bring to life our desire to curate a series of performances -- performances that build a sense of community wellness that stretches far beyond the typical acts that stop off in our home: California’s Central Valley. 


We began this August by hosting the amazing Grammy®-nominated artist Bilal. The show was a success of the spirit, but less rewarding financially. We are hobbled by a lack of seed money that will bring stability to our efforts. Please help us rekindle deeper forms of expression in a community that needs to feel something. Something more. We invite you to help launch the Soulflower Group Speakeasy series, a collection of 5 performances and happenings we would like to produce over the next 6 months.

 

The first Soulflower Speakeasy would pair a nationally-recognized poet with local poets, artists, music and special performances. We will begin with singer, emcee, and HBO Def Jam poet and New Orleans native Sunni Patterson -- whose 2007 visit to the Valley left such a positive impression we felt she would be the ideal spirit to reignite the movement.

Some History About Our Roots

In November of 2003, one of California's premiere poetry rooms closed its curtains. Devoya Mayo hosted 44 shows and 216 poets over the span of three short years. In that time The Ahh Yeah Poetry Jam was a spoken-word staple in the Central Valley. Ahh Yeah was created and fostered with the intention of bringing together diverse communities under one roof, and it succeeded in its goal. Community leaders, emerging and established poets, youth, elders, emcees, punks, professors, and musicians alike all rocked the mic with Devoya, month after month, helping to bridge cultural divides that often hide in plain sight.

When Ahh Yeah concluded, Devoya began to build on her community organizing skills and was invited to take part in a project sponsored by The American Friends Service Committee where she and 17 other organizers from the U.S traveled to Africa and worked with organizers from the continent on the Life over Debt campaign. In 2005 she in turn was asked to help coordinate the U.S. Campus Speaking tour to inform youth and communities across the Midwest about the Life Over Debt campaign.


Enter the Soulflower Group

In 2010, Devoya started The Soulflower Group, a consortium of local creatives who are committed to help rebuild our varied communities via performance, design, music, photography and the like. We all share a common vision of creating spaces and environments that people deserve rather than just settle for.

As a collective The Soulflower Group has two tiers of service. In-house we produce, create and execute gatherings that foster community wellness. We firmly believe that folks do better when they feel better, and we approach every idea with this tenet in mind. Externally, our consultants deliver creativity for individuals who may not otherwise have access to a creative department. Each idea is funded out of pocket via members, with reimbursement following thereafter.


What We Need 

Your help will cover costs of transportation/lodging for both the featured performer and her child, opening poets from outside the area as well as production and documentation costs. All documentation will be used in our efforts to recruit other performers to the Fresno area. Any funds you give beyond our initial funding amount will be used to produce the subsequent events in the series. All proceeds are returned back into the Speakeasy Series with the goal of becoming self-sustaining. Make no mistake we will exhaust every avenue to host this series. If we do not meet our funding goal we'll host the first installment and seek alternative options for all future performances. 

 

What You Get

We've got some perks in exchange for your support. Check below for the loot!


  • 5.00- Thank you in Program
  • 10.00- Thank you in Program/ Soulflower Group Button/ Soulflower Group Photo Postcard
  • 25.00- Everything listed above with a Soulflower Group Commemorative Poster
  • 50.00- Everything listed above with a Soulflower Group CD Compilation
  • 100.00- Everything listed above & 2 free tickets to the show (you may donate these to help others attend the series)
  • 250.00- Everything listed above plus name listed as official sponsor(s) of the event, Soulflower Group Tee-Shirt , Reserved Seating at the event (limited quantity) & a handwritten thank you card mailed directly to your home. 
  • 500.00- Everything listed above along with two free hours of DJ service courtesy of Ms Soulflower ( Devoya Mayo). Dates and time subject to availability. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us to share this campaign with others. Share this information with others. Use the tools my friends!  In the end it's our collective efforts that will yield the best results. Last but not least, come to the show!!!

Thank you for your support and for making a contribution in the way you feel most comfortable doing. It is all very much appreciated! Contact us directly if you require/need any additional information.

story:
Custom Comix: Who Are We and What Do We Want?!

Custom Comix is a small family owned business that creates one-of-a-kind wearable pieces of comic book art. Every piece is made by hand and uses actual upcycled comic book / manga pages. We are the creators of the original comic book bracelets that have been on Etsy the past two years ( and counting!) 

Custom Comix is made up of 2 1/2 people. My name is Holly Donahue and I hand make every item in my shop. I am also in charge of packaging, running the online store and all of the online social networks associated with Custom Comix, and I love every second of it!

Ryan Grant is my boyfriend and he is in charge of shipping off all of the items to their new homes. He is also my main support system and helps come up with new ideas for the shop, as well as help keep me grounded when convention season is here. He is also the muscle that builds all of the displays at each convention.

My daughter Carmen ( or Batgirl as she demans to be called today) is 2 1/2 and helps where she can. Her tiny hands aren't ready to help me craft but that doesnt stop her from trying. She also helps to remind me why I do what I do everyday. She is my geekling in training and probably my biggest fan!

How Custom Comix Started:

If you are here and you know of my little shop, it is probably because you either are, or have a proud geek girl in your life. Have you tried shopping for her? 2 years ago when I opened up my shop, there was little to nothing out there for the geek girl to buy to flaunt her interets-- that was made with HER in mind. You couldn't go into Walmart to pick up a Tank Girl bracelet.. or anything Tank Girl for that matter. ( You still can't!) The fans of smaller fandoms were crying out for something for THEM but it wa falling on deaf ears. Coming back empty handed on a search for something for myself, I decided to just make something. Ryan joined in and that is how the comic book bracelet was born!

I was working full time at a bank and one of my clients loved my bracelet and told me about Etsy. I listed a couple of bracelets and found that I was not the only one frustrated with the selection of items available for geeky girls, and my shop took off! I was able to quit my bank job and stay home full time with my little one. 

We have come a long way since our first bracelet, and our line has really evolved since then. Two years ago we sold only bracelets and now we are able to offer earrings and most recently pendants in our line of products. I love being able to create unique items for amazing ladies and hearing their stories and seeing how happy my items make them really give me that drive to push the Custom Comix name. 

I would love to offer a broader range of items to meet the requests of my supporters. Recently, I put out a product survey and got a huge response-- You told us what you would like to see us cover and smother next, and we REALLY want to bring that to you! That's what brings us to Indiegogo... 

New Products You Say??

The goal amount that we need is $1000, and we plan on working for it. Here is a list of items and descriptions that we would love to offer in our shop. With $1000 we would be able to buy all of the pieces, machinery and tools needed to get us started with these new products. 

-RINGS!: Those of you who filled out our product survey, 90% of you suggested you would like to see rings for sale in our shop. The ones that we have our eye on are sterling silver in color, adjustable in size and like our pentants, they will have real glass placed on top of an image from a comic book to protect it. They will be round in shape and be 20mm in size.

-CUFFLINKS!: MEN!! We really want to include the men this time around. It is always so sad to see guys sulk away from our booth when we are at conventions, so it would be nice to be able to include them! These cufflinks would be similar to the rinfs that we would like to offer. They will be silver in color and have a comic book image covered with a piece of glass to protect it. I am undecided on the shape as of right now, square or circle-- but if we go over our goal, I can experiment with both! These cufflinks would be great for adding a bit of geek flare for the business men out there, or a great accessory for dances or weddings!

-MAGNETS/KEYCHAINS!: Right now, I do have pin back buttons, but I do not offer them in my etsy shop just yet. I want the ability to offer not only buttons, but the option for magnets and keychains! They would all measure 1 1/4 inches in length and be round in shape. 

-POCKET MIRRORS!: The pocket mirrors that we want are 2 1/4in big and will have a comic book image on one side which will be protected by a plastic casing similar to a very large pin back button and on the other side will be the mirror. These would be great to stash in your purse for emergencies!

-VIDEO GAMES & POP CULTURE!: We would like to extend our line to include images from your favorite video games and pop culture characters!

The $1000 is a minimum cost to get us started with the products listed above, if we go over our goal, we will be able to try out additional ideas that we have and buy MORE stock of the above listed materials!

Here's What You'll Get!

This is the fun part-- we are offering different prize perks for each donation tier! Here is what we are offering:

You ROCK!

$1- For $1 I will personally send you an e-mail to remind you how awesome you are! ( You know, in case you forget) 

Button Crazy!

$5- For $5 you will receive 5 random mystery pin back buttons ( 1 1/4in.) Each one is made using actual comic book pages and they feature popular characters, so rest assured you won't be getting any of Batman's feet.

To Rule Them All..

$10- For $10 you will receive a ring featuring the character of your choice! Each ring will be silver in color, round in shape and adjustable in size. It will have a glass top to protect the comic book image inside!

Wear A Hero Around Your Neck

$15- For $15 you will receive a comic book pendant featuring the character of your choice!! Each pendant is antique silver in color, 30x40mm in size and like the rings, a glass piece is places inside to protect the comic book image. Each pendant comes with a 16 in. rolo chain. ( Not a ball chain!) 

Make A Statement

$15- If pendants aren't your thing, for $15 you will receive a pair of comic book earrings featuring the character of your choice! Earrings are about 2 1/2 inches in diameter and the comics are secured on very light weight metal discs. 

Six Pieces of Flare!

$20- For $20 you receive your choice of Earrings or Pendant with rolo chain AND 5 pin back buttons featuring the character of your choice!

Coaster Set

$25- For $25 you will receive a set of (4) ceramic coasters and a holder featuring the character of your choice!! 

Wear Your Geek On Your Sleeve

$30- For $30 receive a comic book bracelet featuring the character of your choice! Our bracelets are our biggest seller!! They come in two different sizes, Reg 2 3/4in diameter and XL: 3in diameter. The comic book pages are protected by using a combination of two different water resistant sealers.

Power Up Pack

$50- For $50 you receive 5 comic book magnets, 1 comic book ring and 1 comic book pendant and chain in the characters of your choice!

Sidekick Pack

$75- For a whole year, we will happily hand out your business cards with every sale we make via our online store and at conventions we attend AND free ad space on Momsbasement.org for 6 months!

Level Up Pack

$75- For our non-business owner supporters, at $75 receive 1 comic book bracelet, 1 comic book pendant and chain, 1 comic book ring and 1 pair of comic book earrings! All featuring the character of your choice! 

Everything Bagel

$100- For $100 you get the star treatment! You will receive 1 comic book bracelet, 1 comic book pendant and rolo chain, 1 pair of earrings, 1 comic book ring, 5 comic book magnets and a set of (4) ceramic comic book coasters with a holder ALL FEATURING THE CHARACTERS OF YOUR CHOICE!!!  

THANK YOU! 


No, seriousy.. THANK YOU! We really appreciate you stopping by and checking out our Indiegogo campaign. This shop really is my second child, and it means a LOT to me!! Every dollar helps, and I will put every dollar back into this shop to help improve it and make my product line grow-- that's a promise!

If you can't donate right now, just sharing this page to your comic loving friends would help out so much by getting the word out-- every share counts!!

Thanks again, 

Holly, Ryan and Carmen

story:
Hello. My name is David Milow, and I am the colorguard instructor at Patrick Henry High School. Over the past few years, funding for our program has been cut more and more, to the point where it is getting hard to find the funds to keep it going. The kids on the team this year are probably some of the most hard working, and dedicated individuals that I have ever coached, and I am going into my eleventh year doing this. For being as determined as they are, I would hate for them to miss out on the opportunity of competing, just because we don't have the funds to do so. So I decided to try something new this year, in the hopes of finding a way for my kids to march. 


We need to raise anywhere from $4,000 to $5,000 for the season. With the potential of a 30 person team, it could cost us anywhere from $3,000 to $4,000 just for our uniforms alone. On top of that, we need $500 to $1,000 for new flags, as well as new rifles, and our competition registration fees are $525. We don't require anyone on the team to put any money down, that way we can let anyone participate. This is why it is so crucial for us to raise money. The Spirit of '76 Boosters is a 501 (c) non-profit organization, so we would be getting no personal financial gain out of this. Even if we aren't able to reach our entire goal, any amount would help us in competing this season. And if we are able to compete, we will be performing at shows throughout San Diego, and you would be able to come out and see where you money is going.


Giving kids an opportunity to do something that they love has been one of the most rewarding experiences of my life, especially when not everyone knows exactly what colorguard is. I would like to think that being in colorguard has quite an impact on the kids. It teaches teamwork, confidence, dedication, and is also a great place to make friends, and have fun. Since I have been with the same program for so long, I have seen so many of my students start as timid freshman, and turn into mature seniors, and then grow into amazing young adults. This is why it is so important for me to find a way to let the team march in this upcoming season.


I really hope that you can help us out. Whether it be by donating, or passing along the word to someone who you think may be able to help us out, we would appreciate any help that you could give. For more information on our program, you can visit us at http://www.spiritof76boosters.com/ Thank you!


- David Milow

story:
The Tree of Transmutation is an interactive sculpture to be installed at Burning Man 2012.  This sculpture is part of the Transmutation Series by artist Kevin Christman.  It is his vision of his artistic ideas brought to the scale of Black Rock City to share with the unique community of Burning Man and to continue beyond the Playa.

Reward for a $250 Donation

Description

From a distance the sculpture looks like a tree or chandelier with strange translucent fruit or lighted pods suspended from stems radiating out from the center. 

Tree of Transmutation Sketch

The tree is made of fabricated steel branches that spring from the Playa and carry the suspended figures out from the center trunk.  Upon inspection the six pods appear to be female forms, two times life size, in various positions, suspended in space. 

Cocoons!

We have added a new feature to this project..Cocoons!  These suspended fabric cocoons will be hung between the branches so anyone can become fetal and emerge as the beautiful butterfly that they want to be.

Pyramid

In the center is a ten foot tall wooden pyramid pieced intricately together like the stonework of a Mayan wall.  The top is capped in three feet of copper plate with the tip intersecting a three-foot diameter ball of half life-size skeletons with a ten-inch iron version of the larger female figure suspended in the center.

Inner Core

The delicacy of the gesture appears as the figures rotate in their hanging positions. This sculpture engages a viewer from a distance, transforming as the figures interact on the Playa.

Artist Vision

This piece is a continuation of my Transmutation series, which refers to the alchemical process of evolution that we are perpetually undergoing.  At this point in time, it feels important to keep balanced, go inward, and know oneself before expanding to our ultimate potential.  The female figure in the fetal pose represents a place of nurturing in a safe environment, returning to the fertile womb, the cocoon that provides the enclosure for transmuting from chrysalis to the butterfly.  These ideas are explained more eloquently by Dr. Bruce Lipton  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gcacx_i6MIE

Engaging the viewer is the one of the most important elements that I strive for in every piece I create.  I am intentionally creating many layers of interest, from the initial visual hit to the curious close intrigue of the details.

I have always viewed the actions of my life as if I was looking at myself, removed from everything in the world.  Just my naked self in a vacuum of white space, how would my actions appear?  Would I be the crazy one reacting to someone else's hostility, or would I be centered in the face of the storm?  My experience at Burning Man in the middle of a dust storm was precisely such a vacuum.  Since that moment I have wanted to bring this project to the desert. 

 On the Playa

This sculpture is intended to engage the viewer through tactile inter-activity with the sculptures.  The female figures are removable from the tree and are free to roam the Playa, and return again to the tree in the evening for illumination.  The early hours of dusk the tree would begin to illuminate and when all figures have been returned to their branches a dynamic light show would occur that celebrates the final return.  The lighting will act as a metaphor for coming together to complete the transformation into a new brilliant future.

The Crew

We are so honored to have received an Honorarium from Burning Man.  This has made it possible for us to start to make this project come to life on the Playa.  We also could not do this without the enormous effort of so many friends here in Oregon.  We thank you for your support and would like you to join our Crew

  • Kevin Christman - the artist and visionary, www.kevinchristman.com
  • JulieO - mother of the crew, www.julieodwyerdesign.com
  • Steve Sirianni - making it all work, www.wallsoftimebuilders.com
  • Lynda Sirianni - holding the heart of the idea
  • Jason Hutchins - our welder
  • Zac Snow - Kevin's right hand man..and a Ginger!
  • Ken Becker - Aaaaaah!, www.safeworld.com
  • Rachel Rose - on the Playa coordinator extrordinaire
  • Greycloud - telepathetically solving all problems
  • Marya - get-it-done kinda girl
  • Inger Jorgensen - artist assistant and great lady
  • Mark Millner - transport support and fun guy on the Playa
  • Annabel Allen - videographer and wardrobe guru
  • Noah Kay - Kevin's left hand man
  • Todd Ellis - the prop master
  • Gabriel Lipper - fellow artist and antagonist
  • Saione Penn - the heart of the art
  • Navin Mahabir - archivist and best tan
  • Brian Dunagan - engineer god
  • YOU!!!!!!
The Crew
story_txt:

story:
I have dreamed of opening a ceramics studio since I was a kid and have been working with ceramics since I was about 10 years old (I'm 50 now).  I decided to go back to school last year because my career had stalled, and in January I signed up for a ceramics class just as a fun filler.  It was an epiphany!  It reawakened my dream and fulfilled a need that I have always had to have a creative outlet in my life.  Within the first few weeks, I had dropped my programming classes and decided to pursue the studio idea.  

What I am looking for is funding to support my first year in business.  I have a studio space in mind that has a very reasonable rent.  I found someone on Craig's List selling his late wife's ceramic studio - all equipment and supplies that I would need to get started.  I haven't even fully moved the equipment out of his house and have already made a sale!  I have many people - friends and acquaintences who have expressed interest in coming to my studio and I have a small amount of my recent work displayed on my Facebook page.  

Even if I don't reach my full goal, I will use the funds I do receive to get this studio opened.  The money I'm asking for is enough to cover rent and electricity for one year - and that's all.  I have most everything else I need.  I can find cheap or free tables and chairs on craig's list - preventing used furniture from ending up in landfills.  I don't need to spend a lot of money on fancy fixtures - that's not what this is about.  

I know I can create a warm, inviting space that people will want to come to.  I will have to start part time because I have to support myself - I'm a single mom who has raised 3 beautiful, successful daughters and now that they are all out on their own, I feel like I can do this and bring a little beauty to the world!  I have always been known as "the cool mom" because I keep up with current trends and have a contemporary style so my studio will be fresh and will draw all kinds of people.  

 

Even if you can't contribute financially, please spread the word for me!  Indiegogo has all the tools necessary to contribute to and/or share my cause.   My friends and family believe in me, and so do I!!  I can do this!  Any help will surely be appreciated.  Thank you for your time.

story:
Project Summary

My name is James Arndt. I'm an established game developer based out of Central Florida. You can see my work at www.jamesarndt3d.com and check out a history of some of the games I've worked on.
This campaign is based around the idea of bringing high quality assets to people for a very low price. It's also geared towards providing assets for projects being developed for mobile platforms like iOS and Android, as well as PC/Mac builds. These assets are medium poly count, low bone count and have low texture overhead. I'll get into the nitty gritty technical details below.

What I'm hoping to achieve with this campaign is : Provide low cost assets to game developers for usage in their game development projects. At the same time I am hoping to fund my own hourly work on these assets and expand the collection to include all of the (4) skin texture variations and the (4) clothing variations.  This would allow for more than 32 different and unique zombie combinations.

Technical Details

3,321 polygons for Male Zombie Character Model

2,936 polygons for Female Zombie Character Model

1024 x 1024px Diffuse texture (both male and female)

1024 x 1024px Normal Map Texture (both male and female)

* Specular Map within the Alpha Channel of the Diffuse.

Character models are exported into FBX format, OBJ format (static models), and the source 3ds Max files. The FBX format will work in most major game engines used today.  Textures are offered as PSD files, with appropriately named layers, and overlay/color/pattern styles (for easy editing).

Character Model Wireframe Previews


What I Need & What You Get

I am hoping to fund my own hourly work on these assets and expand the collection to really give game developers a large pack of high quality assets. I can offer this at a very low cost due to the nature of crowdfunding. My goal is simple: financially cover the time spent working on these assets.

Now on to what you get!
(2) Base Character Models (Male and Female Versions)
(FBX format, and source 3ds Max file)
(4) Skin Texture Variations in layered PSD file format
(4) Clothing Variations (attached 3D Models/Skinned with Animation)
(FBX format, and source 3ds Max file)
(1) Unity Package File for each Perk Tier (one button Unity import)
(35) Unique Animations: 
(8) Walking Loop Animations
(6) Running Loop Animations
(6) Idle Loop Animations
(7) Attacking Animations
(8) Unique Eating, Getting Hit and Crawling Animations
* Animations are provided as "in-place" Legacy animations, as well as separate versions for Unity's Mecanim (including root motion for walk and run cycles.)
* I will also be including a Unity Package file for each perk tier. This will allow one button import into the Unity Game Engine, importing all of the assets at once.

Character Model Previews

Check Out the current Unity Web Player Demo:

UNITY WEB DEMO

    Risks & Challenges

    The bulk of this character pack is completed, so the risk is minimal. I am setting the campaign to be limited to 28 days. Within the 28 day time period I have to wrap up (4) skin texture variations and (4) clothing variations for the female and male characters. This is completely doable within half the time period of the campaign. I see no risk other than myself being potentially abducted by aliens.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you don't have a need for animated zombie character models, chances are you might know someone who does! Please help if you can and use those Facebook and Twitter Share buttons found up top!

      And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

We are Supreme Origins a not-for-profit group formed by a group of friends whose lasting friendships were built on their shared involvement and experiences of previous Sheffield Carnivals, which ran throughout the 1980’s to 1990’s.

The group perceive that cultural diversity is becoming more fragmented in the city, although cultural diversity is growing, and want to create and coordinate a carnival event that could bring people together, to share and celebrate the many cultures in Sheffield.

Most other cities have a carnival and we thought, why shouldn't we!

We are very excited to announce that Sheffield Carnival is launching at the Sheffield Fayre, taking place at Norfolk Heritage Park, on Monday 28th August 2017!

The Carnival spirit has been missing from Sheffield for over 20 years and we are bringing it back with a bang.

The event will run alongside the Sheffield Fayre and will consist of a parade made up of children and people from the local community who will display their carnival costumes in the “Sheffield Shines” parade.  

The “Sheffield Shines” parade aims to celebrate everything Sheffield, the history, culture and heritage of Sheffield, what makes Sheffield unique and to showcase and celebrate the many cultures that reside in Sheffield.

2017 will be the first of what will be an annual event with a different theme each year.

The theme for our very first carnival will be “Sheffield in Bloom”.

 

What We Need 

We will be running costume making workshops in the run up to the carnival and need your donations to help cover the cost of arts materials for our workshops.

We want to create beautiful vibrant costumes to show "Sheffield in Bloom" comprising of flowers, insects and plants in keeping with the Sheffield Fayre's Horticultural Show.

This is where you could help!

We are asking people to donate as much or as little as you can, to help us create some fabulous costumes.

It only takes "£2 to Shine" to support the "Sheffield Shines" parade.

We are suggesting people donate £2 (or more) and post a photo of yourself with the hashtag #2toShine on social media channels, to help Sheffield to Shine!

Any additional money we raise would be used towards expenses for artists and refreshments for the children taking part, any funds leftover will be rolled forward to next year.

 

The Impact

Part of our vision is to encourage participation from the city and the wider region.  In order to achieve this we intend to engage with local people by providing workshops in local community centres, organisations and youth clubs.

We want to create opportunities to bring people together, to share and celebrate the many cultures within the city in the "Sheffield Shines" parade.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our crowdfunding campaign on your social media networks.

  • We need artists and creative people to facilitate our workshops and help us create costumes. 
  • Join the parade!  We are keen to encourage people from the wider local community to join our parade.  Come in your national dress to represent your heritage, or if you have a coordinated group or you have been a lantern parader, bring your lantern, we’d love you to join us.
  • Book a stall.  We will be having a number of stalls please get in touch for more information. 
  • Be a volunteer.  We are looking for volunteers on the day to help with stewarding, litter picking etc.
  • Be a performer. We are looking for musicians, music artists, dance groups and performers to perform on the main stage at the event.

Visit our website for more information about how to get involved and to find out more about our project.

Email: info@sheffieldcarnival.org

Visit our social media channels and like and share our posts

https://www.facebook.com/sheffieldcarnival/

https://twitter.com/sheffcarnival

story:
What are we up to this time?

This year, Haute to Death is proud to be a featured collective for Satellite Art Show, one of the more progressive and exuberant fairs that specializes in independent and emerging galleries, curators and artist lead projects.

While the visual works of Haute to Death will be on display, we've also included the work of respected creators and friends Lindsay Cashews, Jade Homicz, and John Griffith; artists who operate from their own self-actualized aesthetic universe, while simultaneously sharing in our collective ethos, furthering the narrative and execution of this particular show. 

The concepts and spirit of the work in the show are those that are central to our parties; the internal exploration / external catharsis that club culture can have on ones identity and self-actualization. We have seen the affirmative power that a dance floor can have on people to feel safe to be themselves, as a space to transform and test the waters of new territories of their identity. It's a space that plays by different rules than those that preside over daylight hours. 

We think it's very important and valuable for our family of creators; the artists, musicians and other creative professionals traveling along a similar path to us, who share a spirit and ethos with ours to be represented at these major industry gatherings. Through the help of our community, participating in these projects becomes a much more realistic and attainable goal.

 

What will help us succeed?

As we know, taking on projects of any size requires more than passion. Time, energy, major organization efforts (seriously!) and initial funding are what actualize plans into the real deal. 

For art fairs in particular, inclusion of independent projects is very rare. Not only are the opportunities for emerging or underground creators few and far between, but participation cost alone can be quite unrealistic for non-established, but fully worthy, artists and collectives.

We're thankful to have been selected by Satellite to represent our own facet of Detroit at this year's fair (and do not take the responsibility lightly!) Here's where your cash goes to help us make sure we do our best: 

  • $3000 covers participation and our booth at Satellite. While it may seem like a lot, this is only a fraction of what most fairs charge their participating galleries and curators. Satellite is the strongest choice to position our collective for relevant exposure and positive growth during Art Basel weekend. 
  • $2000 covers production costs. Items like framing, lighting, packaging materials and shipping care, installation materials and other tools to make sure our 300 sq. foot booth shine as bright as it can.

Honestly, that's about it. We've put in the work to make sure we get can get ourselves, our work, and our people down to Miami. Help recouping the cost of participating in Satellite is our primary need, and look to our community for a hand in doing so. 

 

Why is this so important?

Detroit offers a lot for a creative quality of life, but very little for creators to elevate to higher echelons of the industry... So, we jump in and do it ourselves, taking agency over our collective narrative and the individual narratives of those who's work and well being are important and complimentary to our own. 

Working with our community allows us to keep our vision uncompromised by the forces and demands associated with other forms of funding that support work like this. 

Being able to stay true to our vision makes what we do impactful and intriguing. It comes from a real pocket of creativity and it helps people care and connect with the work and our stories that lead us there. When more people connect and buy into the work we raise the ceiling a little bit higher for what's possible in your career as a Detroit based creator. 

We see the role we play in the bigger picture of Detroit and our creative community; improving that ecosystem and making a Detroit based creative career a little more viable for our cohort is very much a part of what drives us. 

 

Anything else?

Yes! We realize a financial contribution isn't always possible, and that's totally okay. We always need help getting the word out about not only this campaign, but the show itself!  

  • Sharing this page and letting others know what's up means a TON!
  • Interact with us on facebook, instagram, mixcloud- wherever! We've made it easy by being @hautetodeath on all of them. Pointing people our way on socials is a big help. 
  • Do you have friends, colleagues, or other connects that will be in town during Art Basel weekend? Please send them our way! They can learn about Satellite Art Show here, but shoot us a message at hautetodeath@gmail.com if we should do a personal intro.
  • We'll be participating in quite a few projects while we're on the road, which we'll be sharing on IG and FB in the coming weeks. Please tag your friends who will be nearby, we'd love to meet them. 

--

Thanks for making it to the end and always keeping us in mind. Wish us luck and we'll see you soon! 

xx, H2D
story_txt:
What are we up to this time?
This year, Haute to Death is proud to be a featured collective for Satellite Art Show, one of the more progressive and exuberant fairs that specializes in independent and emerging galleries, curators and artist lead projects.While the visual works of Haute to Death will be on display, we've also included the work of respected creators and friends Lindsay Cashews, Jade Homicz, and John Griffith; artists who operate from their own self-actualized aesthetic universe, while simultaneously sharing in our collective ethos, furthering the narrative and execution of this particular show. 
The concepts and spirit of the work in the show are those that are central to our parties; the internal exploration / external catharsis that club culture can have on ones identity and self-actualization. We have seen the affirmative power that a dance floor can have on people to feel safe to be themselves, as a space to transform and test the waters of new territories of their identity. It's a space that plays by different rules than those that preside over daylight hours. 
We think it's very important and valuable for our family of creators; the artists, musicians and other creative professionals traveling along a similar path to us, who share a spirit and ethos with ours to be represented at these major industry gatherings. Through the help of our community, participating in these projects becomes a much more realistic and attainable goal.

 
What will help us succeed?
As we know, taking on projects of any size requires more than passion. Time, energy, major organization efforts (seriously!) and initial funding are what actualize plans into the real deal. 
For art fairs in particular, inclusion of independent projects is very rare. Not only are the opportunities for emerging or underground creators few and far between, but participation cost alone can be quite unrealistic for non-established, but fully worthy, artists and collectives.
We're thankful to have been selected by Satellite to represent our own facet of Detroit at this year's fair (and do not take the responsibility lightly!) Here's where your cash goes to help us make sure we do our best: 

$3000 covers participation and our booth at Satellite. While it may seem like a lot, this is only a fraction of what most fairs charge their participating galleries and curators. Satellite is the strongest choice to position our collective for relevant exposure and positive growth during Art Basel weekend. 
$2000 covers production costs. Items like framing, lighting, packaging materials and shipping care, installation materials and other tools to make sure our 300 sq. foot booth shine as bright as it can.

Honestly, that's about it. We've put in the work to make sure we get can get ourselves, our work, and our people down to Miami. Help recouping the cost of participating in Satellite is our primary need, and look to our community for a hand in doing so. 
 
Why is this so important?
Detroit offers a lot for a creative quality of life, but very little for creators to elevate to higher echelons of the industry... So, we jump in and do it ourselves, taking agency over our collective narrative and the individual narratives of those who's work and well being are important and complimentary to our own. 
Working with our community allows us to keep our vision uncompromised by the forces and demands associated with other forms of funding that support work like this. 
Being able to stay true to our vision makes what we do impactful and intriguing. It comes from a real pocket of creativity and it helps people care and connect with the work and our stories that lead us there. When more people connect and buy into the work we raise the ceiling a little bit higher for what's possible in your career as a Detroit based creator. 
We see the role we play in the bigger picture of Detroit and our creative community; improving that ecosystem and making a Detroit based creative career a little more viable for our cohort is very much a part of what drives us. 
 
Anything else?
Yes! We realize a financial contribution isn't always possible, and that's totally okay. We always need help getting the word out about not only this campaign, but the show itself!  

Sharing this page and letting others know what's up means a TON!
Interact with us on facebook, instagram, mixcloud- wherever! We've made it easy by being @hautetodeath on all of them. Pointing people our way on socials is a big help. 
Do you have friends, colleagues, or other connects that will be in town during Art Basel weekend? Please send them our way! They can learn about Satellite Art Show here, but shoot us a message at hautetodeath@gmail.com if we should do a personal intro.
We'll be participating in quite a few projects while we're on the road, which we'll be sharing on IG and FB in the coming weeks. Please tag your friends who will be nearby, we'd love to meet them. 

--
Thanks for making it to the end and always keeping us in mind. Wish us luck and we'll see you soon! 
xx, H2D

story:
Hey! Welcome to my fundraiser! For the past 4 years I have had a dream to take some of my ideas for crafting a share them with others. I had been doing craft shows for several years and while it was a lot of fun, it was hard setting up and breaking down. I had tons of displays too and we had to take two cars just to get my jewelry and crafts to the shows! A year and a half ago I had a wonderful opportunity to be a partner at a shop in East Nashville. My time at Moss has been wonderful and my jewelry business has gotten a lot of recognition since I have been there, Sometimes good things must come to an end and make way for something even better! 

A year and a half ago I also bought a 67 airstream who I named Athena(with help from a friend) she is the goddess of crafting. Who knew!!! I bought her for 4,250 bucks and that was a deal! after that I was broke, but at least I had my airstream. Then came some hurdles. The neighbor complained about her being parked in the street so we had to move her to a friends and figure out how to get her in the back yard. Then my dad's cancer came back and he passed away last summer. I needed some time to grieve after that. In October I received money from dad's fabulous comic strip collections and was able to get 10 trees down a fence moved and a gravel driveway put in the back yard. Athena was home again!! after this we began renovations. First we gutted her which was a lot of fun for me! who needs a punching bag when you have a large hammer! Then we ripped out the floors and then it was winter. It was wet. It was rainy and it was cold!! Renovations were put on hold until spring. We picked out  new floors and put them in and had her rewired. Then came the rebuilding. My husband David has done a beautiful job with wrap around seating and cabinets for retail as well as craft store space.

     Paper Moon Airstream will have a small retail space where I will sell my jewelry(Crescent Moon Jewels) crafts and fair trade tapestries. It will all be my studio and a creative space for open crafting and craft themed birthday parties, baby showers, moms night out,etc,, You get the idea!

    Athena is being painted and is getting closer to being finished. I have pillows and curtains,and craft supplies and baskets, but I'm not quite done. This is where you come in. My sweet mother has given me money out of the money dad left as an investment, but she can't do anymore. I have put much of my own money into it and so has my husband. We are tapped out. I never thought I would be asking for a donation but here I am. 

  I need: 1) a generator  2) more craft supplies 3)advertising (brochures,cards and signage) 4) more paint 5)a few more building materials 6)foam seating

  If this sounds like a great idea here's how you can help. 1) make a donation or 2)spread the word. 

  If you tell two friends, then they'll tell to friends..and so on and so on and so on.. please share :)

  Thank you for supporting this woman and her dream!!! XO Jennifer

story:
WHY?

for over a year now i have been practicing tarot and astrology, learning about herbs and herbal remedies, and for much longer i have been drawing. i've always played around with the idea of creating my own plant tarot deck, and now i finally feel like i know them well enough to get it done. i just need the start up money to get them printed....


$800?!?!

this seems like a steep amount for a deck of cards? let's break it down

  •  a tarot deck is 78 cards (so this is 78 different cards, printed front and back in only ONE deck)
  • something to hold the cards (simple tuck box is 25 cents a deck, or a pouch is another alternative)
  • shipping ($60-90 depending on the amount of decks ordered)
  • 50-100 decks (the more you order the cheaper the cost of printing!)

and if we raise more, it would go towards more add ons - like gold foil printing on the tuck box, or a tarot card booklet to go along with it.


WHAT DO YOU GET?

other than the satisfaction of helping out a little artist dream big! donating also acts as a pre-order. you will get a coupon code (and a thank you!) to discount the amount you donated when the cards are up and ready (early November 2015). if you donate more than the cost of the cards you will get more personalized goodies.


MY BACKGROUND

all my life i have been artistic, and yet i never felt secure enough to take the plunge and just do it. even after graduating from MassArt in 2012 i went towards a more secure job field working at a botanic garden and tried to cram making art into the after hours.

in March 2015 i decided to risk it all and travel to Taos, New Mexico. I wasn't planning on staying, but as i started to get more freelance art projects I felt like maybe this is where i should be. it's risky not having a steady income, and right now i need a little indegogo boost, but I'm confident as i get more products out it'll grow from there

i have sold on etsy (which i plan on getting up and running again) and have a shelf at the Crompton Collective, an antiques and artisan mall in Worcester that has an amazing vibe, and loyal following.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP

of course, I understand not everyone has money to donate. even the littlest donation of a couple dollars can help- but if you're not in a position, feel free to just share this around and get the word out!

thanks so much!
Heather

story:
Short Summary

Growing older gives you more perspective about time. I realized I want to do things differently. Feeling that there is so little time to waste on things that I don't like.

Here is where I need your help. I used lots of my savings over the past few years to get a camera that is decent enough and won't break down on me any time soon. As a University student I cannot work to get the money necessary for both relocating abroad and the equipment needed to make photographs and prints.
Currently finishing my last year of IT & Electronics. But what's after that? I'd like to study and live abroad. Get to know people all over the world by travelling, exploring and going on lifetime adventures. Aside from that I want to do what I love to do every day and that is photographing.
In trade for the help I want to give you high quality prints.
I'm not the best with words, so sorry for that!


What I Need & What You Get

To keep on doing what I love I need money to keep shooting. Right now the biggest costs are:
  • Film
  • Developing
  • Printing & Enlarging
  • Scanners
  • Gear
To make sure I can study and live abroad and make my dream come true. I need to save a lot of money. Saving means less expenses which makes it hard to keep on photographing. I tried to learn everything myself to save costs instead of going to a lab. This was part one of the plan, this project is part two.
By backing my project I will make every print uniquely with a chemical process. There is a lot involved to make every print just right which makes it very personal. This gives me the opportunity to give something back for your appreciation of my work. 
Printing pictures gives another dimension to a photograph and connects people much more with the subject. Nothing can beat a well made silver print. Some images could be a digital print as only a small portion is digital work.


The Impact

If you need any references you can see a small selection of my work on my website: www.jessestr.be
The funding would help me not to touch my personal savings for the relocation abroad. Photography is a passion and I'd like to keep it that way so it doesn't become an obligation.
Thank you for reading through all this and it would be great if you could support me. 


Risks & Challenges

No risks are bound to this project. Except for not getting the funds.


Other Ways You Can Help

You may always share this project or like one of my other projects on Facebook.
You can visit my website on www.jessestr.be or like my facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/jessestruyveltphotography

As a film lover I try to help the film community as much as I can so in January 2014 I raised the Film Foundation (https://www.facebook.com/filmfoundation) to bring film photographers together by organizing workshops and meetings.

story:
My Short Summary

  • Hi! My name is Amber Nicole Beasley. Ever since entering the world of Comics, and Comic Cons, I have loved and seen many new art forms, along with being reminded with the art I love to make. After watching for so long, It is time to follow one of my dreams, and start up my own business!
  • I'm trying to express myself and family through art. From custom Pixel Figures/Candles/mugs/Skirts and more. With any business, I'm trying to reach a small start up fund, in order to get going!
  • Helping this goal be reached will be the most important aspect in my buisness, seeing that others care and want to have the art I will be making. Those interested in donating will get my full appreciate and previews of art, and even custom designed items!


What We Need & What You Get

  • I'am trying to reach a fund of $500, in order to get every single supply I need, to make everything I want to showcase for you all. Without your help, reaching my full potential in this business will not be achieved.
  • Unique Perks Include: Custom Art before an on-line store/custom orders are even available! Discounts on future purchases, and more!
  • Whatever funds I can raise, will go towards making my art for all of you! No penny wasted!

Risks & Challenges

  • Being a mother of one, and constantly going to Comic Conventions/Art shows, I decided to do something with my time. Finally, starting my dream of running my own business! Without a start up, being able to find funds and start my business, will take a long time. 
  • Either way, my business will become a reality, But I know there are many who support me, and what I plan on doing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

:

  • Just sharing my campiagn, I will have all the help in the word. Thank you very much for reading!

story:
A BIG THANK YOU TO ALL WHO CONTRIBUTED TO THE CAMPAIGN. ITS BEEN A MAJOR SUCCESS AND WILL ALLOW THE EXHIBITION TO HAPPEN. PLEASE CONTINUE TO SPREAD THE WORD AND GIVE BECAUSE EVERY PENNY WILL GO TOWARD MAKING THE EXHIBITION EVEN BETTER!

-Evond Blake (MEDIAH)


Short Summary

DECIMALS REBUILT- HYPURITIDE

ONLY ONE GALLERY
September 21, 2013
Toronto, Canada

My name is Evond Blake also known as MEDIAH. I’ve been an active graffiti artist since 1994 and since then I have transitioned into the world of media art using animation, graphics, and contemporary art. My work is labeled as Futurist or avant-garde because of the unconventional structure of my style. I define my work as Dynamism because of my unrelenting obsession with dynamic forms, speed, light and reaction.

HYPURITIDE is the 6th Installment of my mega-series of solo shows entitled DECIMALS REBUILT. The intention is to create visually stunning artwork that blurs the lines between new media practices, contemporary art, and the gritty, edgy aesthetic of graffiti art to create a unique experience that moves both spirit and mind.

YOU as the contributor can help me bring this amazing new world into existence. This show will be a catalyst for Decimals Rebuilt to be shown internationally.

What We Need

Space rental- $2000 (two week rental with opening and closing receptions)
Projection equipment rental -$1300
Installation costs -$600
Promotional materials -$400

Perks (What YOU get)

For every contribution of $25 or more you will receive a custom giclée print on archival watercolor paper signed and numbered by me personally. The smallest prints have a value of $40 on their own, but these prints are special as they will not be available for sale anywhere else.

$10 - OFFICIAL SUPPORTER + name on revamped web site + hand written thank you card + DECIMALS REBUILT Wallpaper

$25 - 8"x 10" print + DR postcard + DR Wallpaper

$50- 10"x 15" print +DR postcard + DR Wallpaper

$75- 10"x 15" print +DR t-shirt + DR postcard + DR Wallpaper

$100- 13"x19" print + DR book + DR postcard + DR Wallpaper

$250- 17” x 22” print + DR t-shirt + DR book + DR postcard + DR Wallpaper

$500- 12" X 18" ORIGINAL WATERCOLOUR PAINTING + DR t-shirt + DR book + DR postcard + DR Wallpaper

$750- 16" X 20" ORIGINAL PAINTING + DR t-shirt + DR book + DR postcard + DR Wallpaper

$1000- 20" x 30" ORIGINAL PAINTING on wood panel + Personalized graffiti drawing of YOUR NAME + DR t-shirt +DR book + DR  postcard + DR Wallpaper

 

 

If I don't reach the goal of $4300, the donated funds will be prioritized into space rental and rental of projection equipment. For the past six years I have been investing my own funds and I will continue to do so as I cannot rest until I see this project through to its full completion.

The Impact

My intention is for each and every viewer to walk away from the show feeling spiritually awakened and inspired, like never before at another art show. To date DECIMALS REBUILT has been exposed to thousands of viewers across Canada with animation components featured in the Currents International New Festival in Santa Fe, New Mexico.

Other Ways You Can Help

Outside of a donation, you can help this project by spreading the word about this fundraising campaign on facebook, instagram, twitter, on blogs, web sites and by word of mouth. Also, if you have any connections to technology sponsors (for LED, LCD TVs, and HD projectors) please get in touch with me. Jamaicans have a saying, “Every mickle mek a muckle” which means that every penny adds up. Any contribution can help – big or small. Come be a part of this unprecedented world, COME BE REBUILT.

Video Directed and Edited by Nicolas Kadima
www.rubberpixel.com

story:
About The Project


PY // Art From Parkland's Youth is an art exhibition featuring local high school students in Parkland, WA being put on by Sarah Wise. Sarah holds a BFA in Graphic Design from Pacific Lutheran University in her home town of Parkland. She is currently working towards her MA in Arts Administration from the Savannah College of Art and Design, and this is her final project for that degree. The purpose of this show is to build positive community relationships through art. The students of the local Franklin Pierce School District's two high schools will submit their own original artwork to a jury comprised of PLU students, who will determine which pieces go on display in the Wekell Gallery at PLU. The community will then be invited to a weekend-long exhibition featuring this artwork, showcasing the creative talent found right here in Parkland.

PY // Art From Parkland’s Youth Business Sponsorship

Businesses may contribute to PY // Art From Parkland’s Youth in a variety of ways. The following are suggested levels of participation. Local businesses wishing to support the Parkland community and this project are encouraged to do so in any way they see fit. For more information about the PY // Art From Parkland’s Youth project, Like us on Facebook at facebook.com/pyartshow.

Donations

Monetary donations are accepted. Contributions in any amount will be accepted. Funds will go towards the following:

  • Catering for the gallery’s opening night
  • Printing of all promotional materials for the show
  • Art supplies to help students prepare their work for the gallery space
  • Art-related prizes for students winning 1st, 2nd, and 3rd prizes
  • Any additional funds at the end of this project will be donated to the Franklin Pierce School District for arts education

Businesses making a donation of $30 or more will receive promotion as a “featured sponsor” in the PY // Art From Parkland’s Youth social media campaign. Promotion will include a special thank you to the business and a link to that business’ website (or phone number for businesses that do not have online presence).

Businesses making a donation of $75 or more will automatically receive space in the Sponorship section of the gallery program, which will be distributed to viewers during the show. This is in addition to promotion online through the social media campaign.

Participation

Businesses are also encouraged to participate with promoting the show amongst the Parkland community. There are endless possibilities for how a business may participate in the show. Here are some suggested ways to participate:

Feature student artwork in your place of business. Artwork is a great way to liven up any space, and what better way than to feature artwork from local high school students? Artwork may be installed in your place of business, along with the artists’ name, school, year in school, and information about the PY // Art From Parkland’s Youth exhibition at PLU. Here are the details:

  • You may feature just one piece or however many you’d like, depending on availability
  • Your business will be included as a sponsoring business in the social media campaign online as well as in the printed gallery program at the show

Allow promotion of the show. If you don’t have the space to host artwork, another option may be placing flyers advertising the show in your business. We simply ask that you place at least one flyer in a visible place that will attract customer attention. Do you have a community bulletin board? What about your shop window? Inform the community about the upcoming show, and show that your business is involved with the community and the arts. Here are the specifics:

  • Post at least one flyer; we are happy to provide more at your request
  • Your business will be included as a sponsoring business in the social media campaign and will receive special thanks at the gallery show (please note: special thanks will be verbal during a speech for the gallery opening. This is not the same as being featured in the sponsors section of the printed program) 

Post a link to the show’s Facebook page or blog on your business’ website. We’re happy to accept a little web traffic from your customers! You can raise awareness by featuring a link on your website and informing the community about this unique opportunity. Here are the specifics:

  • Place a link to the show’s Facebook page or blog
  • We will link back to your business in our sponsors section online

Because the purpose of this project is to build community relationships, any form of contribution to the cause is welcomed! If none of these options match your business’ needs, please reach out to Sarah Wise at wise.sarahe@gmail.com to discuss other options. Together, we will find the perfect relationship for your business to support this project. Thank you!

story:
Vous l'avez croisé dans les événements de Montreal, sinon c'est que vous etiez sur une autre planète ! 

Cette jeune femme tres special, prend en photo TOUT et PARTOUT depuis un moment maintenant.

Sachant qu'il n'y a pas souvent de média qui couvre l'ensemble des événements urbain a mtl, ses albums facebook sont devenus en quelque sorte une référence afin de savoir en image, le déroulement de ces event ainsi que les personnes présentent.

 

Cependant la qualité des photo, n'est pas toujours au rendez-vous, faute d'avoir un appareil photo amateur.

 

Voila pourquoi il serait bien de lui offrir tous ensemble un appareil photo professionel qui NOUS sera tous bénéfique en bout de ligne car elle fait tous ses effort pour nous, sans jamais RIEN nous demander.

 

Sa fete arrive le 25 juillet, cela serais un beau cadeau !

story:
Introduction:

 

What is NELAart? Northeast Los Angeles Arts Organization. And where is it? Northeast Los Angeles includes Mount Washington, Highland Park, Eagle Rock, Cyprus Park and Glassell  Park. This area of Los Angeles has some of the city's most diverse collection of artists and a rich history of being an arts community. There are more and more creative artists moving here everyday. Weâ€™re surrounded by fine and commercial artists, designers and architects, musicians and performers, and as more move into the area they find kindred spiritsâ€¦ and a community that celebrates the arts.

 

The area has been a home for arts and crafts for quite awhile and itâ€™s having a resurgence. Itâ€™s only getting better. Thatâ€™s where NELAart comes in. It was founded over 6 years ago by Brian Mallman and a small group of gallery owners and artists who wanted to show art and bring attention to the area as a center for arts. Second Saturday was started and has been running continuously since. Galleries and artists come and go but the monthly event lives on. It has given artists a place to show and arts enthusiasts a place to see local art.

 

THE Meat:

 

Now NELAart is ready to take it to the next levelâ€¦weâ€™re currently in the process of turning it into a non-profit. Fresh events are being put together to bring more artists, galleries, and collectors and potential collectors together. Itâ€™s about connecting people to art and art to people.

 

This brings me to why Iâ€™m here at Indie GoGo talking to all of you. The process of transformation requires funding. And Indie GoGo is one of the places weâ€™re going to to assist the start up process for NELAart.

 

What are some of the things NELAart is planning to do you may askâ€¦we want to spread the word about the arts in this area. We want to assist artists with the things they may need help with such as applying for commissions or putting together a portfolio. There will be grants, in fact weâ€™ve already started a micro-grant program that gives artists cash. Itâ€™s based on the live micro-grant funding model thatâ€™s sweeping the nation. Artists present projects to patrons that have bought tickets, and in most cases enjoyed a little food and drink, and those patrons vote on the project they like best. The winner receives the money from the ticket sales. Itâ€™s crowd funding like Indie GoGo but it happens right in front of you. We also are planning indie film nights and literary salons, performance and music events, pop up galleries and we're helping to bring more arts to the local schools.

 

As an organization we also want to be able to provide information to the arts community such as calls for art, business oriented classes and lectures, insurance, and some of the things most artists cannot always access. All of this requires staff and that requires funding. Weâ€™re not asking for the world, just some start up dollars. And there are goodies to help encourage you to give us some assistance.

 

THE Perks:

$  5.00                                    a NELAart button

$10.00                                    a NELart sticker

$20.00                                    a NELAart poster

$25.00                                    a NELAart t-shirt

 

$50.00                                    all of the above

$75.00                                    art passport card (gives discounts at participating merchants & free admission to              

                                               some art events)

 

$100.00                                  1 month web ad on nelaart.org

$250.00                                  3 month web ad on nelaart.org

$500.00                                  sponsorship mention at next event & 3 month web ad on nelaart.org

$1000                                     Eternal devotion, and a t-shirt as well as the $500.00 level perks +

 

events to comeâ€¦and a couple we already do.

Gallery Night

Micro Grant Events

Satellite Galleries/Windows

Pop up Galleries

Indie Film Nights

Literary Salons

Open Studio Tours

Art Competitions

Xmas Tree 20/20

Business of Art Classes and Lectures

Demonstrations and Classes

Art Education in Schools

Art to Stage New Homes

Fashion Shows

Booths at Events

 

Other Fund Raising Sources

T-Shirts/Stickers

Other NELAart Products

Events that bring together galleries and public that charge admission

Sponsors

Grants

Craft Shows

Donation/Auction Events

Membership Fees â€“ different levels also includes Art Passport card

Bake Sale

story:
A paper craft 3d camera?

Hi, my name is Jairo, I studied Aerospace Engineering and have a degree in Film School from the Dutch Film Academy. After school I started working as a freelancer  and worked as a visual effects artist on commercials.

When I had the idea of shooting 3d movies with my iPhone I started to prototype and it worked. My challenge is to find a cheap way to let you guys participate. Unfortunately it is not as simple as installing an app from the app store. You need a way to physically record two images with a slightly different perspective.

I used 3d modelling software to figure out the dimensions. The final design is a combination of a single piece of cardboard and four metal parts. The app for shooting the movies is already in the app store.

 

 

Fund me!

With the money now available, I investigated a good printing company which can deliver sturdy 400 grams laminated cardboard, it is very good for the model. Also there are two mirror plates underway from China, awesome!

Now I have to figure out how to further produce. Cutting thin metal sheet precisely is annoyingly hard to do and therefore very expensive. Also the cutting plan for the paper is pretty complex. 

I need money to work this out, visit fabrication labs to develop my prototyping skills and even batch produce the parts needed myself if need. These are the perks I have on offer:

Lone Woolf: an original The Woolf 3d anaglyph iPhone kit, and one pair of 3D glasses.

 

Romulus and Remus: two original The Woolf 3d anaglyph iPhone kits, and two pairs of 3D glasses.

 

Woolf Pack: five original The Woolf 3d anaglyph iPhone kits, and five pairs of 3D glasses.

 

Moon  Pack: two original The Woolf 3d anaglyph iPhone kits, two pairs of 3D glasses, a special surprise gift, and your name will be included in the credits of the app.

What Else?

So plan A is get a group of people interested to try this invention of mine and use their money to work out the production of the models. I will keep everyone up to date on my decisions and make photo's etc. After that I will try to really kickstart this baby and find some crazy Japanese market to sell a million Woolfs. Which is plan B... ;-) And of course making a model for the iPhone 5 or the Samsung Galaxy could be a plan, if there is demand.

 

More on the Woolf on www.the-Woolf.nl!

 

Follow @thewoolf3d on Instagram!

 

Regards,

Jairo Bambang Oetomo
BBO Design & Technology

 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please note: The prices for the perks include shipping within Europe. For worldwide shipping please add USD 5.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brian Lee, grandson of Betty and Calvin Douglas, and I have created this campaign to get funding to provide a trip of lifetime for my grandparents. I am going to take these civil rights soldiers to the inauguration to see their efforts come full circle. At 95 and soon to be 88 they will only get this shot at seeing the first African American President inaugurated, since we missed the first one. I have been blessed to have them in my life and owe them so much that this is the least I can do. With age and illness taking its toll my window to pay my gratitude is running out. These two individuals are a bit of living history and believe that they should see this event. Without them and others like them we would not have the country that we know today.

What We Need & What You Get

The first $10000 raised will go to providing proper transportation, lodging and healthcare. My stretch goal is to raise $100000 and film a documentary of their life experiences and trip to the inauguration. Everyone that donates will mentioned in the documentary once we get to our stretch goal.

The Impact

The project is important to our society for a number of reasons. The people who fought in the civil rights movement harnessed a desire to make this country better. They struggled for equality in a world that wasn’t. We cannot forget what made us who we are today and therefore we need to see their story.

story:
What Is The "Angel Experience" -Healing Art Journal?

The, "Angel Experience" – Healing Art Journal takes you on a self guided journey along a spiritual path forged from messages provided by the cosmos on the night of 11-11-2011. Each of the messages provided in this beautiful journal unfolding each pf the steps showing you the steps to break through the barriers that stand in the way as you learn to reshape and redefine your true values and goals so you may meet for the first time... YOU.  

Sure we can question receiving messages from the cosmic universe, nevertheless the messages are here. There are no coincidences the clarity of these messages have come at this point in time. As you can see through Robyne's background and her ability to overcome the odds you know she value's inner strength and awareness unlike anything else. Her truth has allowed her to overcome the impossible not just once rather numerous times. You can be assured the Angel Experience is of great significance to the whole.

The "Angel Experience" in its physical form is a coffee tabletop art book and journal featuring the works of eleven, very talented artists who are working with Robyne to bring alive eleven main art (11" by 14") paintings from the photo's taken on the night of 11-11-2011. Additionally, there are other talented doodle-art artists and illustrators who will complete the 121 (11" by 14") doodle art illustrations. These illustrations support the eleven main art paintings allowing the journalers to work right along side the messages captured on the night of 11-11-2011.

The "Angel Experience" Healing Art Journal has great appeal for those who desire nothing more than to embrace their inner knowing and want their soul to lead the way.

 

Who Is Robyne Arrow?

Sometimes the story finds the storyteller. In the case of the "Angel Experience" the story teller is Robyne Arrow.

On 11/11/11, while walking her dogs at night, Robyne was moved to capture photos of the night sky. When Robyne finally reviewed the photos weeks after they were taken, she realized her camera had captured something magical – see a few for yourself! 

The first few photos into the series of photos on the night of 11-11-2011 portrays the importance of finding stillness in the midst of chaos. The photos then show the power of how various thoughts can either expand your inner soul to awaken or contract you back to your old ways. With the acknowledgement of understanding which thoughts are what you are lead into oneness. What is Oneness? Nothing more than connecting self with one's higher source.

The messages and the step by step process the bearer of light within the cosmos has provided are beyond powerful. It truly is amazing to see how Oneness forms through the power of thought:

 

Fertility Of Oneness

 

Immediately after the "Fertility Of Oneness" photo an Angel appears in the sky as if she has just been born. To sense the mystery of the angels is to touch the inner soul.

 

Angel/Cherub Photo

 

Immediately after the "Angel" photo everything in the sky gets contained into one dimensional portal. The photos from that night have become an inspiration to the healing art journal and each photo becomes more descriptive in detail and insight through their many other insightful messages.

 

Portal Photo

 

Immediately, after the "Portal" photo various other orbs and spirits appear in the sky as if they are attempting to show us how to move comforably through the portal itself.  

 

A Few Of The Messages Received On The Night Of 11-11-2011: 

 

-Awakening The Light Within,

  • The Introduction to the healing art journal.

-Finding Stillness In The Midst Of Chaos,

  • Finding stillness during quiet time is only the first step.
  • Stillness is necessary to allow your soul, your being, your essence to awaken. Its more than shutting out the sounds of busy streets, emptying the mind of all its worries. This you cannot deem to control for how can you if it has never awoken... you know not of the soul, only perhaps the labels, and the words man has taught you... proving to be one of the greatest distractions of all

-How To Discern Between Inner Thoughts And Outer Distractions,

  • The choices we make are what make each one of us different. In order to understand distractions and the power of influence we must first learn the importance of and power of self and with this understanding we learn the power of choice. 
  • Remove self from the outer distractions to hear your deepest, most intimate thoughts.

-Creating Self Value And Worth From Within,

  • Oneness isn't about becoming one with the collective. Oneness is about becoming one with inner source.

-Transcend a Non Dualistic Mind-Set In A Dualistic World,

  • It's not you in this world, rather the world with in you. 

-Manifesting Inner Love,

  • Connecting with your inner source clears the path to the highest of all sources.

-How To Allow Your Soul To Lead The Way, 

  • It's not about a conscious awareness,
  • Conscious awareness distills a delayed reaction. Consciousness is only a source of one's humanness not one's soul.

-Why You Want To Void The Collective Consciousness Mind Set.

-And Many More.

 

 
Find out more about this remarkable night on 11-11-2011:

http://www.blogtalkradio.com/robynearrow/2012/10/31/the-heroines-journey-with-robyne-arrow
