Who is Robyne Arrow? To learn about her incredible life story click the links below:

Website: http://www.robynearrow.com/who-is-robyne.html

Website: http://www.robynearrow.com/photos.html

 

To learn what Robyne Arrow is doing now check the link below:

Website: http://www.robynearrow.com

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/robyne.arrow

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/spiritoftheangels

Blog Talk Radio: http://www.blogtalkradio.com/robynearrow 

 

A Little Bit More About The Project:

Since realizing the artistic healing and inner awakening potential these messages have provided on the night of 11/11/11, Robyne has poured her heart and soul into authoring the journal chapters, which are now complete. She has also reached out to the artistic community to pave the way for exceptional works of art supporting the messages from the angel experience. This outreach has taken a life of its own and now she is working with various artists around the world to bring the photos and their messages to life.

 

Here is one of the original photos taken on 11-11-2011:

 

and here you see how the photo is brought to life in full living expression and color as represented in the following final production;

 

 

Here they are both side to side, so you may see how the Angel is being brought to life first hand.

 

As you can see this is a very unique and inspiring project.  

Receiving these messages on the night of 11-11-2011 at exactly 11 PM is a miracle all on its own. Bringing these messages to life will be an even greater miracle. Robyne cannot do this type of project on her own. The Angel Experience is a big project. There are three steps that must be completed before the project can go to production.

The first step, Robyne has completed which entails authoring the messages for each of the eleven chapters that make up the Healing Art Journal. 

The second step is where Robyne needs your support. Your contribution will help Robyne hire various talented and beloved artists to reproduce eleven of the original raw photos into 11 inches by 14 inches healing paintings using various paint, pen and pencil as shown in the above photo. Whatever you choose to contribute Robyne can assure you your support will be worth every cent.

The third step entails creating up to 120 doodle art illustrations providing an inspiring environment to journal one's intimate thoughts along with illustrations to color in with various forms of paints, water color, pencil or ink to express through another outlet.  This is what makes up the Healing Art Journal. 

In the end, every page is a surprise, every page brings light onto your journey of self discovery. 

 

Robyne's Funding Goals:

Goal 1: $2750.00 

  • 11-paintings sized 11" by 14" 

 

Goal 2: $7180.00

  • 121-doodle art illustrations sized 11" by 14" 
  • 9% of funds go to the campaign fees

 

Reason For More Than One Funding Goal:

Anything raised above our first goal will help us to complete the 121 pieces of doodle art illustration. The bigger the budget, the more impressive the art journal will be. Like many projects on Indiegogo, Robyne is not here to get rich, but to have an opportunity to create and share beautiful, inspiring artwork for the Healing Art Journal combined with unique, one of a kind messages taken from the night of 11-11-2011. 

To lose out on creating this unique, one of a kind healing art journal would be a major loss to those who are looking for an avenue that will guide them to the answers they seek. The best part is this is not a man-made production rather a unique, one of a kind,  celestial gift.

Of course we have big dreams and goals! This project is not only about creating the artwork for the "Angel Experience" - Healing Arts Journal, but is also about inspiring and uplifting others while sharing Robyne’s story and experience with those who desire a greater sense of inner awareness. This is an incredibly uplifting and exciting project for all involved.

Your support will help us create all the art work necessary to complete the "Angel Experience" a healing art journal table top book containing eleven major photos including 121 pages of unique, and rare, art doodle illustrations. 

Any additional funds collected from this campaign will go towards creating eleven, 22" X 24" canvas paintings taken from the main themed 11" X 14" paintings for the "Angel Experience" healing art journal. These canvas paintings will then allow Robyne to do an eleven city tour where she will share the Angel Experience messages through art exhibits beginning National Angels Day in August 2013.

We really hope you can help contribute towards making this healing art journal available worldwide to individuals who value the importance of allowing their soul to lead the way. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you believe in the power of inner strength and feel like with today's times these messages are important more than at any other time please share the Angel Experience campaign link and any of the websites provided. Tweet about the Angel Experience, post on your facebook pages or your personal blogs or share any of the video's of this campaign on youtube and Vimeo. Even printing out flyers is an awesome way of getting the word out and if you know any journalist or media contacts please don't hesitate to share Robyne's goals, experiences and background with them. Robyne loves to talk about these phenomenal experiences and want to share the Angel Experience with the world. 

The Angel Experience is a phenomenal experience for all who desire a stronger inner self and who desire to embrace that which is within. In a world full of distractions, often times getting in touch with self is a very hard thing to do thus all the more reason to share the Angel Experience with self and everyone you know.
story_txt:
What Is The "Angel Experience" -Healing Art Journal?
The, "Angel Experience" – Healing Art Journal takes you on a self guided journey along a spiritual path forged from messages provided by the cosmos on the night of 11-11-2011. Each of the messages provided in this beautiful journal unfolding each pf the steps showing you the steps to break through the barriers that stand in the way as you learn to reshape and redefine your true values and goals so you may meet for the first time... YOU.  
Sure we can question receiving messages from the cosmic universe, nevertheless the messages are here. There are no coincidences the clarity of these messages have come at this point in time. As you can see through Robyne's background and her ability to overcome the odds you know she value's inner strength and awareness unlike anything else. Her truth has allowed her to overcome the impossible not just once rather numerous times. You can be assured the Angel Experience is of great significance to the whole.
The "Angel Experience" in its physical form is a coffee tabletop art book and journal featuring the works of eleven, very talented artists who are working with Robyne to bring alive eleven main art (11" by 14") paintings from the photo's taken on the night of 11-11-2011. Additionally, there are other talented doodle-art artists and illustrators who will complete the 121 (11" by 14") doodle art illustrations. These illustrations support the eleven main art paintings allowing the journalers to work right along side the messages captured on the night of 11-11-2011.
The "Angel Experience" Healing Art Journal has great appeal for those who desire nothing more than to embrace their inner knowing and want their soul to lead the way.
 
Who Is Robyne Arrow?
Sometimes the story finds the storyteller. In the case of the "Angel Experience" the story teller is Robyne Arrow.
On 11/11/11, while walking her dogs at night, Robyne was moved to capture photos of the night sky. When Robyne finally reviewed the photos weeks after they were taken, she realized her camera had captured something magical – see a few for yourself! 
The first few photos into the series of photos on the night of 11-11-2011 portrays the importance of finding stillness in the midst of chaos. The photos then show the power of how various thoughts can either expand your inner soul to awaken or contract you back to your old ways. With the acknowledgement of understanding which thoughts are what you are lead into oneness. What is Oneness? Nothing more than connecting self with one's higher source.
The messages and the step by step process the bearer of light within the cosmos has provided are beyond powerful. It truly is amazing to see how Oneness forms through the power of thought:
 

Fertility Of Oneness
 
Immediately after the "Fertility Of Oneness" photo an Angel appears in the sky as if she has just been born. To sense the mystery of the angels is to touch the inner soul.
 

Angel/Cherub Photo
 
Immediately after the "Angel" photo everything in the sky gets contained into one dimensional portal. The photos from that night have become an inspiration to the healing art journal and each photo becomes more descriptive in detail and insight through their many other insightful messages.
 

Portal Photo
 
Immediately, after the "Portal" photo various other orbs and spirits appear in the sky as if they are attempting to show us how to move comforably through the portal itself.  
 
A Few Of The Messages Received On The Night Of 11-11-2011: 
 
-Awakening The Light Within,

The Introduction to the healing art journal.

-Finding Stillness In The Midst Of Chaos,

Finding stillness during quiet time is only the first step.
Stillness is necessary to allow your soul, your being, your essence to awaken. Its more than shutting out the sounds of busy streets, emptying the mind of all its worries. This you cannot deem to control for how can you if it has never awoken... you know not of the soul, only perhaps the labels, and the words man has taught you... proving to be one of the greatest distractions of all

-How To Discern Between Inner Thoughts And Outer Distractions,

The choices we make are what make each one of us different. In order to understand distractions and the power of influence we must first learn the importance of and power of self and with this understanding we learn the power of choice. 
Remove self from the outer distractions to hear your deepest, most intimate thoughts.

-Creating Self Value And Worth From Within,

Oneness isn't about becoming one with the collective. Oneness is about becoming one with inner source.

-Transcend a Non Dualistic Mind-Set In A Dualistic World,

It's not you in this world, rather the world with in you. 

-Manifesting Inner Love,

Connecting with your inner source clears the path to the highest of all sources.

-How To Allow Your Soul To Lead The Way, 

It's not about a conscious awareness,
Conscious awareness distills a delayed reaction. Consciousness is only a source of one's humanness not one's soul.

-Why You Want To Void The Collective Consciousness Mind Set.
-And Many More.
 
 

Find out more about this remarkable night on 11-11-2011:

story:
Version française au bas

 

AN INNOVATIVE RESEARCH AND CREATION PROJECT IN DIGITAL ARTS

 

Who are we ? The most amazing team !

This project emerged from the encounter of brilliant established creators and dynamic emerging artists. Internationally acclaimed new media artists Isabelle Choinière and Ricardo Dal Farra, with scenographer and lighting designer Audrey-Anne Bouchard gathered an amazing team of collaborators together for this project’s realization. The great combination of knowledgeable and experienced new media artists with wildly creative and innovative younger spirits brings an incredible richness to our creative process.

To this day, over thirty people (artists, producers, promoters, researchers, programmers) are involved in this great project. Everyone is extremely competent and deeply committed to the research. Coming from media arts, dance, visual arts, electro acoustics, our team finds its strength in its multidisciplinarity. In a collective dynamic, we each bring our own expertise and sensitivity to the emergence of a unique artistic form.

**Watch the video for the project's complete credits

 

The artistic project : an immersive Collective Body

We believe that technologies, when integrated in a performative context, hold the potential to go beyond the spectacular and lead to deeper research. Therefore, in this research project, we are asking ourselves: how can technologies alter or even enrich the performer and the spectator’s sensorial experience ?

We are currently exploring this idea in the creation of a dance and digital arts performance/installation entitled Collective Body. On stage, five female dancers, bodies intertwined, form a human sculpture in constant movement, a Collective Body. Bodies and breaths tangle, the dancers are simultaneously five bodies and one same mass. Before the spectator’s eye, our sound composer will be managing the live mediatisation of the dancers’ vocal expressions into digital sound. Those sounds will then be transformed and spatialized in real time around the spectators, integrating them in the sound installation, in the Collective Body itself.

This means that, as a spectator of our piece, you are sitting, not in front of the show, but in the performance. You become part of the installation itself. Not only can you see, from very close, the five performers moving in a unique and original way, but you can also hear their voices and feel them traveling all around you. We want this performance to be a surprising multisensorial experience for you, one that is perceptible by much more than only sight.

Art is about taking risks

Our goal is to use sound spatialization to blur your sense of space. We wish to invite you to share with us the risk of losing our stage conventions and sensory reference points, to reinvent together our common experience of this encounter that is performance.

Intimacy at the digital era

In the evanescence of this digital world, we sometimes lose the physical contact with the other. In our creation, we want to stage the presence of flesh, the human mass in its material and interconnected dimension. In the performance, the dancers are constantly touching each other, caring for each other. We believe that intimacy can be found in an environment inhabited by technology. The sound device that we are developing will be used not to transform the women’s voices into techno-like sounds, but rather to make their chant and breaths travel in space and envelop the spectator in this intimacy. We wish to state that “high tech” performance, beyond spectacular, can also be personal and touching.

 

The outcome

We have been chosen to open the international digital arts festival CYNETART in Germany !

This creation will be presented at the Festspielhaus Hellerau in November 2013 as the opening piece of the International Digital Arts Festival Cynetart, in Dresden, Germany. Along with the piece’s presentation, a two-day Forum will be held in the context of which various Universities (Paris 8, Université de Nice, Bologna University, Chichester University, UQAM and Concordia) will meet to exchange and write on the Collective Body’s creative research. This will be a great opportunity to connect with a range of artists and researchers on the challenges of creating art today.

 

Advancement in Performing Arts : why is it important to do research ?

Just like for any science, art needs to constantly adapt its language and form to answer the new challenges of its time and context. In this era of the digital, the face of communication is completely different. In order to reach today’s audience, art needs to integrate those new communication strategies in its language. Therefore, it is important to invest time and money to understand the new tools, adapt them for their use in the artistic context. It is also important to take a moment to wonder if the technology we are using really contributes to our artistic discourse.

In the Collective Body project, we are asking ourselves those questions. We are also developing our own spatialization device which will contribute to the advancement of technology’s position in the arts.

 

Why do We need your support ?

Collective Body is being created in Montreal with the collaboration of Hexagram Centre for Research-Creation in Media Arts, Longueuil Council for the Arts, Emploi Quebec and Coop de communication Chin Up. The performance will be completed in Dresden in the context of a creation residency. Over the course of this last residency, organized by the international digital arts festival Cynetart, the project’s team will emphasize and deepen technology’s integration and influence on the dancers’ performative behaviour.

We are thrilled to be supported by so many great structures. 

However, work involving digital technology is highly expensive. There is a great deal of equipment to be purchased and programming to be done. To complete our research, we need your support. With this campaign, we wish to fundraise more than 2000 $! Support our research and help art reinvent itself to better challenge each one of us!

Thank you

Collective Body’ s team

 ___

 

UN GRAND PROJET DE RECHERCHE ET DE CRÉATION EN ARTS NUMÉRIQUES

 

Qui sommes nous ? Une équipe extraordinaire !

Ce projet est né de la rencontre de brillants créateurs établis et de jeunes artistes dynamiques. Les artistes Isabelle Choinière et Ricardo Dal Farra, internationalement reconnus pour leurs œuvres en arts et technologies, ainsi qu’Audrey-Anne Bouchard, scénographe et conceptrice d’éclairages, ont rassemblé une équipe de collaborateurs tous plus extraordinaires les uns que les autres, afin de réaliser ce grand projet. La combinaison gagnante du savoir et de l’expérience d’artistes chevronnés avec la créativité débridée et l’esprit novateur de plus jeunes créateurs, enrichie énormément notre processus de création.

À ce jour, plus d’une trentaine de personnes (artistes, producteurs, chercheurs, programmeurs) sont impliqués dans ce grand projet. Tous sont extrêmement compétents et profondément engagés dans la recherche. Provenant de la danse, des arts médiatiques, des arts visuels et de l’électroacoustique, notre équipe trouve sa force dans sa multidisciplinarité. Dans une dynamique collective, chacun d’entre nous apporte sa propre expertise et sa sensibilité à l’émergence d’un langage artistique unique.

**Voir la vidéo pour les crédits complets du projet

 

Le projet artistique : Un Corps Collectif immersif

Nous croyons que les technologies numériques, lorsqu’elles sont intégrées à l’espace performatif, peuvent dépasser l’effet spectaculaire dans une recherche plus approfondie. Dans le cadre de notre projet de recherche, nous explorons la question suivante : comment les technologies peuvent-elles altérer, voire enrichir l’expérience sensorielle du performeur et du spectateur ?

Nous explorons actuellement cette idée à travers la création d’une performance/installation en arts numériques intitulée Corps Collectif. Sur scène, cinq performeuses aux corps entremêlés, forment une sculpture humaine tridimensionnelle en mouvement constant : un Corps Collectif. Les corps et les souffles s’entrelacent, les performeuses sont à la fois cinq corps et une même masse. Sous les yeux des spectateurs, le compositeur sonore performe la médiatisation en direct des expressions vocales des performeuses en information audio numérique. Ces sons sont ensuite transformés puis spatialisés en temps-réel autour des spectateurs, intégrant ceux-ci à l’intérieur de l’installation sonore, à même le Corps Collectif.

Concrètement, cela implique que vous, spectateurs de notre création, prenez place, non pas en face de l’action, mais bien sur la scène, dans la performance. Vous faites partie de l’installation. Non seulement pouvez-vous observer de très près les cinq performeuses dessiner des mouvements originaux et uniques, mais vous pouvez également entendre leurs voix, les sentir voyager tout autour de vous. Nous voulons que cette performance soit une expérience multisensorielle surprenante pour vous, une expérience perceptible bien au-delà du seul sens de la vue.

L’art c’est prendre des risques

Notre objectif est d’utiliser la spatialisation sonore pour troubler vos repères dans l’espace. Nous vous invitons à prendre avec nous le risque de perdre nos conventions scéniques afin de réinventer ensemble notre expérience commune de cette rencontre dite performance.

L’intimité à l’ère du numérique

Dans l’évanescence du monde numérique, nous perdons parfois le contact physique avec l’autre. Dans notre création, nous voulons mettre en scène la présence de la chair, de la masse humaine dans sa dimension matérielle et interconnectée. Au cours de la performance, les danseuses se touchent constamment, prenant soin l’une de l’autre. Nous souhaitons donner sa place à l’intimité dans un environnement scénique habité par le numérique. Le dispositif sonore que nous développons nous servira non pas à transformer les voix des filles en sons techno-robotiques, mais plutôt à faire voyager leurs chants et leurs respirations pour envelopper le spectateur dans cette intimité. Nous voulons affirmer ainsi que les performances  “high tech”, au-delà du spectaculaire, peuvent également êtres personnelles et touchantes.

 

La grande première

Notre pièce a été sélectionnée comme pièce d’ouverture du festival international en arts numériques CYNETART, en Allemagne !

Notre création sera présentée au Festspielhaus Hellerau en novembre 2013 prochain, en tant que spectacle d’ouverture du festival international en arts numériques Cynetart, à Dresden, en Allemagne. Au cours du festival, des chercheurs de diverses institutions (Paris 8, Université de Nice, Université de Bologne, Université de Chichester, UQAM et Concordia), étudieront la démarche de création de Corps Collectif dans le cadre d’un colloque d’une durée de deux jours. Notre performance fera également l’ouverture du projet de recherche intereuropéen METABODY - Media Embodiment Tékhne And Bridges Of Diversity. Notre participation à cet événement nous permettra d’échanger avec des artistes et des chercheurs sur les enjeux et les défis de la création actuelle.

 

Le progrès en arts du spectacle : pourquoi la recherche est-elle importante ?

Comme toute science, l’art a constamment besoin d’adapter son langage et sa forme pour répondre aux nouveaux enjeux de son temps et du contexte dans lequel il est créé. Afin d’atteindre le public d’aujourd’hui, l’art doit intégrer les stratégies de communication numérique actuelles dans son langage. Il est donc important d’investir du temps et des sous dans la compréhension de ces nouveaux outils, de les adapter afin qu’ils puissent êtres utilisés dans le contexte artistique. Il est également primordial de prendre un moment pour se questionner sur la pertinence réelle de l’outil technologique dans la création et à savoir comment cette technologie peut contribuer à l’expression du discours artistique, voire l’enrichir.

Dans le projet Corps Collectif, nous nous posons ces questions. Nous développons également notre propre dispositif de spatialisation sonore qui nous permettra de contribuer au progrès de l’utilisation et de l’intégration des technologies dans le domaine des arts.

 

Pourquoi avons-nous besoin de votre soutien ?

Corps Collectif est créé à Montréal avec la collaboration d’ Hexagram - Centre de recherche et de création en arts médiatiques, du Conseil des arts de Longueuil, d’Emploi-Québec et de la Coop de communication Chin Up. La dernière phase de création de la performance aura lieu à Dresden dans le cadre d'une résidnence de création. Au cours de cette résidence, organisée par le festival international en arts numériques Cynetart, l'équipe du projet approfondira l'intégration de la technologie et son influence sur le comportement performatif et l'expérience des performeuses. 

Nous sommes enchantés d'être supportés par autant de structures intéressantes. 

Puisque le travail impliquant les technologies numériques est très coûteux, nous avons besoin de ressources supplémentaires pour réaliser notre projet. Non seulement l’équipement essentiel est-il dispendieux, mais un travail de programmation considérable doit également être fait par des spécialistes afin d’adapter les outils aux besoins artistiques de la création. Pour poursuivre notre recherche, nous avons besoin de votre soutien. Avec cette campagne de financement, nous souhaitons amasser plus de 2000$! Soutenez notre recherche et aidez l’art à se réinventer pour continuer de soulever des questions pertinentes et d’actualité.

Merci

L’équipe de Corps Collectif

The great combination of knowledgeable and experienced new media artists with wildly creative and innovative younger spirits brings an incredible richness to our creative process.
To this day, over thirty people (artists, producers, promoters, researchers, programmers) are involved in this great project. Everyone is extremely competent and deeply committed to the research. Coming from media arts, dance, visual arts, electro acoustics, our team finds its strength in its multidisciplinarity. In a collective dynamic, we each bring our own expertise and sensitivity to the emergence of a unique artistic form.
**Watch the video for the project's complete credits
 
The artistic project : an immersive Collective Body
We believe that technologies, when integrated in a performative context, hold the potential to go beyond the spectacular and lead to deeper research. Therefore, in this research project, we are asking ourselves: how can technologies alter or even enrich the performer and the spectator’s sensorial experience ?
We are currently exploring this idea in the creation of a dance and digital arts performance/installation entitled Collective Body. On stage, five female dancers, bodies intertwined, form a human sculpture in constant movement, a Collective Body. Bodies and breaths tangle, the dancers are simultaneously five bodies and one same mass. Before the spectator’s eye, our sound composer will be managing the live mediatisation of the dancers’ vocal expressions into digital sound. Those sounds will then be transformed and spatialized in real time around the spectators, integrating them in the sound installation, in the Collective Body itself.
This means that, as a spectator of our piece, you are sitting, not in front of the show, but in the performance. You become part of the installation itself. Not only can you see, from very close, the five performers moving in a unique and original way, but you can also hear their voices and feel them traveling all around you. We want this performance to be a surprising multisensorial experience for you, one that is perceptible by much more than only sight.
Art is about taking risks
Our goal is to use sound spatialization to blur your sense of space. We wish to invite you to share with us the risk of losing our stage conventions and sensory reference points, to reinvent together our common experience of this encounter that is performance.
Intimacy at the digital era
In the evanescence of this digital world, we sometimes lose the physical contact with the other. In our creation, we want to stage the presence of flesh, the human mass in its material and interconnected dimension. In the performance, the dancers are constantly touching each other, caring for each other. We believe that intimacy can be found in an environment inhabited by technology. The sound device that we are developing will be used not to transform the women’s voices into techno-like sounds, but rather to make their chant and breaths travel in space and envelop the spectator in this intimacy. We wish to state that “high tech” performance, beyond spectacular, can also be personal and touching.
 
The outcome
We have been chosen to open the international digital arts festival CYNETART in Germany !
This creation will be presented at the Festspielhaus Hellerau in November 2013 as the opening piece of the International Digital Arts Festival Cynetart, in Dresden, Germany. Along with the piece’s presentation, a two-day Forum will be held in the context of which various Universities (Paris 8, Université de Nice, Bologna University, Chichester University, UQAM and Concordia) will meet to exchange and write on the Collective Body’s creative research. This will be a great opportunity to connect with a range of artists and researchers on the challenges of creating art today.
 
Advancement in Performing Arts : why is it important to do research ?
Just like for any science, art needs to constantly adapt its language and form to answer the new challenges of its time and context. In this era of the digital, the face of communication is completely different. In order to reach today’s audience, art needs to integrate those new communication strategies in its language. Therefore, it is important to invest time and money to understand the new tools, adapt them for their use in the artistic context. It is also important to take a moment to wonder if the technology we are using really contributes to our artistic discourse.
In the Collective Body project, we are asking ourselves those questions. We are also developing our own spatialization device which will contribute to the advancement of technology’s position in the arts. 
 
Why do We need your support ?
Collective Body is being created in Montreal with the collaboration of Hexagram Centre for Research-Creation in Media Arts, Longueuil Council for the Arts, Emploi Quebec and Coop de communication Chin Up. The performance will be completed in Dresden in the context of a creation residency. Over the course of this last residency, organized by the international digital arts festival Cynetart, the project’s team will emphasize and deepen technology’s integration and influence on the dancers’ performative behaviour.
We are thrilled to be supported by so many great structures. 
However, work involving digital technology is highly expensive. There is a great deal of equipment to be purchased and programming to be done. To complete our research, we need your support. With this campaign, we wish to fundraise more than 2000 $! Support our research and help art reinvent itself to better challenge each one of us!
Thank you
Collective Body’ s team
 ___
 
UN GRAND PROJET DE RECHERCHE ET DE CRÉATION EN ARTS NUMÉRIQUES
 
Qui sommes nous ? Une équipe extraordinaire !
Ce projet est né de la rencontre de brillants créateurs établis et de jeunes artistes dynamiques. Les artistes Isabelle Choinière et Ricardo Dal Farra, internationalement reconnus pour leurs œuvres en arts et technologies, ainsi qu’Audrey-Anne Bouchard, scénographe et conceptrice d’éclairages, ont rassemblé une équipe de collaborateurs tous plus extraordinaires les uns que les autres, afin de réaliser ce grand projet. La combinaison gagnante du savoir et de l’expérience d’artistes chevronnés avec la créativité débridée et l’esprit novateur de plus jeunes créateurs, enrichie énormément notre processus de création.
À ce jour, plus d’une trentaine de personnes (artistes, producteurs, chercheurs, programmeurs) sont impliqués dans ce grand projet. Tous sont extrêmement compétents et profondément engagés dans la recherche. Provenant de la danse, des arts médiatiques, des arts visuels et de l’électroacoustique, notre équipe trouve sa force dans sa multidisciplinarité. Dans une dynamique collective, chacun d’entre nous apporte sa propre expertise et sa sensibilité à l’émergence d’un langage artistique unique.
**Voir la vidéo pour les crédits complets du projet
 
Le projet artistique : Un Corps Collectif immersif
Nous croyons que les technologies numériques, lorsqu’elles sont intégrées à l’espace performatif, peuvent dépasser l’effet spectaculaire dans une recherche plus approfondie. Dans le cadre de notre projet de recherche, nous explorons la question suivante : comment les technologies peuvent-elles altérer, voire enrichir l’expérience sensorielle du performeur et du spectateur ?
Nous explorons actuellement cette idée à travers la création d’une performance/installation en arts numériques intitulée Corps Collectif. Sur scène, cinq performeuses aux corps entremêlés, forment une sculpture humaine tridimensionnelle en mouvement constant : un Corps Collectif. Les corps et les souffles s’entrelacent, les performeuses sont à la fois cinq corps et une même masse. Sous les yeux des spectateurs, le compositeur sonore performe la médiatisation en direct des expressions vocales des performeuses en information audio numérique. Ces sons sont ensuite transformés puis spatialisés en temps-réel autour des spectateurs, intégrant ceux-ci à l’intérieur de l’installation sonore, à même le Corps Collectif.
Concrètement, cela implique que vous, spectateurs de notre création, prenez place, non pas en face de l’action, mais bien sur la scène, dans la performance. Vous faites partie de l’installation. Non seulement pouvez-vous observer de très près les cinq performeuses dessiner des mouvements originaux et uniques, mais vous pouvez également entendre leurs voix, les sentir voyager tout autour de vous. Nous voulons que cette performance soit une expérience multisensorielle surprenante pour vous, une expérience perceptible bien au-delà du seul sens de la vue.
L’art c’est prendre des risques
Notre objectif est d’utiliser la spatialisation sonore pour troubler vos repères dans l’espace. Nous vous invitons à prendre avec nous le risque de perdre nos conventions scéniques afin de réinventer ensemble notre expérience commune de cette rencontre dite performance.
L’intimité à l’ère du numérique
Dans l’évanescence du monde numérique, nous perdons parfois le contact physique avec l’autre. Dans notre création, nous voulons mettre en scène la présence de la chair, de la masse humaine dans sa dimension matérielle et interconnectée. Au cours de la performance, les danseuses se touchent constamment, prenant soin l’une de l’autre. Nous souhaitons donner sa place à l’intimité dans un environnement scénique habité par le numérique. Le dispositif sonore que nous développons nous servira non pas à transformer les voix des filles en sons techno-robotiques, mais plutôt à faire voyager leurs chants et leurs respirations pour envelopper le spectateur dans cette intimité. Nous voulons affirmer ainsi que les performances  “high tech”, au-delà du spectaculaire, peuvent également êtres personnelles et touchantes.
 
La grande première
Notre pièce a été sélectionnée comme pièce d’ouverture du festival international en arts numériques CYNETART, en Allemagne !
Notre création sera présentée au Festspielhaus Hellerau en novembre 2013 prochain, en tant que spectacle d’ouverture du festival international en arts numériques Cynetart, à Dresden, en Allemagne. Au cours du festival, des chercheurs de diverses institutions (Paris 8, Université de Nice, Université de Bologne, Université de Chichester, UQAM et Concordia), étudieront la démarche de création de Corps Collectif dans le cadre d’un colloque d’une durée de deux jours. Notre performance fera également l’ouverture du projet de recherche intereuropéen METABODY - Media Embodiment Tékhne And Bridges Of Diversity. Notre participation à cet événement nous permettra d’échanger avec des artistes et des chercheurs sur les enjeux et les défis de la création actuelle.
 
Le progrès en arts du spectacle : pourquoi la recherche est-elle importante ?
Comme toute science, l’art a constamment besoin d’adapter son langage et sa forme pour répondre aux nouveaux enjeux de son temps et du contexte dans lequel il est créé. Afin d’atteindre le public d’aujourd’hui, l’art doit intégrer les stratégies de communication numérique actuelles dans son langage. Il est donc important d’investir du temps et des sous dans la compréhension de ces nouveaux outils, de les adapter afin qu’ils puissent êtres utilisés dans le contexte artistique. Il est également primordial de prendre un moment pour se questionner sur la pertinence réelle de l’outil technologique dans la création et à savoir comment cette technologie peut contribuer à l’expression du discours artistique, voire l’enrichir.
Dans le projet Corps Collectif, nous nous posons ces questions. Nous développons également notre propre dispositif de spatialisation sonore qui nous permettra de contribuer au progrès de l’utilisation et de l’intégration des technologies dans le domaine des arts. 
 
Pourquoi avons-nous besoin de votre soutien ?
Corps Collectif est créé à Montréal avec la collaboration d’ Hexagram - Centre de recherche et de création en arts médiatiques, du Conseil des arts de Longueuil, d’Emploi-Québec et de la Coop de communication Chin Up. La dernière phase de création de la performance aura lieu à Dresden dans le cadre d'une résidnence de création. Au cours de cette résidence, organisée par le festival international en arts numériques Cynetart, l'équipe du projet approfondira l'intégration de la technologie et son influence sur le comportement performatif et l'expérience des performeuses. 
Nous sommes enchantés d'être supportés par autant de structures intéressantes. 
Puisque le travail impliquant les technologies numériques est très coûteux, nous avons besoin de ressources supplémentaires pour réaliser notre projet. Non seulement l’équipement essentiel est-il dispendieux, mais un travail de programmation considérable doit également être fait par des spécialistes afin d’adapter les outils aux besoins artistiques de la création. Pour poursuivre notre recherche, nous avons besoin de votre soutien. Avec cette campagne de financement, nous souhaitons amasser plus de 2000$! Soutenez notre recherche et aidez l’art à se réinventer pour continuer de soulever des questions pertinentes et d’actualité.
Merci
L’équipe de Corps Collectif

story:
Project Summary

This campaign will fund the creation of an art book of ‘Discoveries: Montreal’ by Denise Buisman Pilger. Discoveries: Montreal is a visual arts project that I have been working on for the past two years, it features all the boroughs on the island of Montreal. The book will have a total of 96 pages, showcasing all the pieces in the series as well as detailed information about the artist and the creation of the project. Contribute to this amazing book now! Help Denise raise funds and claim your reward on the right hand side!

 

Artist Bio

Although based in Montreal, visual artist Denise Buisman Pilger is a frequent globe-trotter, gathering inspiration for her urban photo-collages along the way.  Exhibiting and selling her work prolifically in North America and Europe over the past several years, one of the highlights was a trip to Paris to participate in the ‘2011 Salon de la Société Nationale des Beaux-Art’ at the Carrousel du Louvre.

Her creative practice spans more than a decade, beginning with several years as a professional graphic designer and art director for print media, both in Europe and North America.  This sensibility is reflected in her current body of work both aesthetically and technically.  From her home-based studio, she produces city-scapes that are graphic, contemporary and yet, nostalgic. 

Originally from the Netherlands, Denise has a Bachelor of Arts in Illustration from Willem de Kooning Academy of Arts in Rotterdam, and continues to pursue creative professional development to stay on top of new techniques and materials.  She occasionally offers artist talks and technique classes in her community. 

 

Artist Statement

Denise’s work reflects her love of photography, painting and travel configured into graphic pseudo-realities of everyday life filtered through her own whimsical creative lens. Her tableaux are bustling, surreal pastiches of -architectural elements and city life, arranged at unusual angles, irregular scale and not necessarily in their true-to-life configuration. 

Her creative process involves digital photo manipulation, image transfer, acrylic photo collage, acrylic paints/-mediums, and other innovative techniques.  Working in a variety of scale, Denise creates panels that are graphic, contemporary and yet somehow nostalgic.  Often her pieces are black and white with minimalist colour accents, while others abound with colour - her visual vocabulary always unique and always authentic.

In her most recent series – Discoveries: Montreal - Denise explores each of the island city’s 34 boroughs.  Venturing out (camera in hand) she has captured the iconic and quirky details that make every borough unique, turning each into a one-of-a-kind mixed media panel.  The series offers a rare insight into the distinct flavors of all the ‘little villages’ that make up the island’s rich landscape.

Merging many photographs into a singular image, Denise’s unique impressions of the city capture the urban landscape through the eyes of a new resident, highlighting the often mundane, yet essential elements that make up the living, breathing and evolving ecosystem of the city she has called home since 2009.

 

About the book

Discoveries: Montreal is a 'series' and although all the pieces can be enjoyed on their own, they are more powerful as a whole. With original artwork being quite expensive, the individual pieces will probably be sold off separately after the initial showing. This art book will be a way to keep the series together and it will make it possible for people to enjoy the entire series at home for years to come.

This 96page book will be perfect bound with minimalist graphic design, featuring only one piece on each spread so each piece gets full attention. The book will also contain information about the artist and the project and some insights in the creation process. This book will look great on your bookshelf or on you coffee table and will make a great conversation starter.

I am currently working on the final pieces, the series is expected to be finished by the end of June 2013. The text for the book is in the editing phase and the graphic design has been started as well. The book will be in both French and in English, just like the city the project is based on. The publishing date for the book depends on the time needed for photography, translation, proof reading and printing, but it has tentatively been set for early September 2013. Keep an eye on the updates for information on the creation of the book and the final pieces of the series. 

 

Where will your money go?

This is a fixed campaign so you will only be charged if the campaign succeeds. The funds raised will be used to cover the costs of producing the book. It will pay for things like photographing the artwork, proofreading, editing, translation and printing of the book.

 

When can expect your perks?

Because this is a fixed campaign perk will not be shipped out until the end of the campaign. 

• The online credits will go live in the first week after the campaign has been finished. 

• The personalized art cards will be shipped in the first two weeks after the campaign has been finished.

• For the Giclee prints backers wil receive an email with on overview of all the boroughs in the first week after the campaign has been finished. Prints will be ordered as soon as all choices have been received, shipping will depend on the delivery time from the printer.

• The digital and physical copies of the book will be shipped as soon as they are finished. Copies for the supporters of this campaign wil be the first to be shipped. 

• Perks that include multiple items will be shipped as one package, delivery depends on contents.

You will be notified by email when your perk has been shipped.

 

Shipping

Unfortunately shipping is expensive these days. All perks that require shipping will have shipping and handling fees listed in the description. To make sure that the money raised goes towards the production of the book and not to Canada Post I ask that you please add the appropriate shipping and handling fees to the price of you perk of choice, I will not be able to ship out your perk until shipping and handling has been paid. Please note that all perks will be shipped from Canada through Canada Post.

 

Other ways you can help

Can't give today? No worries! There are plenty of other ways to help me achieve this goal. Please share this project with all of your friends, family members and acquaintances both on and off-line. Use Facebook and Twitter (or any other social media site), blog about it, talk about it with your colleagues or your hairdresser, tell as many people as you can! I truly appreciate all the help I can get!

 

Thank you!

I am sincerely grateful for all of your help. Keeping this series together by creating this book is very important to me and I will not be able to do this without your help!

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or concerns you can email me: info@denisebuismanpilger.com or contact me on my Facebook Page, Facebook Profile, Google+ or on Twitter! Contribute to this amazing book now! Help Denise raise funds and claim your reward on the right hand side!

Can't give today? No worries! There are plenty of other ways to help me achieve this goal. Please share this project with all of your friends, family members and acquaintances both on and off-line. story:
My name is Ashley Harris, and last year I represented the Chapel Hill team called the Sacrifical Poets at BNV, an international youth spoken word competition. I was chosen out of 12 youth to be on that six person team to voice the opinions of many in the Chapel Hill area. I wondered then why I was chosen. For 18 years of my life, I have been told to keep quiet. For 18 years of my life, I was told to cry, as long as no one heard me. I have been through many trials in my life, and through all of them had to keep them inside. When I finally wrote my feelings on paper and voiced them, I felt free. I felt like people were informed more about the issues I had but more importantly, I found that I was not alone. I found that I stirred concern in my stories, and that my stories brought me a sense of community. I believe the arts accomplish this feeling. I have been to numerous workshops, such as hip hop, rapping, dancing, and spoken word workshops that had programs to bring this sense of community. They kept children off the streets and they lessened violence in the areas they were held. It seemed in these workshops that despite ones denomination, sex, and race, they were able, through the focused art, to find common ground with one another. But unfortunately, Ive watched this institutions burn into the ground, become evicted and forgotten by the rest of the area. For example, there was a hip hop group from the Bronx that came to Charolette and told us about their after school program.

It sounded too good to be true, a haven where kids could do their work and invest in art that could possess a powerful, changing message. I believed in them whole heartedly, only to find out that they were convicted for a small fire hazard violation that was barely even visible. Then I came to realize this is happening everywhere, art programs are being shut down, and people could care less. Along with schools getting less funding, the first stab they see is the arts: they are quick to annilhate it. But they fail to realize the power of art, and how peaceful it can be. When a person goes on stage, when a child finger paints, when a singer sings, there is a common ground on that evoked emotion. There might be anger in that poet or artists voice, but in the audience there are hundreds of kids and adults who felt the same way and thought no one was listening. And those who didnt understand, finally do. That is the power of art no history, math, or science text book could ever achieve. When you read Issac Newton's laws, do you feel overwhelmed with emotion, that youve reached a revelation, that you no longer have to run away? That everything makes sense, and anger is futile, to forgive? Probably not. But with art, you do feel that. Art can cure an addict from addiction, art can help a runaway find his place, art can cure the sick.

 

This all sounds overly worded, but its true. Art saved me, a child from the lowest ends of the poverty line. A child who was bathed in verbal abuse. A child who was told at a young age they would be nothing. Art helped me realize I was not the only one, and there is a way we can help change the negative mentality this country gives the poor. There are people like me out there who feel worthless, like no one can or wants to hear them. But the exception is that I have my art, and I have this voice. There are many kids out there who have a voice that cannot be heard because there are no arts they can express themselves through. Me and three other women wish to restore this voice in areas where it has been degraded and devalued. I wish to go to Boston with these other talented artists and document the National Poetry Competition. As a member of The Rejects at UNC Chapel Hill, and a lifetime member of the Sacrificial poets, I believe it is crucial for me to bring art back. After it has touched my life, abandoning it would be the highest of treason. So please, help me and these young women as we try to reach out, and share the art of poets from all over the country.

Along with schools getting less funding, the first stab they see is the arts: they are quick to annilhate it. But they fail to realize the power of art, and how peaceful it can be. When a person goes on stage, when a child finger paints, when a singer sings, there is a common ground on that evoked emotion. There might be anger in that poet or artists voice, but in the audience there are hundreds of kids and adults who felt the same way and thought no one was listening. And those who didnt understand, finally do. That is the power of art no history, math, or science text book could ever achieve. When you read Issac Newton's laws, do you feel overwhelmed with emotion, that youve reached a revelation, that you no longer have to run away? That everything makes sense, and anger is futile, to forgive? Probably not. But with art, you do feel that. Art can cure an addict from addiction, art can help a runaway find his place, art can cure the sick.
 
This all sounds overly worded, but its true. Art saved me, a child from the lowest ends of the poverty line. A child who was bathed in verbal abuse. A child who was told at a young age they would be nothing. Art helped me realize I was not the only one, and there is a way we can help change the negative mentality this country gives the poor. There are people like me out there who feel worthless, like no one can or wants to hear them. But the exception is that I have my art, and I have this voice. There are many kids out there who have a voice that cannot be heard because there are no arts they can express themselves through. Me and three other women wish to restore this voice in areas where it has been degraded and devalued. I wish to go to Boston with these other talented artists and document the National Poetry Competition. As a member of The Rejects at UNC Chapel Hill, and a lifetime member of the Sacrificial poets, I believe it is crucial for me to bring art back. After it has touched my life, abandoning it would be the highest of treason. So please, help me and these young women as we try to reach out, and share the art of poets from all over the country.

story:
Visionary Art Exhibit within Sacred Spaces

Visionary Art on exhibit amid dust, flames, meditation, music and ritual all representing more than 40 Artists joined transglobally in creative purpose within Sacred Spaces Village.  

  • Sacred Spaces is a Village on 9:30 and Esplanade at the Burning Man Festival
  • We are honored to exhibit artworks of more than 40 Renowned Visionary Artists from around the globe.  
  • We need your help to cover material costs of printing these Visioary pieces


This body of community art will infuse Sacred Spaces Village as a visually stunning and inspiring mural, the facade of our Temple space, through to the interiour exhibit and gallery spaces. We need your contributions to actualize this amazing visual gift.

Support Artists in Printing and Creating Inner and Outer Exhibits of Visionary Art 

For what you give, recieve visionary art in return - stickerts, prints, holograms, zip-up Cosmos Bags and large one of a kind top-shelf canvas prints - support the creation of amazing Visionary ART space within your world and as part of Sacred Spaces Village.

Break it down:

  • $5,100 - Printing costs for 40 individual large, full-colored, top-shelf linen Art pieces  (displayed within Sacred Spaces)
  • $1,200 - Lighting, water / dust proof, secured against the wind 
  • $  700 - Hardware and fittings to hang 40 large pieces, securely within high winds and high dust conditions.
  • $2,700 of our campaign is dedicated to coving the material and resource costs of the massive 40 foot outer wall mural by the CoLab this includes a specific ink and die needed to paint on cloth in playa conditions, fuel for transport of this pieces to Black Rock City, as well as the hardware required to secure cloth on which the mural is printed.
  • $770 of the $11,000 is paid in fees to IndieGoGo.  
  • The remaining $530 plus additional out-of-pocket goes towards 'perks' fulfillment, our thank you gifts to you! 

Reaching the full funding goal of $11,000 Sacred Spaces Village will create, print and exhibit visionary art from over 40 individual visionary Artists, 40 pieces on exhibit within Sacred Spaces and one giant mural on Sacred Spaces Outer wall created by the CoLab.  

Of course, this amount of fundraising also includes actualization of the 'perks' returned to you, thank you gifts - visionary art you can stick, display or exhibit as part of your space.  

From the Visionary mural visible as the outer wall of Sacred Spaces to the individual cloth pieces on exhibit within and throughout the Village - each dollar contributes to the whole body of this visionary exhibit being offered, on exhibit in a public space as part of Sacred Spaces Village at Burning Man in 2013.  Thank you! 

Other Ways You Can Take Part

Everyone supports Sacred Spaces Visionary Art Exhibit by sharing:

Get the word out, SHARE on email, text messages, twitter and other social network outlets.  Your recommendation for others to contribute to Sacred Spaces is very helpful. Thank you!

story:
No)one. Art House is an organization geared toward producing and curating approachable and stimulating art.  We seek to remove the barriers of codified aesthetics in specific art disciplines to inform and allow viewers to eclipse preconceived expectations of what art can be.  No)one. Art House consists of genre bending painters, photographers, fashion designers, choreographers and musicians, among others.  Patrons attending our productions will be introduced to a palette of multi-disciplinary creations designed to entertain and challenge our audience while remaining accessible.

With your generous donations we can pay all of the amazing artists involved with this show, pay for space to rehearse and create more art, pay venues to house our creations, and spend more of our time brainstorming and developing curriculums to spread our message through outreach programs.  

If you are unable to support us financially, any thing you can think of to contribute to our cause will help.  Be it volunteering at our shows, helping us work behind the scenes, promotion of any kind, or if you own space allowing us to utilize it in a capacity that would be fitting.

Thank you for taking your time out to read our message and we hope to see you at a No)one. Art House event!

story:
Let's take the High Point Mural Project to the next level. Creativity is the key to innovation. Through murals we can let the world know that we are a place that nurtures and encourages creativity.

Check out more of TheLostCause at: www.thelostcausepdx.com (only after you have spent sufficient time supporting this cause.. wink wink) Thank you.

Who am I?

My name is Ryan Saunders and I am a social entrepreneur born and raised in High Point and a resident of the Piedmont triad. I founded a company called Create Your City in November of 2012 as a way to spread the cool ideas that I found around the world and country  into my local community.

The mission of Create Your City is to lead by example through events, conversation and action for the purpose of furthering revitalization efforts within a city.

What is the project?

The goal is to use murals as a calling card and billboard for our cities creativity and willingness to support and nurture our creative class. High Point was built on creativity in the form of the ingenuity that created the International Furniture Market.  We want to bring in world renowned artist TheLostCause (www.thelostcausepdx.com) in an effort to truly put our project on the map and raise the bar for public art in our area. The mission is not to take an opportunity away from local artists but to increase the opportunities for them to challenge themselves and provide a platform for them to take steps toward spreading their art to people around the world.

The Impact

Why High Point?

High Point was built and has thrived for many years on furniture and although manufacturing in the United States has left many cities barren and desolate, the furniture industry actually has a chance of returning to the states in a big way. This involves the growth and development of small batch manufacturers whom are currently hand making work locally. Designers of all sorts and creatives alike can find a world's audience in High Point as well as the contacts necessary to move their career forward. We want these people here and we need them here but reputations state that High Point lacks the community and culture to attract and retain this talent.  We need to show the world that we can support a strong creative class and an example can be set in High Point that we are truly on the verge of a second industrial revolution and this time we will be more conscientious about our practices as the stakes get higher.

High Point Mural Project: Making a difference one can at a time

Didn't realize one mural could have such a profound affect? A mural is a billboard to an artist or designer that they will be accepted and find peers that they can collaborate with,learn from and be challenged by. Please support bringing TheLostCause to High Point so we can continue our journey towards a more creative and interesting community.


    What you need and what you get?

    Whale said when he comes to High Point in September, he wants to meet the locals and connect with artists while he paints murals that he hopes will have an impact.

    “Every city I have visited holds a high level of importance to their murals,” Whale said. “They are like landmarks and are talked about as such. If High Point had more murals, it would bring a buzz and level of excitement that is sustainable and profound.”-High Point Enterprise, http://www.hpe.com/news/x2058990595/Coloring-outside-the-lines

    Come on High Point let's bring TheLostCause to High Point as a further push towards realizing our goals for making High Point the creative hub it is destined to be.

    Just as murals are creative billboard it is also a representation of the artist's own creativity and message. As this mural will become a part of our community we want each of you to be part of it. Each of our prizes our designed to bring the community together, get to know the artist and celebrate the birth of the High Point Mural Project.

    Challenges: 

    This journey to expand the cultural and creative capacity within our city has been an uphill battle. There have been years of challenges which have held us back in one way or another but we will continue to make cracks in the wall and as was started a year ago with the living wall eventually the flood of creativity will burst through and this revitalization will start to truly take hold.

    Other ways you can help:

    Keep fighting the good fight. Talk to people. Take action. Educate Yourself. Let Your Voice be heard and empower others to share theirs.

story:
On September 22nd, 2012 we transformed a CTA train car into a mobile theatre, and a movie set, at the Art on Track festival. There, the Waltzing Mechanics performed their show EL Stories while The Cinema Culture documented the show and passengers watching. EL Stories: Art on Track was performed multiple times throughout the five-hour installation allowing audience members to be extras in the show and the movie.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

As with most not-for-profits what we need is money, and every little bit helps:

  • Cost of doing business is around $2000 a year. We don't like asking for your money, and in fact we haven't done a fundraiser since September of 2012.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we won't fall down – but your support will help us stand tall! 
  • If we reach our goal before the deadline, we'll release an advance trailer of "EL Stories: Art on Track" a documentary of our participation in the 2012 Art on Track festival.
  • Thank you to everyone who has supported us in the past!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • We also need volunteers. Mostly in the areas of grant writing, programmers (code), and what we really like most is creating new positions based on the interest of folks working with us.
  • If you donate please consider sharing with your friends on facebook or twitter that you did, word of mouth is great and when applying for corporate partnerships social media counts, in large amounts!
  • If you're unsure about donating and have a question just send us a note and we'll be happy to try and answer it.

 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Alright, let's keep this short and sweet!

My name is Miranda and I'm a senior at the Kansas City Art Institute, so close (so close) to recieving my B.F.A in Painting. Yes, I'm a painting major, but the freedom of cirriculum has allowed me to work with a variety of materials exploring everything from installation work to photography and printmaking. 

For the last three years at the art institute I have also become passionate about art history and theory, the reasons why art is made rather than making it.

IT'S JUST SO COOL.

But really, with an intense studio I never had time to fully analyze wonderful essays such as Being and Nothingness (all 990 pages). It's important okay? It is around this time I began searching for a program that would allow me to sit in a hole and read and write until my heart's content, and there it was. This fall Paris College of Art is opening a new B.F.A Critical Theory program.

Here is a link to all of my current undergraduate work 

http://www.flickr.com/photos/miranda_bertucci/

Why I need your help...

I'm in the final count down to my semester and I'm still short on cash. By the end of August, I have to pay 3,697 euros to pay for my dorms. (That's about $5100 given the temper of the USD conversion gods on that day).

Now I'm reaching out to my friends, collegues, coworkers, and members of the community for help to make all this possible.

For your donation, you will recieve one of my great perks that highlight many skill sets I have learned so far in college and from my wonderful art highschool in New Orleans, New Orleans Center for Creative Arts. That school is the best thing that has ever happened to me. 

So What, Right? 

I know, it's like why help someone study abroad? It can seem a little frivolous. However, I'm going specifically for this program which is normally only available at the graduate level in many U.S schools. Also, what I plan to learn is like an endangered animal.

Like these guys:

http://www.time.com/time/photogallery/0,29307,1888702_1863780,00.html

Today, a plethora of artists get caught up in making art, which is fine. It's just if I had a dime for everytime I heard, "I don't look at other artists," I wouldn't have to make this Indiegogo. It is so important to study contemporary and past artists because they have problem solved and paved the way for the ideas possible and acceptable today. I feel that too many contemporary artists take this for granted. 

When I began to study art history my freshman year, I became TOO excited to wake up at 8 a.m and trudge across campus in 3 degree weather to sit at a desk for an hour and a half. When I return from this program I hope to share what I have learned and to once again become heavily involved in the Dodge Painting gallery located on my school's campus the exhibits student work and also teaches valuable lessons in professional practice and preparator skills. 

Art is supposed to be for everyone, but how is that goal possible when only a handful understand the lens in which to look through. Opportunities like this are not only important for the career advancement of an artist, but also for you as a contributor! You're becoming an important part of your community, investing in education, and when you need that thinga-ma-bob built or have this idea but not the know how to design it- artists have your back. 

While I'm over there..

I will be intensely studying the French language, immersing myself in every single museum and gallery, refining my pallete (honesty matters right?), and like I said sitting in a hole and reading and writing about art for 5 months. 

I know what it feels like to not be able to help:

So if that is you, all I ask is for you to pass along my campaign. It would still mean the world to me. 

 

To post this in the first place, I have had to put my pride aside (southern pride that is). Asking for help has been difficult enough, but again thank you so so so very much. 

 

Credit where it is due:

The image of myself was taken by Desiree Morales and I am wearing a scarf by Evander Camorlinga. Both very talented artists that are wonderful friends!

story:
Restoring the collection

 “A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.”
Marcus Garvey

 

I have been training in the Japanese martial arts for 20 years…. 8 years ago I started making Japanese katana. I have met many peoples along the way, friends, brothers and of course teachers like Ben Kreiser, Sensei of Min Ryû Shinto Ryu of the San Antonio School of Kenjutsu.  Ben Passed away in November 2012. He was an amazing man, teacher and martial artist. I can truly say knowing him for the short time I did know him; he made a major impact on my life. A few weeks before he passed, he called me and asked if I wanted his collection of Japanese fitting molds. Ben made his living doing restoration of Japanese katana.  Truly, he dedicated his life to preserving the Way of the Samurai.

 

 The collection is in a varied state. The newer molds are okay but with age they have deteriorated. The older molds are seriously deteriorated, Casters looking at them have called them "gum" meaning they are soft quite possibly unsalvageable. The older molds need to be repaired and remolded. I also want to preserve the more recent molds by creating new molds of each in a stronger longer lasting mold material as well as make a display of the collection. I plan to continue his work restoring Antique Katana as well as my work of creating new blades. The final goal of the project is to create a display of the final casting to setup in a public place.

I would like to list a few themes I have noticed in the collection , particularly : cranes , dragons, water, bull, phoenix, eagle , Tiger , bamboo, chrysanthamums, water, fans,coy, monkeys, and several uniques geometric designs, Just to name a few I have noticed.

 

 

We hope to use the funds from this crowdfunder to restore and preserve this collection of History as well as honor the man who dedicated his life to the art of the sword.

 

Funds will be used mostly on Materials and labor: Molding materials, casting materials, as well as what plans to be extensive labor restoring the damaged molds. I will need to bring in a few experts. More Durable molds and models of all the individual pieces will be made. We will be using lost wax methods traditional to making these pieces. A few artists have offered to help but there are at last count 275 molds and since that count another box has been found.  There will be a lot of man hours to restore these molds.

 

 

Our funds goal of $150,000 may seem high to some but consider the man hours going into restoring each piece: repairing to mold to some sort of useable state, pulling a successful wax, repairing that wax  if necessary [ very likely], molding that piece, casting it then cleaning it up by hand detailing polishing and adding necessary patina.... It might take a week or more to repair the damaged pieces. All this will take several sculptures and casters to accomplish. Lots of man hours as well as materials to mold and cast.     We alos have some pretty neat perks on the list. The cost of producing the perks is in there as well. This stuff ain't cheap. Please see the bottom of this portion for info on delivery times for the perks.           

 If we don’t reach our goal, we plan to use what we can to start the project, to restore the pieces that need to be saved before they deteriorate beyond repair. These molds continue to deteriorate even if not in use

IF we DO exceed the goal, the plan is to expand on this project, to do full restoration. If a high enough goal is met, we will build a full forge to carry on the traditions of making swords of all kinds.  Currently, we employ traditional Japanese and European as well as modern methods to make these works of art.

The Impact….. our future

The sword, in all cultures is a part of our history, but not just as a weapon. In myths and legends [and even movies] heroes teach us to dream of being better people; to be courageous.

To know your future, you must know your past…
                                                   -Margaret Jang


"Study the past if you would define the future...."

-Confucius

 

In the Japanese culture, the Samurai lived by a code of discipline respect and Honor, values a lot of individual seem to put aside these days.  Even today, you will find very few martial artist actively training, who are disrespectful or irresponsible.

 

Training with the sword requires even more discipline and focus.

I feel it is important to hold on to our heritage. My Martial arts are part of my heritage. I sweat, bled and cried to earn what I have earned. I have also dedicated my path to keeping these traditions of the samurai and his sword alive to train others. These techniques are gifts that can be lost…… we must preserve them.

 

“You have to know the past to understand the present.” Dr. Carl Sagan

If you can donate please do. Every penny counts. If you can donate enough to enjoy a perk, Please do.

If you can’t contribute financially but feel the cause is just, spread the word, tell your friends.  Share on facebook.... If the word doesnt get out , then this project will never take off

“In the art of peace, a single cut of the sword summons up the wondrous powers of the universe. That one sword links the past, present, and future; it absorbs the universe. Time and space disappear. All of creation, from the distant past to the present moment, lives in the sword. All human existence flourishes right here in the sword you hold in your hands. You are now prepared for anything that may arise.”
― Morihei Ueshiba, The Art of Peace

 

We will be attempting to create a blog to show our progress, when you make your donation to the fundraiser , we will add your email to the blog update so you can see our progress.

The perks will be made after the fundraiser is over. We ask for your patience while we make them. The top perks will take the longest and with a lot of hustle, we are aiming to have all the perks save the top 3 completed and delivered in less than 3 months. That said we appreciate your patience. Several of the perks completion dates will be based on restoring the collection. We have set the number of perks HIGH so we can allow everyone to choose what they want and hopefully raise enough money to do more than just restore the collection.

 

Our cause is important and our dreams are Big.
story_txt:
Restoring the collection 
 “A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.”Marcus Garvey

 
I have been training in the Japanese martial arts for 20 years…. 8 years ago I started making Japanese katana. I have met many peoples along the way, friends, brothers and of course teachers like Ben Kreiser, Sensei of Min Ryû Shinto Ryu of the San Antonio School of Kenjutsu.  Ben Passed away in November 2012. He was an amazing man, teacher and martial artist. I can truly say knowing him for the short time I did know him; he made a major impact on my life. A few weeks before he passed, he called me and asked if I wanted his collection of Japanese fitting molds. Ben made his living doing restoration of Japanese katana.  Truly, he dedicated his life to preserving the Way of the Samurai. 
 
 The collection is in a varied state. The newer molds are okay but with age they have deteriorated. The older molds are seriously deteriorated, Casters looking at them have called them "gum" meaning they are soft quite possibly unsalvageable. The older molds need to be repaired and remolded. I also want to preserve the more recent molds by creating new molds of each in a stronger longer lasting mold material as well as make a display of the collection. I plan to continue his work restoring Antique Katana as well as my work of creating new blades. The final goal of the project is to create a display of the final casting to setup in a public place.
I would like to list a few themes I have noticed in the collection , particularly : cranes , dragons, water, bull, phoenix, eagle , Tiger , bamboo, chrysanthamums, water, fans,coy, monkeys, and several uniques geometric designs, Just to name a few I have noticed.

 
 
We hope to use the funds from this crowdfunder to restore and preserve this collection of History as well as honor the man who dedicated his life to the art of the sword. 
 
Funds will be used mostly on Materials and labor: Molding materials, casting materials, as well as what plans to be extensive labor restoring the damaged molds. I will need to bring in a few experts. More Durable molds and models of all the individual pieces will be made. We will be using lost wax methods traditional to making these pieces. A few artists have offered to help but there are at last count 275 molds and since that count another box has been found.  There will be a lot of man hours to restore these molds.
 
  
Our funds goal of $150,000 may seem high to some but consider the man hours going into restoring each piece: repairing to mold to some sort of useable state, pulling a successful wax, repairing that wax  if necessary [ very likely], molding that piece, casting it then cleaning it up by hand detailing polishing and adding necessary patina.... It might take a week or more to repair the damaged pieces. All this will take several sculptures and casters to accomplish. Lots of man hours as well as materials to mold and cast.     We alos have some pretty neat perks on the list. The cost of producing the perks is in there as well. This stuff ain't cheap. Please see the bottom of this portion for info on delivery times for the perks.

The sword, in all cultures is a part of our history, but not just as a weapon. In myths and legends [and even movies] heroes teach us to dream of being better people; to be courageous.
To know your future, you must know your past…                                                   -Margaret Jang"Study the past if you would define the future...."
-Confucius
 
In the Japanese culture, the Samurai lived by a code of discipline respect and Honor, values a lot of individual seem to put aside these days.  Even today, you will find very few martial artist actively training, who are disrespectful or irresponsible. 
 
Training with the sword requires even more discipline and focus.
I feel it is important to hold on to our heritage. My Martial arts are part of my heritage. I sweat, bled and cried to earn what I have earned. I have also dedicated my path to keeping these traditions of the samurai and his sword alive to train others. These techniques are gifts that can be lost…… we must preserve them.
 
“You have to know the past to understand the present.” Dr. Carl Sagan

If you can’t contribute financially but feel the cause is just, spread the word, tell your friends.  Share on facebook.... If the word doesnt get out , then this project will never take off

All of creation, from the distant past to the present moment, lives in the sword. All human existence flourishes right here in the sword you hold in your hands.
