story:
poesianamusica.com


ALL ABOUT


  • PROPONENT NOTE

This campaign is an artistic campaign, social, educational and revolutionary.

This campaign talks about how I was progressing from the lower quality videos, pictures taken from my cell phone until I get to the professional level, approving a project in the Ministry of Culture.

This campaign talks about evolve and proves it. This campaign flirts with humans and art. This is my material's life, I'm in every video and photo introducing myself to you, either by sound or by image, that's what I do. Use your reason to understand, use your heart to feel...

Best regards!


  • INTRODUCTION

Dear friends, 

It's been twelve years now I work in Rio de Janeiro with poetry, tourism, music, arts in general and social inclusion. I participated in an NGO which supports needy children from favela Parada de Lucas (Rio's periphery) with projects such as graffiti, stencil, music and local collectivity.
At this time i've followed the needs and issues of these children’s and others who could not participate in this program due to lack of physical space.
Everyday in these NGO made me see how we have brilliant kids in the slums with no opportunity for their development.

 I've been in this project for some months but my heart and my mind are still touched by the memories of moments i had in this place.
I can remember the heartness of these children and how my little contribution was important to them.

Meanwhile,  this time I've been giving guitar lessons, studying, working as a freelancer in tourism, sometimes catching up some works as a photographer, feeding a website and a blog, making drawings and producing shirts, writing daily poems, publishing books, tryin to raise funds for a educational project i have (I'll talk a bit more about this later) and have some time to educate my daughter. So my time to do volunteer work was pratically zero and i needed think how give sequence in my contributions with society. Then i made a educational project to allow me do something with longer range.

The contribution i ask is to hire people to work with me in my initiatives. 
So far my videos, my volunteer works, my classes, my studies, my website, my books and editions were all funded by me, since part of creation, structural publishing and marketing. I'm really passionate about what I do. But the things are not going the way I expected, and my art and social contribution are somewhat tied by lack of funds. I was very reluctant until now but I have to agree that it is time to ask for some help, I'm exhausted. 
At the moment, my educational project is validated by the Brazilian Ministry of Culture and is valued at around $152.437,00, but here I only ask an initial amount which I believe already cover some needs.

I have been finding it difficult to raise the necessary to consolidate it as most private organizations in Brazil only aim to profit financially from their own investments or help projects that have truly walk alone and not need monetary coverage. I find it strange, but is the way it works.

About the contents, our project deals with poetry, music and we have future plans to cover other subjects such as the ones mentioned above but aiming at global inclusion, given that we intend to draw the attention of other countries and cultures to our real everyday lives and even translate all texts to another languages.

We aim to meet the demands of all classes of the Brazilian society and intend to use any funds received in the best possible way, highlighting the popular culture, and opening up new climbs to strengthen and encourage the arts, reading and music, reducing inequalities of opportunity in our country.

Thanks to everyone involved and wish all participants in this project, supporters or contributors, a better world, more just and free of all chains that limit progress.
Best regards!


  • ABOUT ME AND MY ART

 Well, for you to understand better about the aspects of my art, I have 31 years old, one eleven year old daughter named Ana Julia, which is the name of a song from a Rio band of MPB and Rock, well known here in my state.
I am known here as Magheize, a nickname given by my childhood friends.

I was born in Suburb, more precisely between the North Zone and the Baixada Fluminense. Since childhood I lived with the reality of working, fight for my ideals, take care of my family and bring a smile even in the face of adversity.
Here in Brazil is no lack of warmth and difficulties to be overcome.

I studied for four years at FAETEC which is a technical and academic center near my old neighborhood. There I majored in Speech, Music and presented my final thesis on diaphragmatic breathing and employment exercises for the muscles in the singing voice.
After the course I also did a test and graduated as a popular musician in guitar, singing and percussion by the Order of the Musicians of Brazil.

At the moment, i work on a cultural project, validated by Cultural Ministry and search about tourism, in Celso Suckow da Fonseca federal center, in addition to working in the area with people around the world, I do gradually some investiments in my social and music projects, aiming to become an exponent here in my country.
During these lines you will be able to better understand my story, what I've done here, where I am and where I'm going.

  • SOME OF MY MUSIC. 
These are some videos I made after a short course of editing and audio programming.

AMENDOEIRA (Almond)

The almond is a very popular tree in suburban streets, gives us no edible fruit but is a very wide and full of leaves. Every day you find people taking shade to escape the high temperatures that reach 41 degrees centigrade.
I grew up playing under these trees, which coincidentally existed both in front of the house where I was raised, as in the pavement of the house of my maternal grandparents where I spent my school holidays. At night it was surrounded by bats, well, I remember my kites hold them and hide myself from other children in plays of hide and seek.
This song alludes precisely in a metaphor about the difficulty of growing up on the strees and face the time, is about the creativity of my people, your beauty and the power that comes from this.
I made this music with some things I learned on folk guitar, classical and bossa nova. 

GNOSIS

I made this videoclip to entering contests of musical short films, remember to have it sent to some festivals in Cannes, Seoul, Berlin and other countries but i think my material doesn't been good enough to enter any of then.

Even so I was very pleased to be able to actively participate and take a bit of my culture to other places, this music give me some work and made me more powerfull with the strings.

The video is about the stages of life, is about having the knowledge that everything is finite.


SUPERNOVA

Nothing is more curious than the universe and that I've always been very curious about this subject. I made this song for a custom soundtrack and thinking about music theraphy. Some parts were recovered and ended up doing a synchronized video clippings with some images that was ready in my home studio.

I conclude that it is a very good music to sleep, and whenever working on my stuff by dawn, I hear this music before falling asleep.



TRISTES DIAS (SAD DAYS)

This song was composed at the time of my adolescence, I just came to do the recording and music video about ten years later.

At this time I was writing five to ten poems a day and was not going to guitar lessons. It was a very difficult phase in my life because my parents were separating and had many fights, my daughter was very small and I had taken a job as a mattress salesman and felt that walked in the opposite of art.

But life, in spite of preaching in these parts, makes us stronger and makes us face some facts, even bitter.

In some ways it was exactly at this time that I decided to work with art and to follow up my career this way.

Developed a keener critical sense and I could see that we must give up some things that are not relevant, because the only way to go, best of all, are the pathways that make our hearts throb.

The video images come to complete a comprehensive way what I felt at that time, and this time, some musicians participated with flutes, percussion and electric guitars.

I tried to embed the video clip in a contest of Brazilian MTV, but what did the head of staff at the time was the National Rap, MPB was already in decline due to the fever of the troubled political moment that we passed.

This was one of my best productions.



BEHIND BLUE EYES

I made this video for an ex-girlfriend of mine who had beautiful blue eyes. We have separated after two years together and I was feeling crazy because in addition to not be giving more classes or working on art, I was very anxious to join college in Petropolis, highland area of Rio.

I wondered a lot about being or not being a good artist and thought I really had no talent for anything, since i had failed, somehow, every contest i had entered.

At this time I learned a lot about doing good clips with low costs and any tools. Prepared a portfolio of songs and invented a "B" plan to record a commercial CD in order to market it.


Finally, I got enough average and entered in the field of tourism and hospitality. As soon as I arrived in that town, walked on foot for two days searching for any work, and finally got a job as a bilingual messenger at a local hotel. So i rooted in the place.

My willpower and need for a change of scenery was so much that i took only a week to settle me.

The longing of my ex-girlfriend was dissipating and my luck began to change.
On this date I listened rock all time and needed to convert my feelings into art, even though I was not use this video for any purpose.



THE LION'S MARCH

Very well, if you've followed me this far, you realize that I love study, learn new things and develop ideas. Even in bad conditions. Can also be inside of fact that I don't hold me a styles, i like music, and instrumental is one type i like much cause i got freedom feelings on it.

This video was a test I did to see if I could accompany images with a guitar, improvising music and connect them to the movements of animals on a documentary.

Chose the lions because they are angry, they are at the top of the food chain in grasslands, and also because it was the animal I most identified myself at that moment. I had a complete mastery on choices. One day, reading Soren Kieerkegaard in a librally, a phrase struck me too "the truth is always a truth in action, as the faith is always faith through works."

This Danish philosopher made some comparations between animal society and human. then I could see by his eyes and understand what he was saying.

All this went through my head and then I I filtered the ideas for this arrangement with almost ten minutes long.



SMALL SHOWS AND GIGS

I will be brief to comment on this video.

There by the middle of 2009, I was the singer of this band called Foramalú. I sang covers of rock bands in Lapa, downtown Rio where the bands do a circuit. We were one of the bands that were always called.


We made a hundred concerts and gigs by the four corners of the state and this was one of them. The video was made by a fan.


  • INK WORKS
Some street paintings, made parallel classes for children.


This is my daughter, Ana Julia. This time she must have been about six years old.


This refrigerator was painted to customer specification for a craft store. I worked on it for three hours and liked the result. The client even more.

After this day, I felt that artistic painting had not even limits.

Working on...


  • CLASSES
These photos were taken on a day of volunteer work in the slums of Parada de Lucas, I was six months on the project, then called me to get fixed, but was busy with a range of concerts and compositions copyright songs for joining festivals state. I miss these kids that were really special.
 I do not know if their have reached individual goals, but I know they were very good in what they did. It was very nice to feel the affection of them with me
The educational project I have, currently occurred to me this time, but only got approval from the ministry of culture in mid-2013.

PARADA DE LUCAS SLUMS



These photos were taken by fifth graders in high school Anchieta, where I also participated with some art classes. I was the youngest of the teachers on the institution and had low experience but did my part with them.

ANCHIETA'S COLLEGE


Batucada was a body of music and percussion project where I attended. In the same school, I studied speech and music for four consecutive years.

BATUCADA'S BLOCK


  • PHOTOGRAPHY AND TOURISM
These are some photos I took as part of Tours.
Once I entered college, had a stoppage of almost a school year. 
The strike of 2011 devastated the students and so I returned to Rio with a locked registration and entered the job market with only one completed period. Worked in for four years without leaving my project aside.


ITATIAIA

Itatiaia is a municipality in the State of Rio de Janeiro. It is located on the border of the states of Rio de Janeiro and Minas Gerais in the Mantiqueira's Range.

Subdivided into two districts: Itatiaia (headquarters) and Penedo, which generates much of the city's income due to tourism.

This photo was taken for a client on the road to another state.


RED BEACH, URCA

The Red Beach is located in the neighborhood of Urca, in the city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

The beach is greatly appreciated by the surrounding landscape between the Urca and the hill of Babilônia.

The beach, despite having no large waves is deep.

In its sands, can be seen garnet crystals, but this is not the reason of his name; it is so called because the sand becomes reddish when the sun goes down, due to the reflection of sunlight on the red crystals and roses.

This photo was taken for a client who was visiting the Sugar Loaf.




BOTAFOGO'S BEACH

Botafogo Praia is located in Botafogo Bay, the eponymous district in the city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

At the time of founding of the city of Rio de Janeiro, vast land grants were given outside the city limits, around the Guanabara Bay.

João de Souza Pereira Botafogo, owner and resident on site, named the cove, the beach and the neighborhood that would form in the following centuries.

This photo was taken for a Londoner client who was in conference in a drilling company located in Argentina building, one of the other business centers in the neighborhood.




FIOCRUZ, MANGUINHOS

The Oswaldo Cruz Foundation (Fiocruz) is a federal institution under the Ministry of Health located in the city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Built in 1900 by renowned sanitarian Oswaldo Cruz, is the most important institution of science and technology in health in Latin America, being a reference in research in the field of public health.

I took this photo, curiously, reflects some of the inserted urban art in our academic and research centers.



SÃO BENTO'S MONASTERY

The Monastery of São Bento do Rio de Janeiro is a historic monastery located in Morro de Sao Bento in the center of the city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is one of the main monuments of colonial art in the city and the country.

The monks live there in prayer, being always on standby to receive all guests and visitors, even welcoming the coming to life of prayer, retreat, or those seeking spiritual guidance or confession.

As you can see, is a place also very popular for tourists worldwide.

This picture was taken by a customer coming from Crete, Greece, which hired me for a city tour in order to meet monuments and churches in downtown Rio.


FIFTEEN SQUARE (PRAÇA XV)

The Fifteen November Square, also known as Praça XV de Novembro, is a square located in the center of the city of Rio de Janeiro, State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. In its surroundings, are located the station Barcas S / A, which makes paths of Rio to Niteroi, the Street March 1, the Arc of Teles, the Tiradentes Palace, the Imperial Palace and the Legislative Assembly of Rio de Janeiro.

This photo was taken again to prove the art of inserting everywhere. One of our customers caught my attention to color in every corner of the city.


MAC, NITERÓI

The Museum of Contemporary Art in Niterói (MAC) is a museum located in the city of Niteroi, state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Designed by architect Oscar Niemeyer, the MAC has become one of the postcards of Niteroi. It is primarily the works of contemporary art, all dated to the course of the 20th century offers from art to abstract works depicting the illusion of the Brazilian monarchy. The museum has a collection of 1,217 works Collection Sattamini. A set meeting since the 1950s by the collector Sattamini, the second largest collection of contemporary art in Brazil.

I took this shot, framing a person at the bottom, right, for one of my clients who wanted to sample his wife, how great is the museum that is associated with a spacecraft.



ROLLS ROYCE FACTORY, MACAÉ

The Roll's Royce, builder of engines and parts, is all over our state. With headquarters in Santa Cruz, Macaé, Niterói, is embedded in our market and annually receives thousands of engineers worldwide.

On this day, we took a three-hour drive through the BR-101, with a team of four engineers. A Norwegian, two North American and an Indian who later also would tour the city.

I took this picture to use it after the reception of clients in Galeão Airport (GIG), and ask the charge of the day to fix the letter "L", which was crooked. One of my clients said I was too detailed, as an engineer, then laughed.



SÃO PAULO, CAPITOL

A photo taken from the side of a building near the Pacaembu, an amazing painting.

This day I visited São Paulo for a workshop to learn about business tourism and decided to make some records.


TORTOISE BEACH, BÚZIOS

The Turtle Beach is located in the city of Armação dos Búzios, in the Brazilian state of Rio de Janeiro.

Many tourists came this time to meet beaches and islands. This is, in my opinion, one of the most beautiful of them.

This boat caught my eye and gave me a feeling of momentary nostalgia.


SÃO MIGUEL'S SHIPYARD

Active since the 70's, strategically located in an area of 20 thousand square meters in Port Gradim, São Gonçalo, Rio de Janeiro, São Miguel Shipyard has recently been refurbished to meet the new demands of the market for construction, repair and modernization of offshore support vessels and offshore, with high added technological value (PSVs, OSRVs and AHTSs). For this, the Shipyard San Miguel has two dry docks and structure capable of delivering up to six sized vessels of a PSV 4500, a year.

A photo of colorful bins separated for recyclable waste distributed throughout the complex.


MOCANGUÊ ISLAND

The Mocanguê Island is located within the Guanabara Bay, Niterói, state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

It consists of two conjugated islands known by Mocanguê Large and Mocanguê Small. In the small yard was located and the workshops of the Brazilian Lloyd Shipping Company, the great always belonged to the Navy. When it decided to incorporate the Naval Base of Rio de Janeiro, landed the channel separating the islands.

The small island was donated to the Navy of Brazil by the Federal Government in December 1973. In it was established in July 1977, the Naval Station in Rio de Janeiro, extinct in May 1986 to make way for naval base, made up of a series Military Organizations focused on the training of personnel for the performance of duties and functions in the Navy of Brazil.

I took this picture synchronizing a plane and two seagulls I would use for future cards of my project.


HOTEL SOLAR EMPIRE, PETRÓPOLIS

The Solar Empire Hotel is design to entice and enchant any observer. The environment consists of two old houses of 1875 and 1893, both listed by IPHAN and restored to turn them into a fine hotel with high quality standards. The architectural beauty of these palaces and the quality of service provided by the hotel staff tune with other monuments of Petrópolis the imperial city.

This photo was taken by me on a Monday while working waiting for the reopening of my course management in tourism. The facade of the hotel is one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen.

Just at this time, I got a better job offer in Rio, where did all the photos from previous frames.



THIS PICS ARE DEDICATED TO TWO GOOD FRIENDS WHO ENCOURAGED ME

Mister Knut, from Bergen/NOR

Mister Cook, From Ohio/USA


  • PUBLISHED BOOKS

This is the staff who helped me with the publication of my first book.

The left, Taciana, who helped me with advice on advertising, Marcela, my sister, formed in letters from UERJ, my brother Allan and his wife, Michelle, market consultants.

This book was launched at the same time I ended my circuit as a singer, the publisher is also in Lapa, downtown Rio.


MULTIFOCO PUBLISHING HOUSE


O BATE-BOLA (The Beat-Ball)


The tittle

Bate-bola is a fantasy carnival popularly used in our festival. The tradition was brought by Portuguese colonists, and was also influenced by the Folia de Reis (Reverly King).

In the early days, the fantasy of Bate-ball is much resembled the clown, but including terrifying masks. Hitting the ground with their ox bladders quite smelly, arrested by rope to a pole or cable, the hits balls were the terror of the children. The balls are no longer bladders and now are rubber or plastic but the fearful attitude of hits balls remains.


The Contents

The book alludes to the difficulties and delights of academic art world, paths and difficulties, from the teachers to the entrance in the television medium and state.

The title was chosen as a metaphor to exemplify the attitude to achieve recognition and success.

The book was also accepted by Cultura bookstore, one of the most popular of our country


Link

http://rakuten.livrariacultura.com.br/scripts/resenha/resenha.asp?nitem=29833616


POEMAS ESCROTOS EXCRETADOS COMO CRÔNICAS
(Scrotums poems excreted as chronic)


The tittle

The title makes reference to the discomfort that each sector of art and Brazilian culture, may or may not cause every spectator.

The Contents

This book was written as a comedy critical to elucidate the growing Brazilian programs dedicated to laughter.

There is also corroboration regarding some aspects of sex tourism, the period of popularization of art via social medias and the question of tastes and identification for every style of music.

This time, the editing was done by a São Paulo company that would give me a better margin in publications and greater freedom of choice in the layout.

The cover was made by me, the detail is in the author's name, which is pushed out of the case, implying that there was an error in editing, but is not. This was indeed the expected effect to give the idea of the lack of space for the author in the book market.

In fact, the book's narrative that's about it, take things seriously while everyone is joking around. Trust in own work and potential.


Link

http://www.livrorama.com.br/loja/details.php?p=341


  • MUSICAL CIRCUIT

Some photos taken five years of work as a singer, producer and band concerts.


MOFO BAR, LAPA

On the first floor of the old house is the bar with 130 seats.

I remember arriving at the last minute this day, for the soundcheck and also we replaced our drummer, who was having personal problems and can not attend.

Was a day of great hardship, however overcome. The show was very good and people loved our copyright songs.


SALOON 79, BOTAFOGO

The saloon 79, is a rock bar very popular in Botafogo. The only rule of the place is, playing rock and play loud. The place team was very competent and treated us very well.

Three bands performed on this day and the house was very crowded in the middle of our presentation.

When I arrived, there were not many people and i worried, but this time we had no problems and all members attended, everything happened as expected.


SESC, ENGENHO DE DENTRO

Festival of independent bands supported by the state board.

Tonight we did a forty-five minute set, with copyright songs I wrote in a week.

I remember that the band worked hard on the songs and our bass player can not participate because it was in Minas Gerais, waiting for the birth of your child.

Two new members were called, and a friend of ours, flutist, made appearances on some songs.

Ended the night in Lapa, to do a brief celebration. It was a very special day for us.


ODYSSEY THEATRE

We were headlining the night, remember it was a weekend, the house was packed.

It was my last show with this band before falling by late nights writing my educational project and working day in the bureaucratic part of it.

I kept a very good material for future release so my appointments in my cultural project finish.


  • GRAPHICS DESIGN
LOGOS
Two figures created for my audiovisual production company. A enterprise logo and a published banner.


SHIRTS

Some shirts I have for free distribution and dissemination of the project.

The prints were dotted with critical sense. The colors pleased me a lot.

HUMANITY

CLEANUP

NEED

A BETTER BRAZIL



    • ABOUT MY EDUCATIONAL PROJECT WITH CULTURAL MINISTRY

I have developed a cultural project called "Poesia na Música" (Poetry in Music), which was recently approved by the Brazilian Ministry of Culture,  in accordance with the Rouanet Law, article 26,  allowing us - according to the standards of "Rouanet" Law, article 26 - the sponsorship opportunity through Donations, Tax Waiver or Federal Tax Incentives to fundraising revolving around R$ 340,580.00,  around US$ 150,000.00. 

As still could not get a sponsor, I decided do this crowdfunding to reduce the amount required to 1/3, which is precisely what is necessary to start.


Cultural details of the project

In the next semester, we will launch our website " POESIA NA MÚSICA", presenting to the world the icons of Brazilian popular musical poetry and the history of our music. They will be listed by the decade in which they acted, from the 1920' icon and pioneer, Heitor Villa Lobos.

 Villa-Lobos engaged in what is the most significative popular music genre, featured in the most important group of Brazilian poet-musicians.  

Our project will be made available in both Portuguese and English, welcoming users from different parts of the world. We will also elaborate subtitled videos enabling the inclusion of the hearing and visually impaired.

There will be space for debates, sharing material about the subjects in the scope of the website and also poetry contests. A dynamic and practical way to spread knowledge and the perpetuation of our culture. 

The project aims at strengthening cultural, to be able in the near future, meet the social sphere.


Details of the Advertising Project

The website should attract around 2,000 to 6,000  viewers daily, generating around 800,000 monthly visits (see technical report issued by the Ministry of Culture attached). 



Technical report issued by the Ministry of Culture

This is the system that puts me in direct contact with Cultural Ministry-Brasilia (Salic Web), is where i do all the procedures, shipping documents, do spreadsheets, calculate budgets, payroll and some other things.


Doing a bit of effort you can calmly analyze the numbers and even data. The print was small, but you can get a sense of the magnitude of it.

Dear, I must say that I'm working for two long years, going for three in this system. I also researched a lot about social security and IRS because these types of projects go through a big supervision, the project can suffers audit if i fail and all my 2004 work to date can down the drain with my credentials.

Here you can see closer the specifications. Are in Portuguese, but I think there is nothing to worry about, since it is quite simple to understand.



Project Budget Worksheet

As you can see, we need to cover all these areas with the best professionals.

If you want to contact, visit our website, leave a message.

Our email address is at the bottom.




Thank you in advance for your generous support - we really can't do this without you!

BEST REGARDS!

D. Barbosa MAGHEIZE 
CEO/FOUNDER
magheize@poesianamusica.com


poesianamusica.com
story_txt:
poesianamusica.comALL ABOUT
PROPONENT NOTE

This campaign is an artistic campaign, social, educational and revolutionary.
This campaign talks about how I was progressing from the lower quality videos, pictures taken from my cell phone until I get to the professional level, approving a project in the Ministry of Culture.
This campaign talks about evolve and proves it. This campaign flirts with humans and art. This is my material's life, I'm in every video and photo introducing myself to you, either by sound or by image, that's what I do. Use your reason to understand, use your heart to feel...
Best regards!



INTRODUCTION

Dear friends, 

It's been twelve years now I work in Rio de Janeiro with poetry, tourism, music,
arts in general and social inclusion. I participated in an NGO which
supports needy children from favela Parada de Lucas (Rio's periphery) with
projects such as graffiti, stencil, music and local collectivity.At this time i've followed the
needs and issues of these children’s and others who could not participate in this program due to lack of physical space.Everyday in these NGO made me see how we have brilliant kids in the slums with no opportunity for their development.

 I've been in this project for some months but my heart and my mind are still touched by the memories of moments i had in this place.I can remember the heartness of these children and how my little contribution was important to them.

Meanwhile,  this time I've been giving guitar lessons, studying, working as a freelancer
in tourism, sometimes catching up some works as a photographer, feeding a website and a blog, making drawings and producing shirts, writing daily poems,
publishing books, tryin to raise funds for a educational project i have (I'll talk a
bit more about this later) and have some time to educate my daughter. So my time to do volunteer work was pratically zero and i needed think how give sequence in my contributions with society. Then i made a educational project to allow me do something with longer range.
The contribution i ask is to hire people to work with me in my initiatives. So far my videos,
my volunteer works, my classes, my studies, my website, my books and editions were all funded by me, since part of creation, structural publishing and
marketing. I'm really passionate about what I do. But the things are not
going the way I expected, and my art and social contribution are somewhat tied
by lack of funds. I was very reluctant until now but I have to agree that it is
time to ask for some help, I'm exhausted. 

At the moment, my educational project is validated by the Brazilian Ministry of
Culture and is valued at around $152.437,00, but here I only ask an initial
amount which I believe already cover some needs.

I have been finding it difficult to raise the necessary to consolidate it as
most private organizations in Brazil only aim to profit financially from their
own investments or help projects that have truly walk alone and not need
monetary coverage. I find it strange, but is the way it works.

About the contents, our project deals with poetry, music and we have future
plans to cover other subjects such as the ones mentioned above but aiming at
global inclusion, given that we intend to draw the attention of other countries
and cultures to our real everyday lives and even translate all texts to another
languages.

We aim to meet the demands of all classes of the Brazilian society and intend
to use any funds received in the best possible way, highlighting the popular
culture, and opening up new climbs to strengthen and encourage the arts,
reading and music, reducing inequalities of opportunity in our country.

Thanks to everyone involved and wish all participants in this project,
supporters or contributors, a better world, more just and free of all chains
that limit progress.
Best regards!
ABOUT ME AND MY ART

 Well, for you to understand better about the aspects of my art, I have 31 years
old, one eleven year old daughter named Ana Julia, which is the name of a song
from a Rio band of MPB and Rock, well known here in my state.
I am known here as Magheize, a nickname given by my childhood friends.

I was born in Suburb, more precisely between the North Zone and the Baixada
Fluminense. Since childhood I lived with the reality of working, fight for
my ideals, take care of my family and bring a smile even in the face of
adversity.
Here in Brazil is no lack of warmth and difficulties to be overcome.

I studied for four years at FAETEC which is a technical and academic center
near my old neighborhood. There I majored in Speech, Music and presented my final
thesis on diaphragmatic breathing and employment exercises for the muscles in
the singing voice.

After the course I also did a test and graduated as a popular musician in guitar, singing and percussion by the Order of the Musicians of Brazil.

At the moment, i work on a cultural project, validated by Cultural Ministry and search about tourism, in Celso Suckow da Fonseca federal center, in addition to working in the area with people around the world, I do gradually some investiments in my social and music projects, aiming to become an exponent here in my country.
During these lines you will be able to better understand my story, what I've done here, where I am and where I'm going.

SOME OF MY MUSIC. 

These are some videos I made after a short course of editing and audio programming.



AMENDOEIRA (Almond)The almond is a very popular tree in suburban streets, gives us no
edible fruit but is a very wide and full of leaves. Every day you find
people taking shade to escape the high temperatures that reach 41 degrees
centigrade.

I grew up playing under these trees, which coincidentally existed
both in front of the house where I was raised, as in the pavement of the house of
my maternal grandparents where I spent my school holidays. At night it was surrounded by bats, well, I remember my kites hold them and
hide myself from other children in plays of hide and seek.

This song alludes precisely in a metaphor about the difficulty of growing
up on the strees and face the time, is about the creativity of my people, your beauty and
the power that comes from this.
I made this music with some things I learned on folk guitar, classical and
bossa nova. 

GNOSISI made this videoclip to entering contests of musical short films, remember to have it sent to some festivals in Cannes, Seoul, Berlin and other countries but i think my material doesn't been good enough to enter any of then.
Even so I was very pleased to be able to actively participate and take a bit of my culture to other places, this music give me some work and made me more powerfull with the strings.
The video is about the stages of life, is about having the knowledge that everything is finite.

SUPERNOVANothing is more curious than the universe and that I've always been very curious about this subject. I made this song for a custom
soundtrack and thinking about music theraphy. Some parts were recovered
and ended up doing a synchronized video clippings with some images that was ready in my home studio.
I conclude that it is a very good music to sleep, and whenever working on my
stuff by dawn, I hear this music before falling asleep.


TRISTES DIAS (SAD DAYS)
This song was composed at the time of my adolescence, I just came to do the
recording and music video about ten years later.

At this time I was writing five to ten poems a day and was not going to guitar
lessons. It was a very difficult phase in my life because my parents were
separating and had many fights, my daughter was very small and I had taken a
job as a mattress salesman and felt that walked in the opposite of art.

But life, in spite of preaching in these parts, makes us stronger and makes us
face some facts, even bitter.

In some ways it was exactly at this time that I decided to work with art and to
follow up my career this way.

Developed a keener critical sense and I could see that we must give up some
things that are not relevant, because the only way to go, best of all, are the
pathways that make our hearts throb.

The video images come to complete a comprehensive way what I felt at that time,
and this time, some musicians participated with flutes, percussion and electric
guitars.

I tried to embed the video clip in a contest of Brazilian MTV, but what did the
head of staff at the time was the National Rap, MPB was already in decline due
to the fever of the troubled political moment that we passed.

This was one of my best productions.


BEHIND BLUE EYESI made this video for an ex-girlfriend of mine who had beautiful blue eyes.
We have separated after two years together and I was feeling crazy because in addition to not be giving more classes or working on art, I was very anxious to join college in Petropolis, highland area of Rio.

I wondered a lot about being or not being a good artist and thought I really
had no talent for anything, since i had failed, somehow, every
contest i had entered.

At this time I learned a lot about doing good clips with low costs and any tools. Prepared a portfolio of songs and invented a "B" plan to record a commercial CD in order to market it.


Finally, I got enough average and entered in the field of tourism and
hospitality. As soon as I arrived in that town, walked on foot for two days searching for any work, and finally got a job as a bilingual messenger at a local hotel. So i rooted in the place.

My willpower and need for a change of scenery was so much that i took only a week to settle me.

The longing of my ex-girlfriend was dissipating and my luck began to change.On this date I listened rock all time and needed to convert my feelings into
art, even though I was not use this video for any purpose.

THE LION'S MARCHVery well, if you've followed me this far, you realize that I love study, learn new things and develop ideas. Even in bad conditions. Can also be inside of fact that I don't hold me a styles, i like music, and instrumental is one type i like much cause i got freedom feelings on it.

This video was a test I did to see if I could accompany images with a guitar, improvising
music and connect them to the movements of animals on a documentary.

Chose the lions because they are angry, they are at the top of the food chain
in grasslands, and also because it was the animal I most identified myself
at that moment. I had a complete mastery on choices. One day, reading Soren Kieerkegaard in a librally, a phrase struck me
too "the truth is always a truth in action, as the faith is always faith
through works."

This Danish philosopher made some comparations between animal society and human. then I could see by his eyes and understand what he was saying.

All this went through my head and then I I filtered the ideas for this arrangement with almost ten minutes long.



SMALL SHOWS AND GIGS
I will be brief to comment on this video.

There by the middle of 2009, I was the singer of this band called Foramalú. I sang covers of rock bands in Lapa, downtown Rio where the bands do a circuit. We were one of the bands that were always called.


We made a hundred concerts and gigs by the four corners of the state and this
was one of them. The video was made by a fan.


INK WORKS
Some street paintings, made parallel classes for children.





This is my daughter, Ana Julia. This time she must have been about six years old.


This refrigerator was painted to customer specification for a craft store. I worked on it for three hours and liked the result. The client even more.
After this day, I felt that artistic painting had not even limits.

Working on...



CLASSESThese photos were taken on a day of volunteer work in the slums of
Parada de Lucas, I was six months on the project, then called me to get fixed,
but was busy with a range of concerts and compositions copyright songs for
joining festivals state. I miss these kids that were really special.
 I do not
know if their have reached individual goals, but I know they were very good in what
they did. It was very nice to feel the affection of them with me
The educational project I have, currently occurred to me this time, but only got
approval from the ministry of culture in mid-2013.PARADA DE LUCAS SLUMS


These photos were taken by fifth graders in high school Anchieta, where I also participated with some art classes. I was the youngest of the teachers on the institution and had low experience but did my part with them.
ANCHIETA'S COLLEGE







Batucada was a body of music and percussion project where I attended. In the same school, I studied speech and music for four consecutive years.
BATUCADA'S BLOCK



PHOTOGRAPHY AND TOURISM
These are some photos I took as part of Tours.


Once I entered college, had a stoppage of almost a school year. The strike of 2011 devastated the students and so I returned to Rio with a locked
registration and entered the job market with only one completed period. Worked in for four years without leaving my project aside.


ITATIAIA


Itatiaia is a municipality in the State of Rio de Janeiro. It is located on the border of the states of Rio de Janeiro and Minas Gerais in the Mantiqueira's Range.
Subdivided into two districts: Itatiaia (headquarters) and Penedo, which generates much of the city's income due to tourism.This photo was taken for a client on the road to another state.


RED BEACH, URCA
The Red Beach is located in the neighborhood of Urca, in the city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
The beach is greatly appreciated by the surrounding landscape between the Urca and the hill of Babilônia.
The beach, despite having no large waves is deep.
In its sands, can be seen garnet crystals, but this is not the reason of his name; it is so called because the sand becomes reddish when the sun goes down, due to the reflection of sunlight on the red crystals and roses.
This photo was taken for a client who was visiting the Sugar Loaf.


BOTAFOGO'S BEACH

At the time of founding of the city of Rio de Janeiro, vast land grants were given outside the city limits, around the Guanabara Bay.
João de Souza Pereira Botafogo, owner and resident on site, named the cove, the beach and the neighborhood that would form in the following centuries.
This photo was taken for a Londoner client who was in conference in a drilling company located in Argentina building, one of the other business centers in the neighborhood.


FIOCRUZ, MANGUINHOSThe Oswaldo Cruz Foundation (Fiocruz) is a federal institution under the Ministry of Health located in the city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Built in 1900 by renowned sanitarian Oswaldo Cruz, is the most important institution of science and technology in health in Latin America, being a reference in research in the field of public health.
I took this photo, curiously, reflects some of the inserted urban art in our academic and research centers.


SÃO BENTO'S MONASTERY
The Monastery of São Bento do Rio de Janeiro is a historic monastery located in Morro de Sao Bento in the center of the city of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is one of the main monuments of colonial art in the city and the country.
The monks live there in prayer, being always on standby to receive all guests and visitors, even welcoming the coming to life of prayer, retreat, or those seeking spiritual guidance or confession.
As you can see, is a place also very popular for tourists worldwide.
This picture was taken by a customer coming from Crete, Greece, which hired me for a city tour in order to meet monuments and churches in downtown Rio.



FIFTEEN SQUARE (PRAÇA XV)


The Fifteen November Square, also known as Praça XV de Novembro, is a square located in the center of the city of Rio de Janeiro, State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. In its surroundings, are located the station Barcas S / A, which makes paths of Rio to Niteroi, the Street March 1, the Arc of Teles, the Tiradentes Palace, the Imperial Palace and the Legislative Assembly of Rio de Janeiro.
This photo was taken again to prove the art of inserting everywhere. One of our customers caught my attention to color in every corner of the city.



MAC, NITERÓI
The Museum of Contemporary Art in Niterói (MAC) is a museum located in the city of Niteroi, state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Designed by architect Oscar Niemeyer, the MAC has become one of the postcards of Niteroi. It is primarily the works of contemporary art, all dated to the course of the 20th century offers from art to abstract works depicting the illusion of the Brazilian monarchy. The museum has a collection of 1,217 works Collection Sattamini. A set meeting since the 1950s by the collector Sattamini, the second largest collection of contemporary art in Brazil.
I took this shot, framing a person at the bottom, right, for one of my clients who wanted to sample his wife, how great is the museum that is associated with a spacecraft.



ROLLS ROYCE FACTORY, MACAÉ

The Roll's Royce, builder of engines and parts, is all over our state. With headquarters in Santa Cruz, Macaé, Niterói, is embedded in our market and annually receives thousands of engineers worldwide.
On this day, we took a three-hour drive through the BR-101, with a team of four engineers. A Norwegian, two North American and an Indian who later also would tour the city.
I took this picture to use it after the reception of clients in Galeão Airport (GIG), and ask the charge of the day to fix the letter "L", which was crooked. One of my clients said I was too detailed, as an engineer, then laughed.




SÃO PAULO, CAPITOL

A photo taken from the side of a building near the Pacaembu, an amazing painting.
This day I visited São Paulo for a workshop to learn about business tourism and decided to make some records.



TORTOISE BEACH, BÚZIOS
The Turtle Beach is located in the city of Armação dos Búzios, in the Brazilian state of Rio de Janeiro.
Many tourists came this time to meet beaches and islands. This is, in my opinion, one of the most beautiful of them.
This boat caught my eye and gave me a feeling of momentary nostalgia.



SÃO MIGUEL'S SHIPYARDActive since the 70's, strategically located in an area of 20 thousand square meters in Port Gradim, São Gonçalo, Rio de Janeiro, São Miguel Shipyard has recently been refurbished to meet the new demands of the market for construction, repair and modernization of offshore support vessels and offshore, with high added technological value (PSVs, OSRVs and AHTSs). For this, the Shipyard San Miguel has two dry docks and structure capable of delivering up to six sized vessels of a PSV 4500, a year.
A photo of colorful bins separated for recyclable waste distributed throughout the complex.


MOCANGUÊ ISLAND

The Mocanguê Island is located within the Guanabara Bay, Niterói, state of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
It consists of two conjugated islands known by Mocanguê Large and Mocanguê Small. In the small yard was located and the workshops of the Brazilian Lloyd Shipping Company, the great always belonged to the Navy. When it decided to incorporate the Naval Base of Rio de Janeiro, landed the channel separating the islands.
The small island was donated to the Navy of Brazil by the Federal Government in December 1973. In it was established in July 1977, the Naval Station in Rio de Janeiro, extinct in May 1986 to make way for naval base, made up of a series Military Organizations focused on the training of personnel for the performance of duties and functions in the Navy of Brazil.
I took this picture synchronizing a plane and two seagulls I would use for future cards of my project.



HOTEL SOLAR EMPIRE, PETRÓPOLISThe Solar Empire Hotel is design to entice and enchant any observer. The environment consists of two old houses of 1875 and 1893, both listed by IPHAN and restored to turn them into a fine hotel with high quality standards. The architectural beauty of these palaces and the quality of service provided by the hotel staff tune with other monuments of Petrópolis the imperial city.

This photo was taken by me on a Monday while working waiting for the reopening of my course management in tourism. The facade of the hotel is one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen.
Just at this time, I got a better job offer in Rio, where did all the photos from previous frames.
THIS PICS ARE DEDICATED TO TWO GOOD FRIENDS WHO ENCOURAGED ME
Mister Knut, from Bergen/NOR


Mister Cook, From Ohio/USA




PUBLISHED BOOKS

This is the staff who helped me with the publication of my first book.
The left, Taciana, who helped me with advice on advertising, Marcela, my sister, formed in letters from UERJ, my brother Allan and his wife, Michelle, market consultants.
This book was launched at the same time I ended my circuit as a singer, the publisher is also in Lapa, downtown Rio.

MULTIFOCO PUBLISHING HOUSE





O BATE-BOLA
(The Beat-Ball)

The tittle

Bate-bola is a fantasy carnival popularly used in our festival. The
tradition was brought by Portuguese colonists, and was also influenced by the
Folia de Reis (Reverly King).

In the early days, the fantasy of Bate-ball is much resembled the clown, but
including terrifying masks. Hitting the ground with their ox bladders quite
smelly, arrested by rope to a pole or cable, the hits balls were the terror of
the children. The balls are no longer bladders and now are rubber or plastic
but the fearful attitude of hits balls remains.


The Contents

The book
alludes to the difficulties and delights of academic art world, paths and
difficulties, from the teachers to the entrance in the television medium and
state.
The title was
chosen as a metaphor to exemplify the attitude to achieve recognition and
success.
The book was also accepted by Cultura bookstore, one of the most popular of our country

Link

http://rakuten.livrariacultura.com.br/scripts/resenha/resenha.asp?nitem=29833616


POEMAS
ESCROTOS EXCRETADOS COMO CRÔNICAS
(Scrotums poems excreted as chronic)


The tittle

The title makes reference to the discomfort that each sector of art
and Brazilian culture, may or may not cause every spectator.

The Contents
This book was written as a comedy critical to
elucidate the growing Brazilian programs dedicated to laughter.

There is also
corroboration regarding some aspects of sex tourism, the period of
popularization of art via social medias and the question of tastes and
identification for every style of music.
This time, the editing was done by a São Paulo company that would give me a better margin in publications and greater freedom of choice in the layout.
The cover was made by me, the detail is in the author's name, which is pushed out of the case, implying that there was an error in editing, but is not. This was indeed the expected effect to give the idea of the lack of space for the author in the book market.
In fact, the book's narrative that's about it, take things seriously while everyone is joking around. Trust in own work and potential.

Link
http://www.livrorama.com.br/loja/details.php?p=341





MUSICAL CIRCUIT


Some photos taken five years of work as a singer, producer and band concerts.MOFO BAR, LAPA

On the first floor of the old house is the bar with 130 seats.
I remember arriving at the last minute this day, for the soundcheck and also we replaced our drummer, who was having personal problems and can not attend.
Was a day of great hardship, however overcome. The show was very good and people loved our copyright songs.




SALOON 79, BOTAFOGO


The saloon 79, is a rock bar very popular in Botafogo. The only rule of the place is, playing rock and play loud. The place team was very competent and treated us very well.
Three bands performed on this day and the house was very crowded in the middle of our presentation.
When I arrived, there were not many people and i worried, but this time we had no problems and all members attended, everything happened as expected.



SESC, ENGENHO DE DENTRO

Festival of independent bands supported by the state board.
Tonight we did a forty-five minute set, with copyright songs I wrote in a week.
I remember that the band worked hard on the songs and our bass player can not participate because it was in Minas Gerais, waiting for the birth of your child.
Two new members were called, and a friend of ours, flutist, made appearances on some songs.
Ended the night in Lapa, to do a brief celebration. It was a very special day for us.


ODYSSEY THEATRE
We were headlining the night, remember it was a weekend, the house was packed.
It was my last show with this band before falling by late nights writing my educational project and working day in the bureaucratic part of it.
I kept a very good material for future release so my appointments in my cultural project finish.



GRAPHICS DESIGN

LOGOS

Two figures created for my audiovisual production company. A enterprise logo and a published banner.


SHIRTS


Some shirts I have for free distribution and dissemination of the project.
The prints were dotted with critical sense. The colors pleased me a lot.
HUMANITY
CLEANUP
NEED
A BETTER BRAZIL



ABOUT MY EDUCATIONAL PROJECT WITH CULTURAL MINISTRY

I have developed a cultural project called "Poesia na Música" (Poetry in Music), which was recently approved by the Brazilian Ministry of Culture,  in accordance with the Rouanet Law, article 26,  allowing us - according to the standards of "Rouanet" Law, article 26 - the sponsorship opportunity through Donations, Tax Waiver or Federal Tax Incentives to fundraising revolving around R$ 340,580.00,  around US$ 150,000.00. 
As still could not get a sponsor, I decided do this crowdfunding to reduce the amount required to 1/3, which is precisely what is necessary to start.


Cultural details of the project
In the next semester, we will launch our website " POESIA NA MÚSICA", presenting to the world the icons of Brazilian popular musical poetry and the history of our music. They will be listed by the decade in which they acted, from the 1920' icon and pioneer, Heitor Villa Lobos.
 Villa-Lobos engaged in what is the most significative popular music genre, featured in the most important group of Brazilian poet-musicians.  
Our project will be made available in both Portuguese and English, welcoming users from different parts of the world. We will also elaborate subtitled videos enabling the inclusion of the hearing and visually impaired.
There will be space for debates, sharing material about the subjects in the scope of the website and also poetry contests. A dynamic and practical way to spread knowledge and the perpetuation of our culture. 
The project aims at strengthening cultural, to be able in the near future, meet the social sphere.

Details of the Advertising Project
The website should attract around 2,000 to 6,000  viewers daily, generating around 800,000 monthly visits (see technical report issued by the Ministry of Culture attached). 





Technical report issued by the Ministry of Culture



This is the system that puts me in direct contact with Cultural Ministry-Brasilia (Salic Web), is where i do all the procedures, shipping documents, do spreadsheets, calculate budgets, payroll and some other things.

Doing a bit of effort you can calmly analyze the numbers and even data. The print was small, but you can get a sense of the magnitude of it.

Dear, I must say that I'm working for two long years, going for three in this system. I also researched a lot about social security and IRS because these types of projects go through a big supervision, the project can suffers audit if i fail and all my 2004 work to date can down the drain with my credentials.

Here you can see closer the specifications. Are in Portuguese, but I think there is nothing to worry about, since it is quite simple to understand.


Project Budget Worksheet


As you can see, we need to cover all these areas with the best professionals.
If you want to contact, visit our website, leave a message.
Our email address is at the bottom.






Thank you in advance for your generous support - we really can't do this without you!BEST REGARDS!D. Barbosa MAGHEIZE CEO/FOUNDERmagheize@poesianamusica.com
poesianamusica.com

story:
Cymagica at Gratifly!


The purpose and scope of the cymagica art installation series is to give participants a multisensory comprehension of the sounds that are occurring all around and within them at any moment, in a live and interactive setting.


What is Cymatics?

Sound can be made visible through the vibration of various materials, from water to oils, to sugars and sands, creating resonance patterns that give rise to symmetry, form, and pattern, mimicking various cosmic functions from simple ripple effects, to spiraling galaxy formations, to the organization of cellular organisms… all can be seen within the patterns created by sound interference, showing the sacred resonant processes that shape and connect us all.


Why is this important?

Sound has been used for millennia as a healing force, mentally, physically, and spiritually. Various multitudes of instruments have been crafted, such as didgeridoos, tuning forks, and song bowls, to channel the natural vibrations of the universe and return flow and pattern to the physical body. By merging technology and these ancient practices, we are able to create our own devices as incredible tools and visual aids that educate and inspire individuals on a variety of different levels. Since my own discovery of cymatics within the water I placed in my Tibetan bowls during my practice, I have delved deep into personal study, experimentation, and creation in an attempt to share this harmonious resonance with all.


The Opportunity at hand

This year we have the unique experience to bring this project to life at an incredible event ~Gratifly Music and Arts Festival. We want to make this experience available to a large audience, and collaborate with live music being fed from the stages. The fruition of this project would add a physical visualization of sound at an event that until now has only been done with digital media. We will also be creating an entirely interactive area for YOU to come play!



Interaction with the crowd

We will be providing instruments from guitars to synthesizers, microphones, and other implements of sonic oscillation to allow participants to see their OWN vibrations reflected back at them, and we would love to invite any musician (vocalist, instrumentalist, or even DJ!) or non-musician alike to bring their gifts and instruments to patch into the sound board we will be providing.

Humble Beginnings

What We Need

In order to create the installation we want to see, we need your help! By supporting this project, you are helping us to spread our passion and knowledge of cymatics with the world.

For Gratifly festival, we will be building a new cymatics device from the ground-up onsite. This requires materials such as powered amplifiers and speakers, waterproofing materials, and construction materials for the base of the device. We will also need to build a weather structure from bamboo and tarp.

To broadcast the imagery, we will need an HD projector and screen.We also need various vibratory media, such as fluids and particulate matter.


Here is a comprehensive list of our needs in an itemized budget.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_9c3woNwFRju5GXDHHBdMFUyzrfiW1bgIwvZjToeqa4/edit?usp=sharing

The materials we will be vibrating include:

  • Water

  • Fluorescent Dyes

  • Glycerine (non-palm)

  • Vegetable Oil (non-palm)

  • Quartz Sand

  • Non-Newtonian fluids

  • Isopropyl

  • And of course... YOU!


This will be our sixth event performing cymatics, from small to large events, and no other event quite encapsulates the energy that Gratifly provides. In the hills of Lake Hartwell in South Carolina, Gratifly provides a vessel for personal growth and experience unlike any other. Coming early and helping build the stage and temple last year was one of the most inspirational experiences of my life, and I witnessed firsthand the power of the individual and the group to build dream into reality. This spurred me to share my gift with the live music community in a secretly educational, highly interactive and inspirational space. We would love to come inspire and show others how powerful following your dreams can be!



Thank you for your time and consideration! We're looking forward to playing around in our sonic playground with you. If you can't donate money, please consider donating your energy by sharing this campaign through social media.

See you at Gratifly! (((<3)))


Dustyn Archer

Cymagica Art Collective

dustynarcher@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Samoa. I was born in a small fishing village near Hiroshima, Japan. I moved to New York City in 1980 and became a pioneer of the East Village performance art scene, performing regularly in the Pyramid Club, Danceteria, Armageddon, ABC No Rio and other notorious underground spaces in the thriving art world of downtown 1980s New York. When I arrived to in NYC, I did not speak any English but I found a way to survive by being open and willing to try new things.  I am the co-founder and guitarist, with artist Kembra Pfahler, of the punk rock glam band The Voluptuous Horror of Karen Black. 

I’ve been working with oil paint for more than 17 years with an emphasis on politics, social issues, portraits and pets – and all with a kitsch but humorous sensibility. There are so many more paintings that I want and need to create to fulfill my vision but I've reached a point where I need your help to continue. The paintings I want to create will feature people who have lived on the edge, or outside of society, bravely, uniquely making their own path and creating legacies which provide hope and inspiration to people like me – people who feel different and have never been comfortable within the confines of social “norms” - outsiders like Bob Dylan, Andy Warhol, Kembra Pfahler, Antony Hegarty and Lou Reed.  Many of these creative pioneers died tragically and too young. All of them left enormous hope to people like me and made a strong mark on my mind and soul. Here's a shortlist of some of the inspiring people I want to paint:

  • Patti Smith
  • Gram Parsons
  • Vic Morrow
  • Mr. Rogers
  • Amy Goodman
  • Malcolm X
  • Princess Diana
  • Phillip Seymour Hoffman
  • Eleanor Roosevelt
  • Bob Ross
  • Cornel West
  • Yoko Ono
  • George Takei
  • John F Kennedy

This is the biggest project I have ever undertaken. It is very important to remember, especially young people, that our mind is not owned by anyone...yet. I want to bring vibrant art once again to the forefront of this great city that I love. Please help me to achieve this goal by being a vital part of it. Your contribution to this project will help in very real, tangible ways by giving me the ability to purchase materials, supplies and most importantly, time, to finish these portraits, photograph them and make fine art digital Giclée prints of all the work. I hope to exhibit the finished paintings in 2016. 

You can contribute any amount that you want. It will be greatly appreciated.

You can see examples of my paintings at http://lonelysamoans.com.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a listing of what I need:

  • canvases 
  • oil paints
  • acrylic paints
  • new brushes and paint supplies (mine are dead)
  • silk screens
  • occasional assistant
  • work space
  • high quality photographic documentation of the finished paintings
  • fine art Giclée prints of original artworks to be offered for sale

Details are sent by request.

    Contributors will receive the following in return:
    • $25 - you will get 1 Andy Warhol portrait post card.
    • $150 - you will get 1 Andy Warhol portrait post card and your name will be listed as patron at future show. (optional)
    • $500 - You will get one 8" x 10" Glclée print of Andy Warhol portrait plus 5 Andy Warhol portrait post cards. Your name will be listed as patron at future show. (optional)
    • $1000 - you will get one beautifully framed 11" x 14" Glclée  print of Andy Warhol portrait plus 10 Andy Warhol portrait post cards. Your name will be listed as patron at future show. (optional)
    • $3000 - I will paint your portrait on woodcut panel plus 30 Andy Warhol portrait post cards. Your name will be listed as patron at future show. (optional)
    If I don't meet my goal, I will do my best to complete this project within the money raised. It will take a little longer but I will not stop. I was DIY before it was trendy! If you can't contribute, that's cool, I get it, New York is too damned expensive! - but please share this on all of your social media hook-ups and help me out. That would be great.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you are not able contribute, please spread the word! Please tell everyone that you know.

        Thank you so much.

story:
Art Residency Station @ Ablon 

For the past 20 years, the building of l'ancienne gare marchande, or the old freight loading station, in Ablon (just 15 minutes away from the centre of Paris, France), has served as an atelier for artists from all over the world.

History

Australian band Dirty Three, as well as their front man Warren Ellis; French band Ez3kiel, and Croatian band Darko Rundek & his Cargo Orchestra (to name just a few) have all chosen the facilities to write, record and perform their music. Numerous visual, video and performing artists, writers, photographers, and designers have also been drawn to this unique creative space. The venue even hosted a birthday party for the esteemed French philosopher Alain Badiou, with the help of his colleague Jacques Rancière.

Ablon is close to Paris’ city centre, yet still completely isolated.It has a history as a birthplace for exquisite art and a thoroughly welcoming ambience. Its stone walls create an amazing acoustic. And, handily, there are no neighbors to complain about noise!

Clear and Present Danger

For the last two decades, the French branch of SKROZ, a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit under French law, has been leasing the building from the French Rail Network (RFF). In the last X years, maintenance costs have grown so high that SKROZ can no longer both care for the venue and offer it to artists at affordable fees.

Unless we can swiftly make l'ancienne gare marchande self-sustainable (and by “swiftly,” we mean within the next two months), the venue will be either torn down or converted into commercial storage. Yet another valuable and historic arts space will be lost.

Future

We are now seeking vital support to not only preserve the Gare d’Ablon, but to turn it into a residency venue that will enable artists from all over the world to have a space in Paris, the arts capital of Europe, that can be used for both work and cultural events.

In order to achieve that, we need to renovate and refurbish the space.  It has to be made habitable as well as fun to work in. The necessary permits must be applied for and obtained.  Most importantly, we hope to build a network of supporters that will enable us to acquire the building from its current owner.

With your help, Ablon's currently single 100m2 large and 8m high atelier, with separate kitchen and bathroom, would turn into a two-tiered double bedroom residency with a 100m2 of co-working space, sound studio and a garden to match.

All improvements will be done to the highest environmental standards, and the mezzanine will be built exclusively out of re-usable wooden blocks in to create both warm & functional environments, as well as keep the unique acoustics of the space.

Every three months, there will be an open call for applications, with successful applicants being offered a residency in Ablon, with lengths varying from a week to a month.

The residents would then be able to live and work in Ablon, just a 15 minutes RER C ride away from Place Saint Michel in Paris. The atelier is a delightful environment for workshops, presentations, meetings and social gatherings.

Furthermore, we will create a communication platform and a newsletter for the Art Residency Station @ Ablon alumni, so our past and future tenants can share both their work and plans, creating new partnerships on their own.

Not All Contributions Need to be $!

We are excited and thankful that you’ve read this far. We are immensely grateful if you chose to donate to our vision. If you can’t, we’re very grateful for your interest – and we ask you to please help us get the word out!

Please like us on Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/theskroz

Please follow us on Twitter:

https://twitter.com/betaskroz

Please follow us on Instagram:

https://instagram.com/skroz

And, Thank You.

Pass the word along about our indiegogo campaign using the site’s share tools!

About Ablon 

Ablon-sur-Seine is a commune in the Val-de-Marne department in the southeastern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 15.3 km (9.5 mi) from the center of Paris and 8km from the ParisOrlyAirport.

First mentioned in the 12th century, Ablon developed as a trading port for timber, coal, and especially Beaujolais wine, but by the 19th century became a resort for the Parisians, a place where they came to spend their holydays and  swim in the Seine (while it was still clean). It has kept the same residential character to this day.

Ablon today has a couple of great boulangeries or bakeries, as well a great butcher shop, a bodega and a pharmacy, all within a walking distance of Gare’d Ablon.

There are also a number of restaurants in the neighborhood – Chinese, Japoneese, Portuguese and – of course – French.

 

About Us

Vedran Peternel

 

Born in 1967 in Zagreb, Croatia, Vedran Peternel has been living in Paris, France, since 1979, exploring different aspects of sound as a form of an artistic expression.

 

 

 

As a FOH engineer, Peternel has collaborated on projects with such bands as:

  • Dirty Three (European tour with PJ Harvey), and
  • Theo Hakola (French and European tours, European tour with NickCave and the Bad Seeds).

As a studio sound engineer and producer, with:

  • Dirty Three on the album Lowlands
  • Ezekiel on the albums Barbary and Naphtaline
  • High Tone on the album Bass Temperature
  • Hurleurs on the album Ciel d’Encre
  • Warren Ellis (Dirty Three, Grinderman, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds) on a Cadbury’s Flake advert.


As a musician and producer with:

Darko Rundek Cargo Orkestar, recording, mixing and co-producing albums Ruke and Mhm Aha Oh Yeah Da Da (published by Piranha Musik – Berlin), as well as performing the same material live, among many other places in Europe, at Centre Pompidou.


As a sound art pedagogue with:

  • Le FAIR (Fonds d'action et d'initiative rock), action fund created in 1989 at the initiative of the French Ministry of Culture,  coaching young French bands in recording and mixing techniques
  • Pulsart organization, engaged in multimedia workshops with troubled adolescents in French prisons and halfway houses.

 

Vedran Peternel hosted and edited the music show Telegram on the French International Radio (RFI) for more than 15 years, and is the co-author and sound designer of radio-documentaries:

  • The Gate of Europe (co-produced by Danish, Croatian and Bulgarian National Radio),
  • Mars Over Zagreb (ABC, Australia) and
  • An ABC of the Night (BBC, UK).


Vedran was also the audio consultant for the Who is Mr. Waxman, an audio novel by Barbara Browning, as well as a sound designer for:

  • Marat/Sade, a production of the Ulysses Theatre founded by Rade Serbedzija on Brijuni Islands in Croatia
  • War – Memento mori, a documentary about the painter Edo Murtić commissioned by Museum of Contemporary Art in Zagreb, Croatia

In 2005, Vedran started a multi-annual collaboration with the writer and dramaturge Ivana Sajko on the project Autoreferential readings, sound designing and performing lectures of the author’s work.

In 2007 he composed and performed music for her play Archetype : Medea  (Trilogy : Medea, Women-Bomb, Europe – Zagreb Youth Theatre, Croatia) and in 2010 he composed the music, sound designed and performed the production of her play Rose is a rose, is a rose, is a rose (Zagreb Youth Theatre & Istrian National Theatre, Croatia).

In 2010 Vedran’s French non-profit organization KAAN merged with Croatian SKROZ collective, and he has been creating performing arts projects for it ever since: from @BetaSkroz to theatrical productions for children and young audiences La Poule aux oeufs d'or and La belette entrée dans un grenier, to the most recent project – Forrest, Timber, Hardly, Quite after Nin Andrews’ Book of Orgasms.

 

Nora Krstulović

Nora Krstulović was educated as a theatre director but with a background in IT and management, she has over the years taken a number of top management positions within the theatre & film community in Croatia.

 

 

 

 

As a communications director for:

  • Dubrovnik Summer Festival (2000 - 2004)
  • Ministry of Culture of Republic of Croatia & International Network on Cultural Policy Annual Conference (2003)
  • Croatian Institute for Movement and Dance (2006 – 2009)
  • Dance Week Festival (2006 – 2009)
  • Zagreb Dance Centre (2008 – 2010)
  • Motovun Film Festival (2011)
  • Perforations Festival (2012)
  • IETM Plenary Meeting Zagreb (2012).


and as the executive producer for:

  • Pula Film Festival (2005)


Nora is also the founder and Editor-In-Chief of the Teatar.hr the largest performing arts web magazine (2002 – present) in Eastern Europe, and was the Editor-In-Chief of film magazine  Filmski.net (2007 - 2008) and Croatian cultural events monthly Sonda (2007 – 2008). She was a columnist for the Croatian political weekly magazine Forum (2011. – 2012.), and continues to be a contributor to a large number of regional publications.

Nora was a mentor at one of the most important festivals for young playwrights in Europe, Interplay Europe (2006), and to this day is a guest lecturer at the Academy of Drama Arts in Zagreb teaching a class in communication strategies, as well a lecturer for the  Education and Teacher Training Agency, a public institution responsible for the provision of professional and advisory support in the area of general education in Croatia.

However, she claims her true calling is in performing arts, and to prove it she has directed and produced (*) a large number of performances including:

  • Simona D. Paltinuš: Asphyxia Violenta
    play, SKUC / GDK Gavella (1992)*
  • E. Ionesco: The Bold Soprano
    play, Europski dom (1994) *
  • E. Ioneco: The Bold Soprano
    play, Dubrovnik/Zagreb, Teatar &TD / Rozatuna*
  • Patrick Marber: Closer
    play, GDK Gavella (1997)
  • Jurica Pavičić: Poisoner
    play, Croatian National Theatre Split (2000)
  • Jasen Boko: Luka – The Magic Master
    play, Mala scena (2005)
  • Steve Thompson: Damages
    play, Mala scena (2005)
  • Samuel Beckett: Breath
    play, Kultura promjene / Kubus Kartel (2006)*
  • Skroz
    devised theatre, Kultura promjene / Kubus Kartel (2006)*
  • TV Skroz
    devised theatre, Kultura promjene / Skroz (2007)*
  • Mirela Ivičević: Za tri lipe
    opera, Music Biennale Zagreb, Kultura promjene (2007)
  •  Tinta, let i topla voda
    devised theatre, Ludens teatar (2008)
  • Paul Hindemith: Hin und zurück
    opera, Art Agent (2008)
  • Pop, Skroz
    devised theatre, Skroz / Kultura promjene (2009)*
  • Brutalno, Skroz
    performance, Skroz (2009)*
  •  Predajte se s nama
    performance, Skroz (2009)*
  •  PopSkroz 2.0
    devised theatre, Skroz (2010)*
  •  A.W. Mozart, A. Salieri, V. Peternel, M.Sviben, N.Krstulović: S & M
    opera, Art Agent / Skroz (2010)*
  • Win/Win
    lecture performance, Kultura promjene/ SKROZ (2011)*

In 2005 with dramaturg Maja Sviben, Nora founded the art collective SKROZ.

Since 2010 all of her performing arts projects have been produced by SKROZ  as the result of a creative partnership with Vedran Peternel, including @BetaSkroz, several productions for children and young audiences like La Poule aux oeufs d'or and La belette entrée dans un grenier, and most recently – Forrest, Timber, Hardly, Quite after Nin Andrews’ Book of Orgasms.

 

SKROZ

 

SKROZ in an art collective whose work is not limited to one medium, artistic discipline or genre. It is a group of authors working as a team to a maximum extent (ergo the name of the collective – SKROZ), in situations where authorship is a product of collective work or the ones where the limits of singular authorship can not be determined.

 

SKROZ was founded by director Nora Krstulović and dramaturge Maja Sviben, later succeeded by Vedran Peternel, involving a large number of associates from various artistic disciplines, with its opus ranging from theatrical shows and performances (‘Brutalno, skroz’, ‘Ponedjeljkom, soba 303′, ‘Pop, skroz’, ‘Tamo i natrag’, ‘Tinta, let i topla voda’, ‘Opera za tri lipe’, ‘@BetaSkroz’, ‘Forrest, Timer, Hardly, Quite’),  to creations in a number of other mediums, especially on-line.
