story:
Hi I'm Tobin Louise Reimer, help me make books and prints!

I'm starting on online store to sell my work and also have been accepted into the art fair that corresponds with Pop Montréal and need help covering the printing costs for these endeavors. I am a 24 year old artist living in Montréal whose work explores femininity, gender, nature, solitude, and relationships. I work in pencil, ink and watercolour primarily, in a delicate, illustrative style. I am making two books, one a collaboration with Noe Bagshaw about the uncomfortable sides of athletics and womanhood, and another illustrations of Greek Myths.

I graduated from Emily Carr University in 2011 in Visual Arts and have been working on drawings and paintings since then. I have participated in numerous shows in British Columbia, the Yukon, and now Quebec! I am working hard on the drawings for these publications but need help kicking off the printing costs. The more money I raise, the better the books will look, and maybe I can send you one! Books are a great way to showcase art and house ideas, can be shared with your friends, are light and portable, and fun! 

 

I'm going to be printing two books, one illustrations of Greek myths, and another with my fellow artist Noe Bagshaw exploring the complexities of femininity, the awkwardness of athletics, and the trials and tribulations of living in a bilingual city.
I need $500 so I have enough books to sell at Puces Pop, the art fair that I am participating in, as well as making high quality art prints of various other works to sell. The books and the prints will also be available on my online store for purchase. This will also help cover the cost of promotional items such as business cards and postcards. 

Depending on how much you pledge, you will receive a postcard, a book, or even a unique piece of art. Your contribution will help me, as an artist, focus on my art and not have to worry about where funding is coming from. 

As a young working artist, it is often hard to financially back your endeavors while having time to work on them. Ideally, these are fused, but being an artist early in my career, I haven't reached this goal yet. I am pursuing a career in illustration and this will be a great venue for me to spread the word and meet a lot of people, especially with your help! 

I am always working on new drawings and right now I would like to take action to publish two small volumes that will collect and document some exciting collections of new images and artworks! The books will be soft-cover zines, with sewn bindings and clear printing. The prints will be on archival artist paper so that they last and you can continue to enjoy them in years to come. 

Being an artist, I must rely somewhat on the public to help continue doing what I love and sharing it with people that I love! Please help me reach my goal! Please share this campaign with others, and and if you're in Montréal, come see me at Puces Pop on May 31st! https://www.facebook.com/events/140907449429174/
story_txt:
Hi I'm Tobin Louise Reimer, help me make books and prints!
I'm starting on online store to sell my work and also have been accepted into the art fair that corresponds with Pop Montréal and need help covering the printing costs for these endeavors. I am a 24 year old artist living in Montréal whose work explores femininity, gender, nature, solitude, and relationships. I work in pencil, ink and watercolour primarily, in a delicate, illustrative style. I am making two books, one a collaboration with Noe Bagshaw about the uncomfortable sides of athletics and womanhood, and another illustrations of Greek Myths.
I graduated from Emily Carr University in 2011 in Visual Arts and have been working on drawings and paintings since then. I have participated in numerous shows in British Columbia, the Yukon, and now Quebec! I am working hard on the drawings for these publications but need help kicking off the printing costs. The more money I raise, the better the books will look, and maybe I can send you one! Books are a great way to showcase art and house ideas, can be shared with your friends, are light and portable, and fun! 
 


I'm going to be printing two books, one illustrations of Greek myths, and another with my fellow artist Noe Bagshaw exploring the complexities of femininity, the awkwardness of athletics, and the trials and tribulations of living in a bilingual city.I need $500 so I have enough books to sell at Puces Pop, the art fair that I am participating in, as well as making high quality art prints of various other works to sell. The books and the prints will also be available on my online store for purchase. This will also help cover the cost of promotional items such as business cards and postcards. 
Depending on how much you pledge, you will receive a postcard, a book, or even a unique piece of art. Your contribution will help me, as an artist, focus on my art and not have to worry about where funding is coming from. 
As a young working artist, it is often hard to financially back your endeavors while having time to work on them. Ideally, these are fused, but being an artist early in my career, I haven't reached this goal yet. I am pursuing a career in illustration and this will be a great venue for me to spread the word and meet a lot of people, especially with your help! I am always working on new drawings and right now I would like to take action to publish two small volumes that will collect and document some exciting collections of new images and artworks! The books will be soft-cover zines, with sewn bindings and clear printing. The prints will be on archival artist paper so that they last and you can continue to enjoy them in years to come. 


Being an artist, I must rely somewhat on the public to help continue doing what I love and sharing it with people that I love! Please help me reach my goal! Please share this campaign with others, and and if you're in Montréal, come see me at Puces Pop on May 31st! https://www.facebook.com/events/140907449429174/

story:
Among more than 600 aplicants, this year i got accepted to take part of an amazing intensive summer programme that is goint to take place in  The US (New York).

The place is called "The Watermill Center International Summer Program" created by Robert Wilson.(at the end you also have some links with more details regarding the programme and Robert Wilson too).

There is a grant that is covering me the participatin fee and also the accomodation there but all the other expenses (flight tickets, visas and any other expense there are not covered).

I trully believe my participation for this programme (mid July - mid August), will help me devolop my artistic skills more and i am looking forward not to miss this opporunity.

Best regards

Links:

http://www.watermillcenter.org/summer/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Wilson_(di...

You also have here some links including my artistic work in the last couple of years:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JH-JH95_jvk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=79iI43qpQSs

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3uaCpGFfS6I

story:
Hello, Indiegogo!! BilletSPIN, here! 

When we sat down to create something new for you, our one goal was to take precision top design to another level. Machining together pieces made of different materials to create a balanced, long-spinning top takes care, expertise, and a superior level of craftsmanship.

Complex designs like these are one of our specialties, so when it came to pushing limits, this is where we pressed. We could have stopped at a 2-piece design. Three? Now four would be amazing, but we couldn't stop there!

We are very pleased to introduce you to the Matrix, a precision top made of 9 PIECES!!

The Design

That is not a typo. The Matrix is made up of 9 separate pieces! To put that in context, our best-selling top, the K2, was 3 pieces. The additional pieces of the Matrix are so expertly balanced that its performance isn't hindered by the complexity--both boast similar top spin times of about 7-10 minutes in our tests.

See for yourself! Full Length Spin video:

So, what are the 9 pieces? There are 4 main components: two outer collars, an inner disc, and a stem. The two outer collars are aligned using 5 stainless steel dowel pins.

These pins align the spoke patterns on each collar and the diagonal hash marks on the outside perimeters. 

Next we focused on the stem. It needed to have a great grip yet fit well with the overall theme of the top.

On the top of the stem sits a 5-point star that is hand aligned to the spoke pattern on the outer collar. Each serration on the grip is individually machined. Below the grip, we feature a "barbed wire" pattern to complement the aggressive style of the design!

In order to give the Matrix the best performance and durability, we chose to use a Tungsten Carbide bearing ball for the contact point. Through extensive testing, we have found this to be the absolute best material for this purpose!

The Matrix is 1.2" in diameter and weighs between 50-60 grams. 

The Matrix is offered exclusively on Indiegogo in standard material combinations. Each of the 25 different material combinations boasts its own visual appeal as well as a unique weight and feel. Made from stainless steel (SS), copper (Cu), and/or bronze (Br), the combinations take on a life of their own.  

Here at BilletSPIN, we pride ourselves on making precision tops to the highest of quality standards. Due to the amount of machining and material fluctuations, your Matrix may experience a slight flutter. We will not refund or replace due to flutter. Thank you.

See the perks on the right side of the screen for full material descriptions. Materials are listed from outside to inside (outer collar/inner disc/stem).

 

Video of all 25 combos:

 

How to order

Ready to order? On the right side of the page, you will see a list of perks. Move your mouse over the perk you would like to receive. Click on "Get this perk." Fill out your information and click "Submit payment." Feel free to purchase as many perks as you like.

After placing you order, just sit back and relax. The only other thing we ask is for you to accept our sincerest gratitude. Thank you so much for your support!

Fulfillment

Once the campaign ends, we will begin shipping. As that happens, we'll be sending email shipping confirmations. The estimated delivery for these tops is in July, 2017.  

Here at BilletSPIN, we're proud of reliably fulfilling all of our campaigns. Customer service is a top priority for us, so please reach out if you have any questions! 

About Us

My name is Rich Stadler. I've been a machinist for over 25 years, and for me, there is nothing better than finding what is hiding in a raw bar of material. My passion for creating functional art with metal drove me to start BilletSPIN in March, 2015. In 2016, it became my full-time job. Being able to bring my work to you in this way is an incredible blessing.

BilletSPIN is a family-owned business that specializes in everyday carry (EDC) items. The most popular of these projects have been our precision tops. EDC means our tops are small enough to fit in your pocket, but their artistic design and long spin times render them interesting enough warrant a prized place on your desk for all to see. 

From the start, we've machined all of our products in our shop located in Wisconsin. Thanks to our customers, BilletSPIN has grown, and so has the team supporting it. A variety of individuals from machinists to a graphic designer now come together to ensure BilletSPIN continues to offer top of the line products made and launched with the same kind of passion that started this company in the first place.

Our Past Projects

BilletSPIN launched with a Kickstarter campaign called Billet Dice. The project succeeded, and we completed fulfillment within a month of the end of the campaign. Next, we introduced precision tops. Due to their popularity, we started making top designs every few weeks and selling them in a group called Pocket Top Talk. We also did a Kickstarter last year called Worry Tokens. On Indiegogo, we launched the BilletSPIN Spheres and precision tops Navigator and K2. Our most popular seller to date, the K2 raised over $400,000. We completed fulfillment of the K2 in 6 weeks after the end of the campaign.

Stay in Touch

If you would like to stay up to date with future designs and all things BilletSPIN related, check out our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/391445661039396/

Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxZbMn2n7KTg83...

Website: www.billetspin.com

or follow Billetspin_tops on Instagram

story:
*We've reached 122% of our campaign goal!  

So, we've been putting the funds to good work already friends!   Check out some pictures from our facebook page:

- We hosted our first exhibition with our new gallery lighting!

- We've purchased and received our new print making press!

And we've purchased and received our new video projector, and are working with a pro on the sound system installation.

We hope you enjoy (are enjoying) your perks!   And in case you missed it, here's a video of us making your prints.

Thanks again for helping us make this happen!  

- the GOA team (Jeff, Rachel, and Peter)


Green Olive Arts is an international art studio and urban art residency in Tetouan, Morocco, specializing in connecting the creatives of the world with the culture, beauty and creatives of Morocco. With 2 years under our belt, Green Olive Arts (GOA) has already begun to buzz as a hub of artistic research, production, and collaboration for artists from many countries. We love doing this! Now, as we head into our 3rd year, we are excited to expand the services we offer and the breadth of reach we have among the world's traveling artists, painters, printmakers, filmmakers and writers.

In addition to 3 large studios, a kitchen, resource room and wood shop, we have a 102 square foot multi-purpose space where we have already hosted a few great exhibitions and workshops. Now we are ready to take that space to the next level!

We plan to add a printmaking set-up, quality gallery lighting and an integrated audio/video projection system to equip our Artists in Residence (AiRs) to better achieve their creative goals and more effectively share their work with the community.

To make that happen we are asking you to help us outfit this space! 

UPDATE: We have been overwhelmed with the outpouring of support for this project so far, helping us reach 100% in the first 6 days! So we are going to ride this wave of generosity and shared vision for the arts in Morocco, and set a stretch goal, that will enable us to do even more! 
We've reached our original goal of $4,800 !!!,  so we're going to expand our studio with the printmaking, gallery lighting and a/v system set-up described below.
BUT NOW, if we reach $8,300, we will expand to be able to host 2 additional artists beyond our current capacity, which means buying all the needed furnishings for 2 more studio spaces. We will also design and have local craftsman build other needed pieces, like a work station above a large flat file for storing printmaking paper,  a mobile work bench for the wood shop,  a storage unit for supplies and equipment, and bookshelves for the art library in our resource room.
  • Printmaking Press and Setup 

    - $2400

     

    A mobile printmaking studio with a hand-cranked intaglio press, drying racks, and all the tools that will allow us to host printmakers and provide other resident artists with the opportunity to experiment in printmaking techniques during their time in the studios. It will be mobile so it can be used in any studio space and hidden away for exhibitions.

  • Exhibition Lighting - $600

         The GOA gallery is increasingly in demand! This space is currently lit by dual-spectrum florescent fixtures for workshops and gatherings, but it is in great need of a specialized lighting system to illuminate artworks displayed on the gallery walls with balanced full spectrum light. We will install 10 energy-efficient, color balanced, LED lights as well as 'dimmable' spots for performances and object lighting.
  • Video Projection and Sound System - $1500

     We have had a lot of inquiries from artists working in sound and digital art. We plan to install a quality digital video projector and sound system to equip us to host screenings of the works of AiR filmmakers, digital media artists, animators and other artists who use digital images and sound in their art.  This system will also allow us to participate as a venue in some of the big film festivals that take place here in Tetouan.


Our goal is to have it all in place and ready to use by this Summer when we dive into a busy season with resident artists. Much of the set-up has already been done and now we just need these key components to bring it all together! That's where you come in.  We are inviting you, our fans and friends who believe in what we are doing, to join us in this exciting step forward!

The groundwork is done... we're already wired, powered and ready to install.

What do you say? Are you up for joining us in taking this to the next level? 

We want to say thank you to YOU
For backing this project, we want to thank you with some carefully chosen, cool personal perks that carry a taste of Morocco and our own artistic touch.  Check them out  on the right sidebar and know that we'll be getting them ready just for you, because we SO appreciate you standing with us in this!

If you don't know us yet and have just happened on this page, please check us out at www.GreenOliveArts.com and spread the word!

Thank You ahead of time on behalf of the countless artists who will be coming to Morocco for a residency at Green Olive Arts!

Jeff, Rachel, and Peter


Here's an extra little video we made for you, to help you share with us in the excitement we have about more artists getting to experience Morocco - YOU get to help make this happen!

The groundwork is done... we're already wired, powered and ready to install.

We want to say thank you to YOU

If you don't know us yet and have just happened on this page, please check us out at www.GreenOliveArts.com and spread the word!
Thank You ahead of time on behalf of the countless artists who will be coming to Morocco for a residency at Green Olive Arts!

Here's an extra little video we made for you, to help you share with us in the excitement we have about more artists getting to experience Morocco - YOU get to help make this happen!

story:
wzornik /'vzɔrɲik/ n. a catalogue of sample designs meant to be a guide for future projects

As people, we aim to live in a sustainable, conscious way - reducing what we have, reusing what we can. Accordingly, such aspects are important to us when, as content creators, we use quite a lot of paper: to write, to sketch, to keep a schedule or gather memories. That’s why in the summer of 2018 we started working on items for ourselves, putting to use our experience in design, art, and handcraft. At first it was a simple hobby. But as friends grew interested in our stuff and broader circles started asking if it’s available anywhere, this hobby turned into a real project. What you can see is the fruit of our intense work.

We’re wzornik, and we’re here to bring you a functional, ethically made, and beautifully crafted range of paper goods.

Let us introduce our first collection: closer. Designed with both functionality and sensory pleasure in mind, it includes two types of sketchbooks, where each type features three covers to choose from. All items were crafted by us at home, allowing us to care for every detail, resulting in an entirely Earth-friendly production.

The thinner type is made of 32 pages, neatly contained in citrus paper with a screenprinted design where each variant refers to a different summer mood. Handy, conveniently sized, and easy to carry around. The inside pages, all 100g/m, are made of corn paper, giving a lovely to touch rough texture with visible pieces. When it comes to our personal needs, we find it perfectly suited for quick notes, drafts, rough sketches and short thoughts. We kept the block blank - no lines, grids, or dots, so that you could fill it entirely as you prefer.

The thicker type has double the amount of space - it includes 64 corn pages of the same density and texture as the thinner one. Binded in a way which specifically allows for a flat opening so that every part of each spread can be used. There are three color variants for covers: either made from cherries, lavender or olives. In this sketchbook we focused on frugality, enhancing the functionality of the product. For this reason, we left the spine visible. It’s ideal for sketches, concepts, small illustrations, journaling and scrapbooking.

We took extreme care to choose the finest materials: what you get is not only high quality, but also produced without negative impact on your environment and surroundings.

All the paper we use contains organic by-products which replace up to 15 percent of virgin tree pulp typically used in standard paper production. It’s FSC-certified, GMO-free, contains post-consumer recycled waste (40%)  and is produced with EKOenergy, resulting in a 20% reduction in carbon footprint. That’s not the only thing which makes it our number one choice, obviously. As we really care about how well different tools perform on it, we’re happy to say that it’s perfect for a vast variety of fineliners, fountain pens, water-based markers, ink tools, pencils and crayons.

Screenprinting, or serigraphy if you like, is another part of our production. Using this method, we’re directly involved in the printing process with nobody else but us actually pressing ink through the screen. In addition, water-based ink allows us to create an entirely earth-friendly outcome. This wouldn’t be possible with regular printing services. And - as you might have realized by now - mass production isn’t our thing. An individual approach is key.

We take great care in choosing even such minor components of our sketchbooks like threads. Made of linen, they’re both durable and ecological. Linen has been used for centuries and is one of first choices for green-minded movements. The entire plant is utilized: instead of harvesting it through cutting, linen is uprooted and taken into production, where the only byproduct is dust forming through the process. On top of that, we really love the natural, rough texture which adds to overall sensory experience of holding our sketchbook in hands.

The experience we have mentioned a few times is not a random result. closer was inspired by a thick summer breeze, warmth of the season, lazy days, fresh seasonal fruits and many more. All parts of the product unify in one piece to reference motifs which remind us of days spent in summer. Each design was kept simple and “quiet” so that everyone can uncover their closer experience in their own way.

While working on this collection, we thought not only about our needs but also of those who share similar interests: artists, writers, creators, designers, DIY lovers, people who care about the environment, ethical work, those who support handcraft and local businesses.

wzornik is also a place for those who don’t know yet how to become a more conscious consumer. Nobody’s born an expert. We wish to set up a business and help in making choices easier for everyone, assuring that what they buy from us is ecologically fair. The high quality of our products comes from combining great materials with precise execution and a conscious, sustainable process to the very end - starting with first design decisions, ending with green delivery to your door.

Packed in ecological envelopes and shipped through an environmentally-friendly courier of our choice, your perk will take from 5 to 30 days to arrive, depending on your location. Since handcraft takes a while, we estimate to start working on perks by the beginning of February and begin delivery in March. All shipping costs are already included in each perk - there’s no hidden expenses. You will be notified about our progress via e-mail throughout the whole process and we’ll always be open to hearing from you in case of any questions.

After that, when wzornik gets in full swing, we aim to expand our work with other goods: new collections, paper products, artistic projects. There are already plans for posters, postcards and seasonal cards. Customisation will be an even bigger part of our plan to develop our offering. It’s important to us that you can get our products perfectly tailored to what you need and find exactly what you’re looking for. We care to give you full satisfaction without compromise.

To achieve all that, we need your support. This campaign is a necessary step towards establishing wzornik, as it comes with obvious costs: renting a studio, buying tools, setting up an online store and the whole taxes thing. Our goal is to stay independent as artists and as a business, which brings us here, to fund this through a crowdfunding campaign. We wish to create something together with you, our customers.

wzornik means a lot to us and our goal is to share it all with others. Your interest makes us incredibly happy - and we’re very grateful even for the smallest aid towards our cause.

Audio source by Lakey Inspired
story_txt: wzornik /'vzɔrɲik/ n. a catalogue of sample designs meant to be a guide for future projectsAs people, we aim to live in a sustainable, conscious way - reducing what we have, reusing what we can. Accordingly, such aspects are important to us when, as content creators, we use quite a lot of paper: to write, to sketch, to keep a schedule or gather memories. That’s why in the summer of 2018 we started working on items for ourselves, putting to use our experience in design, art, and handcraft. At first it was a simple hobby. But as friends grew interested in our stuff and broader circles started asking if it’s available anywhere, this hobby turned into a real project. What you can see is the fruit of our intense work.We’re wzornik, and we’re here to bring you a functional, ethically made, and beautifully crafted range of paper goods.Let us introduce our first collection: closer. Designed with both functionality and sensory pleasure in mind, it includes two types of sketchbooks, where each type features three covers to choose from. All items were crafted by us at home, allowing us to care for every detail, resulting in an entirely Earth-friendly production.The thinner type is made of 32 pages, neatly contained in citrus paper with a screenprinted design where each variant refers to a different summer mood. Handy, conveniently sized, and easy to carry around. The inside pages, all 100g/m, are made of corn paper, giving a lovely to touch rough texture with visible pieces. When it comes to our personal needs, we find it perfectly suited for quick notes, drafts, rough sketches and short thoughts. We kept the block blank - no lines, grids, or dots, so that you could fill it entirely as you prefer.The thicker type has double the amount of space - it includes 64 corn pages of the same density and texture as the thinner one. Binded in a way which specifically allows for a flat opening so that every part of each spread can be used. There are three color variants for covers: either made from cherries, lavender or olives. In this sketchbook we focused on frugality, enhancing the functionality of the product. For this reason, we left the spine visible. It’s ideal for sketches, concepts, small illustrations, journaling and scrapbooking.We took extreme care to choose the finest materials: what you get is not only high quality, but also produced without negative impact on your environment and surroundings.All the paper we use contains organic by-products which replace up to 15 percent of virgin tree pulp typically used in standard paper production. It’s FSC-certified, GMO-free, contains post-consumer recycled waste (40%)  and is produced with EKOenergy, resulting in a 20% reduction in carbon footprint. That’s not the only thing which makes it our number one choice, obviously. As we really care about how well different tools perform on it, we’re happy to say that it’s perfect for a vast variety of fineliners, fountain pens, water-based markers, ink tools, pencils and crayons.Screenprinting, or serigraphy if you like, is another part of our production. Using this method, we’re directly involved in the printing process with nobody else but us actually pressing ink through the screen. In addition, water-based ink allows us to create an entirely earth-friendly outcome. This wouldn’t be possible with regular printing services. And - as you might have realized by now - mass production isn’t our thing. An individual approach is key.We take great care in choosing even such minor components of our sketchbooks like threads. Made of linen, they’re both durable and ecological. Linen has been used for centuries and is one of first choices for green-minded movements. The entire plant is utilized: instead of harvesting it through cutting, linen is uprooted and taken into production, where the only byproduct is dust forming through the process. On top of that, we really love the natural, rough texture which adds to overall sensory experience of holding our sketchbook in hands.The experience we have mentioned a few times is not a random result. closer was inspired by a thick summer breeze, warmth of the season, lazy days, fresh seasonal fruits and many more. All parts of the product unify in one piece to reference motifs which remind us of days spent in summer. Each design was kept simple and “quiet” so that everyone can uncover their closer experience in their own way.While working on this collection, we thought not only about our needs but also of those who share similar interests: artists, writers, creators, designers, DIY lovers, people who care about the environment, ethical work, those who support handcraft and local businesses.wzornik is also a place for those who don’t know yet how to become a more conscious consumer. Nobody’s born an expert. We wish to set up a business and help in making choices easier for everyone, assuring that what they buy from us is ecologically fair. The high quality of our products comes from combining great materials with precise execution and a conscious, sustainable process to the very end - starting with first design decisions, ending with green delivery to your door.Packed in ecological envelopes and shipped through an environmentally-friendly courier of our choice, your perk will take from 5 to 30 days to arrive, depending on your location. Since handcraft takes a while, we estimate to start working on perks by the beginning of February and begin delivery in March. All shipping costs are already included in each perk - there’s no hidden expenses. You will be notified about our progress via e-mail throughout the whole process and we’ll always be open to hearing from you in case of any questions.After that, when wzornik gets in full swing, we aim to expand our work with other goods: new collections, paper products, artistic projects. There are already plans for posters, postcards and seasonal cards. Customisation will be an even bigger part of our plan to develop our offering. It’s important to us that you can get our products perfectly tailored to what you need and find exactly what you’re looking for. We care to give you full satisfaction without compromise.To achieve all that, we need your support. This campaign is a necessary step towards establishing wzornik, as it comes with obvious costs: renting a studio, buying tools, setting up an online store and the whole taxes thing. Our goal is to stay independent as artists and as a business, which brings us here, to fund this through a crowdfunding campaign. We wish to create something together with you, our customers.wzornik means a lot to us and our goal is to share it all with others. Your interest makes us incredibly happy - and we’re very grateful even for the smallest aid towards our cause.Audio source by Lakey Inspired

story:
Meet the Smartest Cat in the World

This is Stabatha, aka Cat Batman, aka Jolt Cola. She showed up on a friends porch, desperate to come inside. She's adorable and for some reason, nobody wants her. She's also FeLV positive -- which means that her lifespan is severely limited and she can't be with other cats. She's wants to sit under your legs, tell you a story and live whatever few years she has with you. 

I want to hire a series of out of work artists to draw pictures of her. Not just to help find her a home, but because there are artists who are out of work and it would be nice for out of work artists to get a paycheck. 

Everybody who contributes gets digital copies of all the drawings, and hopefully Stabatha finds a home and someone to love. 

Campaign drawing by Deanna Leist Aliano.

story:
The creation process is miraculous like nature, involves the inspiration via the view of Einav and thus creates a unique macular and symbolic jewelry.

She select carefully the wooden pieces that appear in the jewel disinfects polished and warms, after that the wood pieces shapes and decorated, finally it fixed and glaze wrapped.

Like in nature - each piece of jewelry is different.

"I choose to work with Oak, Olive pine and Eucalyptus which is itself a tree that symbolizes the settlement. of the Holly Land, because these trees appear in the holly bible verse and brings additional meaning to the wearing.

I wish that my art seeds from the land of Israel, will reach every place in the whole world".

Einav aspires to establish a factory for single mothers of 3 religions, in which they will create together.

This dream can not be realized without your support.

we would like to raise 18,811 USD so we can realize the dream and establish the factory where Einav was born by the donation of 39USDS you will receive one of the jewelry from the collection in a fancy delivery and you will be granted a tree planting on your name in Israel.

Together we can make the dream come true.

Wy we choose to raise 18,811 USD?

1st book

8th chapter

8-11:

8. Then he sent out a dove to see if the water had receded from the surface of the ground. 9 But the dove could find nowhere to perch because there was water over all the surface of the earth; so it returned to Noah in the ark. He reached out his hand and took the dove and brought it back to himself in the ark. 10 He waited seven more days and again sent out the dove from the ark. 11 When the dove returned to him in the evening, there in its beak was a freshly plucked olive leaf! Then Noah knew that the water had receded from the earth.

story:
We're Joy Dept., a group of grad students who believe in inspiring joyful human interaction. We're raising funds to help pay for the technology and materials needed to prototype and build our thesis project.

 

Picture this: it’s a cool summer evening, somewhere in the Colorado wilderness. You hear gentle pops and crackles coming from a fire, then the familiar muffled laughter of your closest friends. You smell the sweet, damp grass, the earthy pine logs burning in the fire, and even a hint of toasted marshmallows.

We want to recreate this familiar experience by designing an interactive public art installation. In doing this, we hope to bring people together, first by curiosity, then with delight, and then, through connection.

This one-of-a-kind interactive installation, themed like a campsite, will build and scale as more people participate. As more people join in, sensors will trigger sound and light, the flames of "campfire" will grow bigger and brighter, and other thematic stimuli will surprise and delight.

What We Need

To build our project, we are purchasing things like infrared sensors, speakers, computer equipment, and lumber. We've already started prototyping, and estimate that $3,200 should be enough to finish our build.

The Impact

For most of us, our public default behavior is to keep to ourselves. But sometimes, we’re interrupted. A random compliment from a stranger. A free cup of coffee. A beautiful piece of art that stops you in your tracks.

Our campsite will be another joyful interruption. By providing a comfortable environment and interesting stimuli, we can encourage more human connection.

Risks & Challenges

As we mentioned, we're grad students studying interaction design. This is one of our final projects. Our biggest challenges right now are securing the rest of the materials we need to complete construction.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help us!

We would greatly appreciate it if you'd help us to get the word out about our campaign, and don't forget those Indiegogo share tools!

Want to follow along with more of our story? Visit our website and follow us on Instagram!

story:
How do we create an installation that addresses and responds to the deep human desire to reach out beyond one's self? Can we create art that not only represents some of our deepest questioning about our place in the cosmos, but also allows us to send messages into the void?

In Case We Miss Each Other is our response to these questions. If you have ever wondered, "What else might be out there?" We are making this for you.

In Case We Miss Each Other is a 40' diameter structure of steel and kinetic movement, with intelligent lighting, recording, and laser communications systems.

It is the vision of artist Ilya Barannikov, founder of Soul Oceans.

What We Need

ICWMEO requires support for our construction materials as well as on-playa maintenance. If we meet our goal, here is how we will spend our funds:

$7,400: project materials and equipment

$3,250: transportation to and from Black Rock City

$3,000: insurance and engineering certificates

$4850: food and lodging for project crew, playa maintenance, and leave no trace expenses

If we do not meet our goal, we will have to reduce the complexity of the structure, as transportation costs and lodging expenses are fixed.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can make a tax-deductible donation to our project through the Burning Man Project, a 501(c)(3) organization. Click here to make a donation: https://connect.clickandpledge.com/Organization...

If you can not contribute financially, you can still help us out! Spread the word about our project and let the world know about it!

For those of you who will be joining us at Burning Man, we are excited for you to record your own message and have it sent out into space!

story:
We need help funding a Panda Oki animated cartoon promo. What is Panda Oki?

At its core, Panda Oki is about family, friends and and above all FUN!! Will children learn things?  Yes, I think it's a shame to have a child's full attention and not take that opportunity to show them about the world around them.  

Every panda in the Bamboo Crew has a personality kids can relate to, recognize in themselves, or in their own social circles. Like every child, each panda has grand aspirations and the drive to achieve, learning to use their strengths and their flaws to their advantage. 

With each story kids will learn what friendship can be, what joys life can bring and how to truly laugh from the heart. What better way to plant the seeds of a better tomorrow, than by carefully weaving these values into the stories they can love for a lifetime.

story:
Short Summary

Every spring the seniors of the MSU BFA program travel to Los Angeles to participate in the showcase that highlights our quality education and training. The important part of showcase are those who attend, LA Film and Theatre industry professionals and Missouri State alumni, giving the alumni the feeling that they left MSU in good, passionate hands and giving the industry pros the opportunity to give us our shot as we seek representation from them. That being said, its hard to get word out for those who work in the industry to come and see us at our showcase, this is where you can step in and help us achieve our goals. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your help comes into play here: Alumni panels, publicity, postcard invitations, mailing hundreds of head shots and resumes that we will be sending to industry professionals costs A LOT of money and it's what we spend all of our fundraising on. Every cent we earn goes directly to affording this.

The Impact

Your money is important so you need to know why its helping not only us but you as well. By contributing to our success at showcase you will be contributing to the future of art and all its forms, every single person you have seen in this video are passionate and driven. Our dreams and achievements, through your help, will be providing a future for our artistic community and those to come. Those who will continue to create and inspire others for all to enjoy. 

Risks & Challenges

Yes, every time we are asked what our majors are we get that "Good Luck" glance with our response.  People will always say we're crazy, but if you reference the top once again, we already know. Their will be plenty of challenges on the road ahead: officially moving to our major cities, getting representation, finding work, you name it. None of this is an easy task, AND our training that we have all received from Missouri State University is giving us the best foot forward to making these leaps and bounds happen. Between our abilities as actors and the knowledge of the field as it currently stands are our best weapons in the arsenal as we take on our future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we totally understand; we're poor college kids, we get it. But you can help us by spreading the word. By sharing and passing the message along we can keep pushing forward as we reach our goals. All we ask is that you stay tuned in with us and follow us on our social medias as Showcase comes near. 

THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING!!

story:
My name is Camila Salcedo, I am an art student in Halifax, NS. One of my main art interests is performance art. My work primarily deals with the complex layers of being a Latina immigrant living in Canada. The intersectionality of my identity as a racialized, white-passing body has lead me to create work focused on feminism, political activism, sexuality and Venezuelan-Canadian cultural identity. 

La Pocha Nostra is a 10-day International Performance Workshop taking place in Mérida, México in January of 2017. This workshop is led by Guillermo Gomez-Peña, a well-known Chicano performance artist. This year, I was selected as one of the 10 international artists that will join another 10 Mexican artists in the workshop. The workshop focuses and centres marginalized voices, creating an emphasis on art about race, ethnicity and cultural identity. Sharing a space and creating with fellow international performance artists, who are radical and like-minded, is going to be an amazing opportunity for me as an emerging artist.

As a student, this workshop would be quite expensive for me to participate in, and this is why I need financial help to be able to pay for the tuition ($850), flights ($800-1000) and accommodation ($400-800). The $2000, that I am hoping to raise through this campaign, will go towards covering those costs.

I travelled to Mexico City for the first time this past summer; It was the first time I had ever travelled alone. Travelling to Mexico as a young woman was very significant to me because I had never been back to Latin America since moving to Canada in 2007. Visiting the country made me feel a sense of home that I hadn’t felt in a very long time—I was able to speak my first language and I was able to connect with a culture that was more similar to my own. Having the ability to travel back to Mexico where I can participate in and create at La Pocha Nostra is my absolute dream!

By contributing to my campaign and helping me achieve my goal, you will be receiving hand crafted tropical-inspired objects!

Without this help I will not be able to fully afford to participate in this workshop and will be forced to take on debt that I simply cannot afford. If you are unable to contribute with money, please contribute by sharing widely with your communities. I would really appreciate it.

Thank you so much for taking interest in reading about my campaign!

story:
We show up to challenging places with art.

Everywhere we go we are met with the response that we have changed lives.

We need your support to keep this going. 

The sites where Mending Spirit projects are placed are often hugely underserved. They are locations where clients as well as caretakers are stressed and traumatized. They are places right in our community where there is little or no funding, time or energy for art.

Through firsthand experience we have learned that art of all kinds, as well as purposeful creative activity, reduces stress, stimulates the mind, comforts the body, and lifts the spirit.

Mending spirit shows up with light with color, movement and life.

Light that heals, color that soothes, movement that sparks.

We have been able to successfully bring our work to over 14 locations since our start in 2014.

Enable us to bring art for healing to four new locations this year.

With us, you can Show Up For Healing.

Every donation goes to the expense of making this happen. 

We have been to 16 locations in 2 years,

Where are we going next?

Anywhere where spirit needs mending, we will bring art for healing.

We are heading to shelters, recovery programs, prisons, schools, courthouses, chemotherapy infusion suites, children’s hospitals, hospice care for the homeless...

If you have trouble donating: Pay pal is where you are sent, but you don't have to use it, just add in your information for a credit card but then click continue without signing in, it will work. 

 

Mending Spirit is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Mending Spirit must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Mending spirit shows up with light with color, movement and life.
Light that heals, color that soothes, movement that sparks.
We have been able to successfully bring our work to over 14 locations since our start in 2014.
Enable us to bring art for healing to four new locations this year.
With us, you can Show Up For Healing.

Every donation goes to the expense of making this happen. 
We have been to 16 locations in 2 years, 
Where are we going next?
Anywhere where spirit needs mending, we will bring art for healing.
We are heading to shelters, recovery programs, prisons, schools, courthouses, chemotherapy infusion suites, children’s hospitals, hospice care for the homeless...
If you have trouble donating: Pay pal is where you are sent, but you don't have to use it, just add in your information for a credit card but then click continue without signing in, it will work. 
 
Mending Spirit is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Mending Spirit must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
On May 13 2015, my beloved Megan Mac turns 30.  

I want it to be a memorable year for her, and what better way to celebrate than by giving her the gift that NEVER goes away.  She has been talking about getting some kind of tattoo that covers her shoulder (like picture) ever since I've known her.  Unfortunately we've just never made time for it.  Nowadays... $600 is a lot of expendable money that we aren't really throwing out for things like this.   

If you have the means to pitch in for this ($20, $50, $100, anything), I'm sure she would greatly appreciate it.  We will be celebrating with a surprise party in May, and I would love to be able to gift her with this.

Thanks in advance for your consideration <3

story:
A Tarot Adult Coloring Book?

Greetings! The World Spirit Adult Coloring Book is STILL AVAILABLE! Visit us on amazon to order at http://www.amazon.com/World-Spirit-Tarot-Adult-Coloring/dp/1512173738/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1442324503&sr=8-1&keywords=world+spirit+tarot+coloring+book

If you ordered the new WST Adult Coloring Book AND the WST second edition deck and book kits, the kits are now scheduled for release in December. SO, we are mailing you your coloring book NOW, and the WST itself in a bit when we have it in our hands. I don't want to make you wait!

About the project! You may know my work from the 2001 edition of the multicultural World Spirit Tarot, or the more recent 2015 Reprint of the deck, funded here on Indiegogo. As part of that huge effort, I shared my black & white tarot art block-prints via social media. Seeing those images, some smart soul posited the idea of an Adult Coloring Book, and away we go... 

And with the wonders of self-publishing, this book is AFFORDABLE! 

  • Adult Coloring Books offer grown-ups a creative, beautiful and meaningful way to relax. The Tarot offers a wonderful tool for meditation. Combine the two and this Coloring Book brings these potent and timeless images home for folks like you to ENJOY!
  • Fun historical tidbit: I've been block-printing since for almost 30 years, and my heritage in this medium extends back through my grandmother's time. 
  • Supporting this campaign not only helps get this art out to folks, it puts money in the pocket of brilliant artist and designer, Steven Warrick, who has done epic pre-print and design work on both the coloring book and the recent World Spirit Tarot reprint. He laid out the new cover, too!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The cost here is mostly design, Indiegogo fees, and shipping. Steven gets paid, Indiegogo takes its share, and printing the first batch and shipping you your goodies will cost about $700. There's always unexpected costs to any project, but I've made my best experienced estimate.
  • You've got options as a donor: you can get a campy "Kissy Thank You" postcard, the World Spirit Tarot Adult Coloring Book itself, OR a Deluxe kit with the WST coloring book AND the new World Spirit Tarot deck and accompanying book. We've also got VIP seats to the TAROT book opening and Halloween theatrical bellydance show in Richmond, VA on Oct 17, 2015.

Is there MORE?

If you can't contribute to the project, please consider getting the word out via word of mouth and social media. It's always more effective if you choose to personalize your postings, such as: "I dig this art, and you might too! Consider pre-ordering a book today!"

And that's all there is to it. This is just very exciting; thanks for sticking with me.

Oh, and additional thanks to the the Resonant Rogues for the backing track, to Shoshi Hill for footage, and to Paolo Garbanzo for editing!

story:
I'm Melanie Daniels, 65 year old community artist, (papermaker, printmaker, bookmaker, lately folkmonkey maker), educator and now a builder.

Thank you for coming to see this campaign site.

So what have I built in the past?

Good question. My last project was founding and directing an inner city art school, Taproots, for 14 years, that reused a closed, 25,000 sq. ft. school building. Students came to our art programs from 32 different zip codes.

I retired a few years ago and began my quest to create a personal and community creative space where I could make my art and others could join me making theirs.   I generated savings of $4,000 from a program that helps women develop assets and with that small sum I began building the studio.
 
How long has this been going on?
I have been working on this "green" building for four years ( going on year 5  counting the training, clearing the site, finding local timberframers, and weather complications) with the help of neighbors, friends and passerbys.
 
Community Involvement
A long with friends and neighbors I partnered with Missouri Botanical Gardens' Earthways Center in 2009 we held a cordwood building class on my site, 8 students, 5 helpers and instructors from the Earthwood School, Rob and Jaki Roy worked for three days to kick off building the walls of the studio. In 2010 some 78 people donated work or materials to the project and in 2011 another 61 people joined in.
 
Now having used all my savings over the 5 years and I am out of funds and nearly out of time to get this first floor completed in this race against the weather.
 
The mortar in the walls can't be used once freezing weather arrives. I am so close - 70% done with the walls
Your contribution can help me win this race with the weather and start moving my equipment inside so I can begin earning my living again as an artist.
 
What Is Needed:
  • $6,000 to hire help for the next four weeks to work with me and mortar the logs into the remaining two walls and the last few feet at the top of the other three;
  • $650 to buy the 5,000 pounds of lime  and 10,000 pounds of sand for the mortar
  • $900 for electricity/lighting
  • $1,000 to buy a composting toilet
  • $ 600 a clean up sink/ shower
  • $300 for labor and materials to frame out 10 windows and 2 doors
  • $500 an electric energy efficient freestanding heater
  • $2,200 flooring
Green Building?
The Cordwood building process is labor intensive but yields a very energy efficient building with a insulation factor of R-23 due to 16" thick walls and a 10" thermal break space filled with cedar sawdust from a local cedar sawmill. I have used recycled windows, doors, outlet boxes and flex pipe from ReStore of Habitat for Humanity, Craigs List and recycling centers.
 
All the 400 cedar logs used to create the walls have been saved from land where they would have been burned as scrap. The timbers for the posts supports are remilled cyprus telephone posts and the posts for the timberframe have been purchased from local sawmills, part of the flooring is made of boards from salvaged pipe crates donated by a neighbor.
 
Impact
This building will of course have a huge impact on me personally as I can finally set up my etching press, papermaking equipment and bookmaking materials and begin making my living from my work.
 
Having this art studio in our village will be like having an art incubator that will nurture the creativity of all who join me in making their art.
 
Anytime we increase creativity everything and everyone around us benefits as well.
 
There are five closet artists on my road in this village who are waking up to their talents now that they have helped me work on this studio and probably many others as I come in contact with the other 100 homeowners here. My point is that when people gather together their creativity is supported and increases- the benefits go way beyond the walls of the studio!
 
Perks You will Receive (See Gallery for photos)
  1. $10 Instant Fame + Thank You
  2. $15 Bookmaking Kit
  3. $25 Original Photo Postcards
  4. $55 Video: Making of the Studio
  5. $75 Handcrafted Travel Journal
  6. $95 Two Original Giclee Prints
  7. $170 Collector Character Sockmonkeys
  8. $495 Private Art Party + Dinner
     OR choice of etching or silkscreen print
  9. $1,000 Framed Handmade Paper Piece

Please help spread the word

Please help us to get the word out about this campaign (it's easy with the Indiegogo share tools located below the video), and please consider contributing financially if you can. Your help will make a difference and be much appreciated.

If you would like to contribute labor by coming out and working with us please email me at mdaniels.studio8@gmail.com

If you do not have a Pay Pal account you  can send a check for the studio project directly to: Melanie Daniels, 7334 Lakeshore Dr, Cedar Hill, MO 63016.

story:
Hello my name is Jeff Zelnio and I have been following my dream of being a full time artist that started at the age of 40 for one year as of November 11th, 2012. I have created mosaics for 5 years and done many great projects from benches for cemeteries to giant top hats. It has been a voyage of self discovery and finding my passion in life has been the greatest blessing. I do this not only for myself but to show others it is never to late to follow your dreams and find your own path.

I had been working in the IT field for over a decade and went to an art event in the desert of Nevada called Burning Man and was so inspired that I knew I had to find some creative outlet for myself. This desire led to taking classes at our local art center. As soon as I took a mosaic class it was like finding my soul-mate and started making plans to exit from the corporate world

It has also been rocky as I find out how to do a business to support myself. Many costly mistakes were made but I have learned a lot along the way and think this project will be a large step in going in the right direction, I plan to take this to art fairs around the country and grow them to something real special to connect with people on a deeper level. And hopefully eventually hire my friends to help create larger scale ideas for public interaction. A guy can dream, but feel have gone so far well with my dreams and helped many others along the way so why not continue down this amazing path the world has led me on.

My mosaics have been well received but the ones that I have back-lit have have been the ones that had the most success and are the ones I most like to make - funny that! These have been very rudimentary with Christmas lights tossed into them or adhered around them to provide a light.  The idea is to take them to the next level with first to have ones that will do static operations such as fading light in and out for certain areas in effect, waves streaking over, and adjustable dimness.  Then after getting the basics down will do more advanced things with LED lights. I have lots of ideas but want to get funding to get prototypes created that will allow me to show them to a broader audience for more complex innovations.

I have been researching how to make LED Lights ran by micro-controllers and have a plan to make different levels of them - some that are switches that do a set type of effects to illuminate sections of the mosaics as well as phase in and out in relaxing patterns. My grand plan is to develop art that can be controlled with motion signals done by waving hands and pieces that have lighting effects that are like puzzle games you unlock to do different things with puzzles. The methods that I can create with your support will be scalable to larger items that will hopefully be installed in public places, but that will be later. Getting the initial help to fund these will go a long way in making that happen.

I think these will be amazing to have and provide joy. I would also like to incorporate sacred learning to people as I plan to have a deepness and symbology to my pieces to make them meditative as well as unlocking subconscious.

I have enlisted experts from the Area515 Makerspace in Des Moines (https://area515.org/ ) that shares a building with me that my studio is at to help me learn Arduino and develop the prototypes to eventually make printed circuit boards (PCB). Members have also agreed to advice me on other technical issues. I have also enlisted the help of a Brian Johnson of Johnson Woodcrafts (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Johnson-Woodcraft/127732383937155?fref=ts )to create frames of high quality. With this team I am confident that the job will be done and be more than I imagined it could be!

 

How I will use the Money:

  • half will go towards living expenses I would normal pay for a month so that I can focus on this project

  • the rest will go towards supplies such as resin ( would like to experiment with implanting LED lighting into resin ) , Arduino boards, PCB etching, optimal construction of frames to illuminate mosaic, fiber optics, LED, soldering station, and other supplies

I really have no choice but to do this, it is exploding in my head screaming for me to do. This is the sort of project that I will do no matter what but would like people to feel a part of it and it would be great to be able to do this project in a sustainable fashion. My main work is commissions, I love collaborating with a client to create something greater than us. I believe that there is beauty in the flaw, that imperfection is what makes us to be human and to overcome those to adapt.

Any amount that you can spare to helping me create this will go a long way in making it happen. As many know, it is hard to judge the exact amounts for prototyping so this is a very conservative amount to make the basics happen , I imagine I will be putting more money into this and see great things in the future for it after prototyping these intial designs , commissioned by you!

 

Other ways you can help

I know that many people cannot afford money towards this but any suggestions or sharing of this campaign will be very appreciated.  There are great sharing tools built into Indiegogo to allow this. Thank you so very much for your consideration, love, comments, and support!

story:
Laced In Ink is a complex creative project, that will transform an empty space into a work of art that a viewer can literally step into.  Laced In Ink will be the home base of a conglomerate of freelance or contract illustrators, graphic designers, photographers, and tattoo artists.  The studio will be a place to not only get tattooed, but a place to gather inspiration, see friendly faces, listen to music, make art, and hang out.  This collaborative project can be a staple in the community while fusing traditional forms of art including illustration, interior, graphic, and spatial design. How much artwork is actually a full body experience that surrounds its viewers and stimulates all the senses? 

Hello! I am Jeremiah, Jere for short, originally from Philadelphia, PA, but currently residing in the Mitten (Ann Arbor, MI).  I went to the University of Michigan, School of Art & Design and graduated in 2009 with a Bachelor's of Fine Art.  Illustration is my passion, I love making art, tattoos, and my friends.  You can see my artwork and portfolio at [ http://www.grizzly-jere.com ] and to see my daily sketches and artwork find me on Instagram @iamcatalyst.

I'm Meredith. Some people call me Megadeath. I am a perfectionist who loves imperfection. I like drawing, shading, photography, metal, forests, fairy tales, and using my imagination whenever possible, each are apart of my heart. Without art I am nothing.

  • We have love, passion, and drive for what we do and want to be creative full time.  We want to help people visualize their ideas, and breathe life into them. Motivation, ambition, and deterination empower us.
  • Laced In ink is simple in nature, but multifaceted in concept and will be so much more than a place to get inked.  It will be an all-in-one creative studio space, tattoo shop, gallery, and classroom.
  • $22,000 is a large sum of money, but it takes the same amount of energy to dream big as it does to dream small.  We are reaching for the stars.
  • To be able to design every part of the shop down to the smallest detail would allow for maximum creativity.  For example, custom wallpaper, upholstrey, cabinetry, lighting, and moulding are all going to be apart of this larger picture.  We believe that everything should be considered when tackling a project of this size.  We will transform an empty space into a work of art that a viewer can be completely surrounded by.
  • More specifically, the funds will go towards securing a space, renovations, construction, building materials, and object fabrication.  We want to transform an empty space into a colorful work of art where white is only an accent color.
  • The funds will also help us acquire an LLC and State & Health Department Licences.  We want our shop standards to be the best they possibly can be. 
  • Each of our perks come with a hand written thank you note that is a small work of art, collaborated on by Meredith and I.  All perks will be limited edition and are never to be reproduced again. Take a look, there is something for everyone.
  • Even if we are unable reach our funding goal we still can move foward with a smaller version of our biggest dreams.  Our funding goal is for a no-holds-bar and brightest version of Laced In Ink. 

Here are some images of what we would like to transform the space into:

 

  • This may be our idea, but there is something for everyone.
  • We want to create a whole new breed of creative art studio and tattoo shop.  Our goal is to help all people that come to the studio whether they are getting tattooed or just there for inspiration or contract work.
  • At the heart of our tattoo shop we will embody above and beyond customer service.  Going to a tattoo shop/art studio can be a uncomfortable especially for first timers.  Laced In Ink will have a comfortable and friendly atmosphere making each tattoo experience as stress free as possible.  We want it to be a place where people will want to be apart of, just come to say hello, hang out, and have fun.  Hopefully one day it will be a staple in the community, a place to see art, and source of many forms of inspiraton.
  • From the second someone walks in we will engage them and find out what they want and how we can achieve their goal.  We plan on giving complimentary aftercare packages to each tattoo client/guest.  Being paperless as far as the adminstrative part of the the shop is another aspect we will be striving to make a reality.  We will make sure it is okay to contact each person a few weeks after their appointments to follow up on how well their tattoo is healing and if they would like to schedule a touch up appointment if necessary.  Lastly, we will host a closed party for our clients to have their tattoos photographed and documented.  Not only will our clients be able to network and meet other people, but also we will able to get to know them as friends.  
  • Further more, on top of being a place you can get tattooed, gain inspiration, and have your ideas visualized we would like to give back to young and emerging artists.  We want to work closely with University of Michigan, School of Art & Design students.  To give back and help students gain experience in a successful art environment would be gratifying.  We have many ideas from basic to complex. At the very least art students can just use the space to do artwork, homework, study, and observe a professional art setting.  The next step from there would be to feature the work of one University of Michigan, School of Art & Design, senior art student's work once a month.  Long term we would like to eventually host a work study program if possible and maybe even an internship for credit through the school.  
  • Lastly, Meredith and I would both like to acquire teaching certificates so we can host a variety of art classes for all ages.  We are thinking in the moment, but are also considering the future and the things to come. 

  • As much as Laced In Ink is our idea, it's for everyone to be apart of.  We are reacing out to art lovers, tattoo enthusiasts, makers, creators, and people of all ages.  Help make this dream a reality.  Thank you for looking and if you see something you like, please pass it along and share it with your friends and family.
story_txt:
Laced In Ink is a complex creative project, that will transform an empty space into a work of art that a viewer can literally step into.  Laced In Ink will be the home base of a conglomerate of freelance or contract illustrators, graphic designers, photographers, and tattoo artists.  The studio will be a place to not only get tattooed, but a place to gather inspiration, see friendly faces, listen to music, make art, and hang out.  This collaborative project can be a staple in the community while fusing traditional forms of art including illustration, interior, graphic, and spatial design. How much artwork is actually a full body experience that surrounds its viewers and stimulates all the senses? 


Hello! I am Jeremiah, Jere for short, originally from Philadelphia, PA, but currently residing in the Mitten (Ann Arbor, MI).  I went to the University of Michigan, School of Art & Design and graduated in 2009 with a Bachelor's of Fine Art.  Illustration is my passion, I love making art, tattoos, and my friends.  You can see my artwork and portfolio at [ http://www.grizzly-jere.com ] and to see my daily sketches and artwork find me on Instagram @iamcatalyst.

I'm Meredith. Some people call me Megadeath. I am a perfectionist who loves imperfection. I like drawing, shading, photography, metal, forests, fairy tales, and using my imagination whenever possible, each are apart of my heart. Without art I am nothing.




We have love, passion, and drive for what we do and want to be creative full time.  We want to help people visualize their ideas, and breathe life into them. Motivation, ambition, and deterination empower us.

Laced In ink is simple in nature, but multifaceted in concept and will be so much more than a place to get inked.  It will be an all-in-one creative studio space, tattoo shop, gallery, and classroom.
$22,000 is a large sum of money, but it takes the same amount of energy to dream big as it does to dream small.  We are reaching for the stars.
To be able to design every part of the shop down to the smallest detail would allow for maximum creativity.  For example, custom wallpaper, upholstrey, cabinetry, lighting, and moulding are all going to be apart of this larger picture.  We believe that everything should be considered when tackling a project of this size.  We will transform an empty space into a work of art that a viewer can be completely surrounded by.
More specifically, the funds will go towards securing a space, renovations, construction, building materials, and object fabrication.  We want to transform an empty space into a colorful work of art where white is only an accent color.
The funds will also help us acquire an LLC and State & Health Department Licences.  We want our shop standards to be the best they possibly can be. 
Each of our perks come with a hand written thank you note that is a small work of art, collaborated on by Meredith and I.  All perks will be limited edition and are never to be reproduced again. Take a look, there is something for everyone.
Even if we are unable reach our funding goal we still can move foward with a smaller version of our biggest dreams.  Our funding goal is for a no-holds-bar and brightest version of Laced In Ink. 

Here are some images of what we would like to transform the space into:



 





This may be our idea, but there is something for everyone.
We want to create a whole new breed of creative art studio and tattoo shop.  Our goal is to help all people that come to the studio whether they are getting tattooed or just there for inspiration or contract work.
At the heart of our tattoo shop we will embody above and beyond customer service.  Going to a tattoo shop/art studio can be a uncomfortable especially for first timers.  Laced In Ink will have a comfortable and friendly atmosphere making each tattoo experience as stress free as possible.  We want it to be a place where people will want to be apart of, just come to say hello, hang out, and have fun.  Hopefully one day it will be a staple in the community, a place to see art, and source of many forms of inspiraton.
From the second someone walks in we will engage them and find out what they want and how we can achieve their goal.  We plan on giving complimentary aftercare packages to each tattoo client/guest.  Being paperless as far as the adminstrative part of the the shop is another aspect we will be striving to make a reality.  We will make sure it is okay to contact each person a few weeks after their appointments to follow up on how well their tattoo is healing and if they would like to schedule a touch up appointment if necessary.  Lastly, we will host a closed party for our clients to have their tattoos photographed and documented.  Not only will our clients be able to network and meet other people, but also we will able to get to know them as friends.  
Further more, on top of being a place you can get tattooed, gain inspiration, and have your ideas visualized we would like to give back to young and emerging artists.  We want to work closely with University of Michigan, School of Art & Design students.  To give back and help students gain experience in a successful art environment would be gratifying.  We have many ideas from basic to complex. At the very least art students can just use the space to do artwork, homework, study, and observe a professional art setting.  The next step from there would be to feature the work of one University of Michigan, School of Art & Design, senior art student's work once a month.  Long term we would like to eventually host a work study program if possible and maybe even an internship for credit through the school.  
Lastly, Meredith and I would both like to acquire teaching certificates so we can host a variety of art classes for all ages.  We are thinking in the moment, but are also considering the future and the things to come. 





As much as Laced In Ink is our idea, it's for everyone to be apart of.  We are reacing out to art lovers, tattoo enthusiasts, makers, creators, and people of all ages.  Help make this dream a reality.  Thank you for looking and if you see something you like, please pass it along and share it with your friends and family.

story:
We are creating a large mural on the North Wall of the Odd Fellows building in downtown Sebastopol. 

The theme, based on a Kashaya Pomo story details how Coyote the Trickster created the  Sonoma coastline by the unintended consequences of his actions. This  mural about the origins of the landscape has a bit of spiritual magic, a beautiful scene and a story that comes from the very roots of this area. We are inviting the community to assist us at a Community Paint Day September 22, and to be part of the crowd funding process. To date, our fundraising efforts, including in-kind donations, have totaled $26,000 of a $30,000 budget.  We are seeking an additional $4,000 to cover scaffolding, primer and varnish costs to complete and install the mural by October 15, 2013.

The full story can be read at https://www.facebook.com/communitymural/info

I have been painting murals throughout the USA for thirty years and have lived in Sebastopol for the past 21 years. Local wildlife painter Molly Eckler will be painting Coyote.  The assistants are young and talented artists Jordan DeVito and Dana Lynn Vallarino. Portions of the painting's lower section will be painted by volunteers from the community on our paint day at the Sebastopol Community Center, September 22, 2013. Everyone is welcome.

This is an opportunity to come together and create something special in our town.

After the paint day, the painting will be installed and the sky and ocean completed onsite.

This large mural, 118 feet x 30 feet, is bering funded soley by contributions from the community. There is no corporate branding or signage. Our costs include city encroachment permit fees, primer, paint,varnish, supplies, rental of the hall, insurance and rental of a scissors lift scaffolding.

Thanks,

Dave Gordon                                                                                                      

contact us at sebastopolmural@sonic.net                                          www.dsgordon.com
