story:
Breve reseña

Somos productores de cine independiente y alternativo con más de diez años de experiencia. Generamos un cine participativo desde la capacitación, producción y distribución de obras de relevancia social y cultural, incentivando la visibilización de las diferentes comunidades, etnias y culturas del Ecuador a través de su propia voz, haciendo énfasis en el rescate y difusión de la tradición oral de nuestros pueblos y su patrimonio intangible.

Encuentros con el cine capacita en el marco de talleres gratuitos, teórico-prácticos de cine y actuación a jóvenes de comunidades rurales del Ecuador, convirtiendo las historias de sus abuelos en una película para compartir con el mundo.

Utilizando los conocimientos im­partidos como herramienta para la realización de su propia película, los jóvenes, con el apoyo y super­visión de profesionales del medio cinematográfico, escriben un guión basado en historias sobre tradiciones, mitos y leyendas; histo­rias contadas por los abuelos de la zona y recopiladas por los jóvenes del taller, que las trasladarán a su propio lenguaje, búsqueda, nece­sidades y punto de vista. Invitando a los nietos de esos abue­los, y a un país entero a descubrir de dónde vienen sus raíces y la impor­tancia de mantenerlas vivas como base de una sociedad consciente y responsable para con su cultura, tradición y subsistencia

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Nos encontramos ya realizando los talleres, tenemos a 22 talentos azuayos, elegidos a través de un riguroso proceso de selección en las diferentes comunidades rurales de la provincia del Azuay y 13 profesionales impartiendo clases. Para llegar a este punto ya hemos alcanzado obtener gran parte del financiamiento de este ambicioso proyecto que busca más dar que recibir, nos falta 63.000 dólares para no cerrar el rodaje de la película a la mitad. Este es el reto, lograr recaudar los fondos suficientes en los próximos 30 días para no enviar a estos jóvenes a su casa sin una película que estrenar.

Como recompensas tenemos:

• Tu nombre aparecerá en los agradecimientos especiales de la película.
• Entérate, te enviaremos  boletines informativos y fotos de las clases, rodaje y estrenos, cada semana.
• Recibirás un DVD original de la película cuando este terminada.
• Si gustas podrás venir al rodaje y participar como extra (Costos de traslado no están incluidos)
• Incluiremos de tu empresa u organización en los créditos y el afiche de la película.

• Se entregará 100 copias originales del DVD para como regalo para tus amigos, proveedores o empleados.

    El impacto

    Basados en el éxito obtenido con “Santa Elena en Bus” primera para de Encuentros con el Cine, una película para expectadores de todas las edades, estrenada en cines a nivel nacional e internacional y presentada en funciones gratuitas y al aire libre en cada uno de los rincones de una provincial que vibró y se reconoció en su película. Más de 8mil DVDs vendidos, y presencia en TV nacional. FILMARTE lanza la segunda edición: Encuentros con el cine AZUAY.

    Deseamos convertir a Encuentros con el cine en una herramienta de empoderamiento para jóvenes en zonas de riesgo llevando a cabo un largometraje escrito, filmado, ac­tuado y producido por los mismos, lo que convierte esta experiencia en un despertar en los miem­bros de las comunidades a su capa­cidad creativa y los conecta de forma práctica con el mundo audiovisual.

      Riesgos y desafíos

      Deseamos convertir a Encuentros con el Cine en una herramienta de empoderamiento para jóvenes en zonas de riesgo llevando a cabo un largometraje escrito, filmado, ac­tuado y producido por los mismos, lo que convierte esta experiencia en un despertar en los miem­bros de las comunidades a su capa­cidad creativa y los conecta de forma práctica con el mundo audiovisual.

      ¡En tus manos está enseñar es estos jóvenes a creer en ellos mismos!

        Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

        Comparte esta campaña de financiamiento con tus amigos, invítales a ser parte, habla del proyecto en tus medios locales y apoya esta gran iniciativa.

        www.filmarte.ec

story:
(The names in gold are up on the wall, have a look at the gallery photo to see!)

Hi, my name is Candice and I am a potter.

I have been working with clay, throwing porcelain and stoneware; and teaching for more than 20 years.

I am trying to set up a studio at home to continue my work. I have a lovely small space in the heart of the Ashdown Forest, UK.  I have spent time, money and effort to get the studio up and running. I have restored the original stables, added a window, built a retaining wall in the garden and bought a kiln. I have two wheels, tools and my hands

What I don’t have is electricity to power my kiln or lights and plugs in the studio.

I need $3500 to cover the cost of upgrading my electric supply board, and to lay a cable to the studio capable of firing the kiln to 1260 degrees Celsius. I have obtained four quotes and they ALL equal the same amount…$3500. It sounds a lot, but without it I cannot follow my dream.

My dream is to produce beautiful ceramics, share my skills through lessons and weekend- retreat classes, introducing people to the therapeutic benefits of expressing their creative self. My aim is to establish a creative space for small groups to enjoy working with clay.

My incredible children, talented nephew and endlessly supportive husband have helped me put together this appeal. If I can get this to work it will change the life of my family, allowing us to move out of a difficult time and use my skills to enhance our lives.

Your contributions will be used to install electrics to the studio…To allow me to turn on the lights!

It doesn’t need to stop there.

I would use any additional funding to buy another wheel or two, and to buy raw materials; clay, glazes, a raku kiln, and do some advertising for my classes.

I could never ask this of you without offering something in return, so, I will be offering incentives for your support, including lumpy memorabilia, slab and hand thrown porcelain or stoneware, and personalised tableware. I will also be offering lessons as reward if you are local. Come along and have a coffee and enrich yourself making something beautiful.

I understand if you yourself cannot contribute to this fundraiser. However, I do ask that you share this campaign through your own networks, be it Facebook, Twitter, etc. to get the word out!

Many thanks for your support.

All Contributors will join the wall of fame and get their name embossed on the studio wall in gold! Watch this space for updates. The bigger your contribution the bigger your name!

Examples of rewards: These can only be fired if I reach my total!

I will be making small hanging lizards, stars, hearts and angels,which will be  scented.

Also, I will throw gift-bowls, hand decorated, or personalised, with a name or phrase…perfect for dinner-party gifts, or wedding favours. Specific quantities can be made to order. Quantity and detail will be dependent on your contributions.

Anyone that funds me will receive a special smile...to tide you over till I can fire the clay!

story:
Ongoing Progress & News 'link':
NEWS: 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' has just become a member of 'MercyCorp'. We are also a member of 'Amnesty International.  
ENDORSEMENT: Andrea Ramolo, Celebrity Canadian Musician
"Hi. This is Canadian musician Andrea Ramolo and I am happy to endorse
the fine work that humanitarian organization 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' is
partaking.  "GLOBAL ArtXchanges"is helping make that possible by giving
impoverished youth in the world to receive proper art supplies,
That in itself will give them confidence and enrich their community.I hope 
you too will help support this special cause by donating any amount that you
are able. Thanking you in advance."

 http://www.vpeltonen.com/artworks/global-artxch...

Our Story

'GLOBAl ArtXchanges' was formed about 2 years ago, here in Thunder Bay, Canada. 
I am Art Director/co-ordinator, Vesa Peltonen, who is an award winning visual artist/teacher. I have helped aboriginal students gain confidence through art. I received this award due to my many years of work in many aspects of art and as an entrepreneur, volunteering and working as an advisor for our province art council. I have been most honoured, but awards are not what I seek, it's watching my efforts work, seeing that young art students become happier, confident & motivated -sustained in their artwork needs.

It is much about caring, compassion and determination. 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges; is meant to 'enrich the lives' of the youth who are in needy art groups and small art schools world-wide that do not have the resources to have proper art supplies. We do not send money. We only send the art supplies the contact person, director, or teacher requests. Once we see all is proper, we make sure they receive it. Money sent has less chance of going to the right place.  

Note  of Importance: 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' already networked in Jugla, Ghana & sent them for art supplies. They sent us artwork by young students did. It was an incredible feeling, and it was most successful. They are now sustaining this art program, and we do the follow up. The artwork that we get from each place we touch will be apart of an exhibition showing 'International Youth Art' we have collected, one culmination and apart of the ongoing work. We've already put in money, & will receive funds from other sources, such as grants and special art council funding. We need $40K as we go.

The Impact

The impact is that not only do the young artists benefit, but also do their family, friends and community. The community begins to share in the responsibility to sustain this effort. Since the young artists have proper art supplies to work with, this puts smiles on the faces of everyone. Having family and teachers begin to share in the responsibility of motivating their youth thus enriches the spirit in people and involving many in this focus of the future of their children's education. "No one can take a young person’s imagination away." as is said. 

What We Need & What You Get
We need to reach a minimum fundraising effort of $12,000. (U.S.D) Once we have worked into many poor/needy world art groups we will have an international exhibition of their work 'called 'Compassion Through Art.. YOU WILL BENEFIT from the news we send to you about the ongoing efforts, where your funds have gone to, see photographs to art, to a final documentary short film.
Look NOW in the Donations we need & what each one you choose GIVE YOU for your generosity.

RETURN to FACEBOOK ORGANIZATION SITE:

http://www.facebook.com/manraze.thunderbay1#!/g...

ENDORSEMENT: Andrea Ramolo, Celebrity Canadian Musician
"Hi. This is Canadian musician Andrea Ramolo and I am happy to endorse the fine work that humanitarian organization 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' is partaking.  "GLOBAL ArtXchanges"is helping make that possible by giving impoverished youth in the world to receive proper art supplies, That in itself will give them confidence and enrich their community.I hope  you too will help support this special cause by donating any amount that you are able. Thanking you in advance."
 http://www.vpeltonen.com/artworks/global-artxch...

Our Story
'GLOBAl ArtXchanges' was formed about 2 years ago, here in Thunder Bay, Canada. 

I am Art Director/co-ordinator, Vesa Peltonen, who is an award winning visual artist/teacher. I have helped aboriginal students gain confidence through art. I received this award due to my many years of work in many aspects of art and as an entrepreneur, volunteering and working as an advisor for our province art council. I have been most honoured, but awards are not what I seek, it's watching my efforts work, seeing that young art students become happier, confident & motivated -sustained in their artwork needs. 

It is much about caring, compassion and determination. 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges; is meant to 'enrich the lives' of the youth who are in needy art groups and small art schools world-wide that do not have the resources to have proper art supplies. We do not send money. We only send the art supplies the contact person, director, or teacher requests. Once we see all is proper, we make sure they receive it. Money sent has less chance of going to the right place.  

Note  of Importance: 'GLOBAL ArtXchanges' already networked in Jugla, Ghana & sent them for art supplies. They sent us artwork by young students did. It was an incredible feeling, and it was most successful. They are now sustaining this art program, and we do the follow up. The artwork that we get from each place we touch will be apart of an exhibition showing 'International Youth Art' we have collected, one culmination and apart of the ongoing work. We've already put in money, & will receive funds from other sources, such as grants and special art council funding. We need $40K as we go.
The Impact

The impact is that not only do the young artists benefit, but also do their family, friends and community. The community begins to share in the responsibility to sustain this effort. Since the young artists have proper art supplies to work with, this puts smiles on the faces of everyone. Having family and teachers begin to share in the responsibility of motivating their youth thus enriches the spirit in people and involving many in this focus of the future of their children's education. "No one can take a young person’s imagination away." as is said. What We Need & What You Get


We need to reach a minimum fundraising effort of $12,000. (U.S.D) Once we have worked into many poor/needy world art groups we will have an international exhibition of their work 'called 'Compassion Through Art.. YOU WILL BENEFIT from the news we send to you about the ongoing efforts, where your funds have gone to, see photographs to art, to a final documentary short film.

Look NOW in the Donations we need & what each one you choose GIVE YOU for your generosity.
RETURN to FACEBOOK ORGANIZATION SITE:
http://www.facebook.com/manraze.thunderbay1#!/g...

story:
è un film indipendente auto-prodotto cominciato 2 anni fa, il montaggio è finito e ora ci prepariamo per le ultime fasi della produzione (mix audio e color correction) e distribuzione nel circuito dei festival.

Chiediamo il vostro contributo entro il 30 Settembre per supportare le ultime fasi della produzione del film.

- Con 5 Euro SUPRA NATURA SOUNDTRACK, un link per scaricare la colonna sonora, un booklet digitale e 2 trailers del film.

- Con 25 Euro SUPRA NATURA T-SHIRT, maglia bianca in cotone biologico con stampa serigrafica a mano disegnata da Dem.

Edizione limitata di 100 copie. Taglie S/M/L. 
Il costo di spedizione in tutta Italia è incluso nelle 25€, per spedizioni fuori Italia vi verrà addebitato un costo extra spedizione di 5€.

Per favore specificare la taglia desiderata scrivendo a questo indirizzo: info@supranatura.org

Per maggiori informazioni: info@supranatura.org

GRAZIE PER IL SUPPORTO

 

 

 is a self-produced film project started two years ago, the film is finished and now we are preparing for the final stages of production (sound mix and color correction) and distribution on the festival circuit.

We ask your contribution before September 30 to support the final stages of production of the film.

 - With 5 Euro SUPRA NATURA SOUNDTRACK, a link to download the soundtrack, a digital booklet and 2 trailers.

- With 25 Euro SUPRA NATURA T-SHIRT, white shirt in organic cotton with hand made silk-screen printing designed by Dem

Limited edition of 100 copies. Sizes S / M / L.
The shipping cost for italy is included in 25€, shipping outside Italy will be charged an extra cost of shipping.

For more info: info@supranatura.org

Thank you for your support

  

 

 

 Stampa a cura di Perpetua / Printed by Perpetua

 

Fors'ero un pesce 
sotto un sole precedente. 
Una di queste rocce 
ogni giorno lucidate dall'acqua 
o un ramo che si curva 
per intingere le dita nel torrente.
Nessun altra spiegazione 
se resto terso per ore 
alla vista, alla voce
di fiumi e mari e boschi.

 

Perhaps I was a fish
under a previous sun,
one of these rocks
polished by water, 
or a bough that bends and dips 
its fingers into the creek. 
No other explanation 
if I'm lost for hours
at the sight and sound 
of streams and seas and trees.

 

Un anno di storia d'Italia raccontato da Madre Natura. Il quotidiano anelito del mutante uomo, la lotta intestina e le forze contrapposte delle radici e delle ali.
La Natura parla e impone la sua purificante estetica, una rivincita animista, pagana, una dichiarazione artistica di religiosità, un linguaggio narrativo inedito, una narrazione a più voci.L'arte del cinema a ricordare che quello delle parole non è che il più banale dei linguaggi di cui disponiamo.
Un film che insegna ad usare le mani, gli occhi, le orecchie ed il cuore. Uscite dagli uffici e dalle metropolitane e andate a cercarlo!
Vi troverete con le narici umide, il collo allungato e le orecchie tese.
E' un' esperienza sensoriale unica

 

One year of Italian history told by Mother Nature. The daily breath of life of the mutant man, the internal struggle and the opposing forces of the roots and wings.
Nature speacks and imposes her purifying aesthetics.
An animist and pagan revenge, an artistic declaration of religiousness.
An unprecedented narrative language, a story with many voices, the art of cinema to remind us that the word is not the most trivial language we have.
A film which teaches how to use hands, eyes, ears and heart.
Go out of the office and metro and look for this film.
You’ll find yourself with wet nostrils, an extended neck and streched ears.
It’s a unique experience for your senses.

 

Alberto "Ridge" Rigettini

  

 

DEM, come un moderno alchimista, crea personaggi bizzarri, creature surreali, abitanti di uno strato impercettibile della realtà umana.
Multiforme ed ironico, le sue opere che spaziano dal wall-painting, all'illustrazione, alla pittura su tela, si arricchiscono di un linguaggio simbolico che invita ad elaborare un proprio codice d'accesso per questo mondo enigmatico ed arcano.
L'avvicinamento a tematiche antropologiche e legate alla natura stimolano l'artista a una costante sperimentazione, giunta negli ultimi anni alla produzione di un film e alla creazione d'installazioni composte esclusivamente da materiali naturali.
Oltre alla produzione nelle fabbriche abbandonate e nei boschi, scelti come sfondo ideale per i suoi lavori, DEM vanta varie pubblicazioni ed esperienze espositive, come la personale alla Oro Gallery di Goteborg e la partecipazione alla mostre Street Art, Sweet Art al PAC di Milano, Nomadaz alla Scion Installation di Los Angeles e CCTV all'Apostrophe Gallery di Hong Kong.

 

SETH MORLEY ovvero Claudio Cecconi è un regista indipendente italiano, montatore, fotografo e fondatore di LOGO VIDEO e YOU ARE GOD FILM PROD.

Filmografia: LOGO CLIP 01, 2001, dv short clips, FEBBRE, 2003, dv 12',WHITE NOISE, 2007 dv 13', IN BARDO, NIN GHOST PROJECT, 2009, HD 7', LA PARTICELLA DI DIO, 2010, HDV 50', SUPRA NATURA, 2013, HD 72'

 

DEM, Like a modern alchemist, DEM creates weird characters, surreal creatures, inhabitants of invisible layers in the world of humans.
Eclectic and funny, through wall-paintings, illustrations, paintings on canvas rich in allegorical language, he lets the viewer find the key to that enigmatic and arcane world.
The approach to anthropological themes related to nature stimulate the artist in a constant experimentation, reached in recent years to the production of a film and the creation of installations made-up entirely of natural materials.
Besides painting in condemned buildings and forests, ideal background for his works, DEM has also been guest artist at Goteborg's Oro Gallery, and taken part in exhibitions such as Street Art, Sweet Art (PAC, Milano), Nomadaz (Scion Gallery, Los Angeles) and CCTV (Apostrophe Gallery, Hong Kong).

  .

SETH MORLEY aka Claudio Cecconi is an italian independent filmmaker, editor and photographer. He is the founder of LOGO VIDEO and YOU ARE GOD FILM PROD.

Filmography: LOGO CLIP 01, 2001, dv short clips, FEBBRE, 2003, dv 12', WHITE NOISE, 2007 dv 13', IN BARDO, NIN GHOST PROJECT, 2009, HD 7',  LA PARTICELLA DI DIO, 2010, HDV 50', SUPRA NATURA, 2013, HD 72'

  

More infos at: www.supranatura.org - info@supranatura.org 

 

   

© 2013 YOU ARE GOD FILM PROD. and DEM

story:
There is nothing like an artist being given the opportunity to see their creative visions spring to life. Trust us we know. Mint Presents was founded by a musician and an actress who know that feeling. That feeling when you have created until your brain hurts, and rehearsed to exhaustion, and finally. . .finally the moment comes when art runs through you onstage, and your audience becomes one with you in a place where story, where music, where art lives. 

But let's face it. In a world where money talks even the freshest of ideas need funding on occasion. That's where Mint Presents comes in. We are dedicated to the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex on being the source that helps artists focus only on the "art part" of their projects, so they may spend their time looking for the perfect word for "dream" rather than the business of how their word will be heard. Our artists will NEVER be charged for our services. We are dedicated to the art and artist and our business design reflects that.

So whether it's a live play, belly dancing show, art exhibit, or the next best rock band in town, Mint Presents will manage every aspect of production from venue acquisition, to promotion, to fund raising so artists can see their minty fresh ideas spring to an artistic reality. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Help The Only Female Team out of 200 Artists To Paint at UpFest!

Who We Are:

   Artists Danielle Mastrion & Lexi Bella met in 2008 during the Femme Fatale Art Battle (a live art competition) and began a friendship & shared respect that has brought them to a new level in their work. For many years both ladies traveled within  the live & street art circles of downtown New York, seeking to create bigger & better art as well as teach & mentor young artists by teaching programs for The Lower East Side Girl's Club & Wingspan Arts.

    2012 was a milestone year for both artists with their careers blossoming, doing work that garnered them international attention. They were both in the ArtBattles huge Pop Up Art Gallery on Bleeker Street in Greenwhich Village; both exhibited in 5 Raw, a landmark show at Gallery Bar in the Lower East Side last Summer; both participated in the Centre-Fuge Public Mural Project twice, with Danielle's Tribute to the Beastie Boys being featured on RollingStone.com. Between the two of them they have painted walls in locations such as  5 Poinz Living Graffiti Museum, The Brooklyn Collective (Formerly The Bushwick 5 Points), at Art Basel Miami 2013, in Berlin, Paris, & The North Philly Walls. Both artists traveled to Paris together last Fall to compete in ArtBattles 2012 International Championships with 8 other artists from NYC, LA, Paris, Barcelona, Amsterdam, & Warsaw. They both won the first round, & Lexi won the Amercan Championship. To get to the international round, both ladies have won several ArtBattles in New York City, garnishing spots in the International battles to represent America & New York City. Both ladies also were part of Fountain Art Fair this year, the art world's most anticipated NYC Art Fair during the Armory Show. Now they are ready to go back across the pond & paint their designated 10 X 10 Ft Wall & show them how NYC does it!

Check out their artwork & past murals:

www.lexibella.com

www.daniellemastrion.com

ALSO Please follow us:

Twitter: @Lexibellaart & @DANIELLEBKNYC

Instagram: @LexiBellaArt @DANIELLEBKNYC

Tumblr: http://lexibellaart.tumblr.com/

Pinterest: http://pinterest.com/lexibellaart/

What is UpFest:

   Upfest - The Urban Paint Festival, created in 2008 between three crazy but art loving individuals. Inspired by Super Cans (Southampton), Cans Festival (London) and the growing number of paint jams around the UK, Upfest was born. 

  With over 1000 artists applying & 200 being accepted for 2013, Upfest has turned into the biggest international Live & Street (Urban) Art Festival in Europe and is creating a format soon to be but not yet replicated in the States. inside and outside music stages at full volume with 10X10 ft walls constructed all over for registered artists to paint, South Bristol turns in to the place to be for all things street for 48hrs of 'Live' Urban and Contemporary Art.       

  Over the last three festivals Upfest has worked with a local charity called Nacoa, this amazing charity support many children across the UK, who live with alcohol or drug dependant family members. We would like to thank all the artists that attend for helping us raise over £15,000 so far for Nacoa and just as important, raise awareness of the vital work they do.

www.upfest.com

@upfest

   These ladies are the only all-female team asked out of 200 artists from all over the world to paint at UpFest! Gender does not matter in regards to art, capabilities, or talent; BUT we are looking to inspire young female artists via the Lower East Side Girl's Club, as listed below: 

WE ARE ALSO DEDICATING THE WORK WE CREATE TO THE LOWER EAST SIDE GIRLS CLUB AND WE WILL BE SPEAKING TO YOUNG WOMEN THERE ABOUT OUR TRIP ON OUR RETURN & TEACHING A MURAL PAINTING CLASS

PLEASE SUPPORT THE ARTS!  We can't get over there without your help !

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $5,000 to cover all costs associated with our trip to Bristol from May 25th-May 28th 2013. We are both working artists in (expensive) New York City who have more than one job to pay our rent. Lexi is a mother so she has an extra person to take care of as well! As much as we want to make a living with only by doing art, we arent quite there yet & REALLY NEED YOUR HELP to grow as artists & continue to inspire & continue to spread the benefits of public art internationally. 

Here is the break down of costs:

  • Air Travel from NYC to Bristol May 25-28:$900-$1500 per person, $3000 for 2
  • Hotel from May 25-28:$325
  • Transportation & car rental:$500
  • Paint & Supplies for 10ft X 10ft mural:$200
  • Food:$300
  • Miscellaneous/Emergency fund (injuries, unforseen costs, etc): $625

(if there are left over funds when we return we intend to donate them to the Lower East Side Girl's Club)

Our Gifts To You:

Each of our Perks involve handmade art pieces by us for you!

You receive a piece of art history you helped create by supporting us.

Not only do you get the satisfaction of being a collector (look out Barnes)but we will also send a quality photograph of our finished piece to every one of our contributors!

Finally you also help us to inspire & teach the girls at the Lower East Side Girls Club, who we will be speaking to about our experience when we return as well as teaching about the process!

Sounds like a Win/Win/Win to us!

 

The Impact

       On an artistic level we believe very much in Public Art and perpetuating work that beautifies cities or any surroundings as well as work that is accessable to any viewer. Over the past 30-50 years work within the white cube of a gallery has become more obscure and intimidating to the average person. You can ask anyone what kind of music they like & they will answer you but if you ask them what kind of art they like they may respond, "I dont know" or perhaps try to dig into their memory of an art history class they took once. When art is public or in the streets it is accessable for everyone's opinion & more important enjoyment. We want to not only continue the tradition of painting on a large scale & bringing art to the people, as well as develop techniques in the New York tradition of spraypaint.

     On a pro-woman level being the only female team out of 200 being asked to paint at UpFest carries a lot of weight with us. The art world, ESPECIALLY the Urban Painting art world is a male dominated place, and to get recognition & repect for your art is a constant battle, but one we embrace fully. We both have had young women approach us as we paint on the streets and say "I've never seen a women do this; I didn't think women painted walls". We want to change that perception. We want to share this with the world, meet like minded individuals from other amazing places, and be a source of inspiration for the next generation of artists, the ladies at the Lower East Side Girl's club.

    

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • PLEASE Tweet, Share, & Yell from the Hills about this for us!
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you know anyone that can get us deals on airfare, transportation, or cut costs in any way let us know!

We are both working artists in (expensive) New York City who have more than one job to pay our rent. Lexi is a mother so she has an extra person to take care of as well! As much as we want to make a living with only by doing art, we arent quite there yet & REALLY NEED YOUR HELP to grow as artists & continue to inspire & continue to spread the benefits of public art internationally. 
Here is the break down of costs:

Air Travel from NYC to Bristol May 25-28:$900-$1500 per person, $3000 for 2
Hotel from May 25-28:$325
Transportation & car rental:$500
Paint & Supplies for 10ft X 10ft mural:$200
Food:$300
Miscellaneous/Emergency fund (injuries, unforseen costs, etc): $625

(if there are left over funds when we return we intend to donate them to the Lower East Side Girl's Club)
Our Gifts To You:
Each of our Perks involve handmade art pieces by us for you!
You receive a piece of art history you helped create by supporting us.
Not only do you get the satisfaction of being a collector (look out Barnes)but we will also send a quality photograph of our finished piece to every one of our contributors!
Finally you also help us to inspire & teach the girls at the Lower East Side Girls Club, who we will be speaking to about our experience when we return as well as teaching about the process!
Sounds like a Win/Win/Win to us!
 
The Impact
       On an artistic level we believe very much in Public Art and perpetuating work that beautifies cities or any surroundings as well as work that is accessable to any viewer. Over the past 30-50 years work within the white cube of a gallery has become more obscure and intimidating to the average person. You can ask anyone what kind of music they like & they will answer you but if you ask them what kind of art they like they may respond, "I dont know" or perhaps try to dig into their memory of an art history class they took once. When art is public or in the streets it is accessable for everyone's opinion & more important enjoyment. We want to not only continue the tradition of painting on a large scale & bringing art to the people, as well as develop techniques in the New York tradition of spraypaint. 
     On a pro-woman level being the only female team out of 200 being asked to paint at UpFest carries a lot of weight with us. The art world, ESPECIALLY the Urban Painting art world is a male dominated place, and to get recognition & repect for your art is a constant battle, but one we embrace fully. We both have had young women approach us as we paint on the streets and say "I've never seen a women do this; I didn't think women painted walls". We want to change that perception. We want to share this with the world, meet like minded individuals from other amazing places, and be a source of inspiration for the next generation of artists, the ladies at the Lower East Side Girl's club.


    
Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

PLEASE Tweet, Share, & Yell from the Hills about this for us!
use the Indiegogo share tools!
If you know anyone that can get us deals on airfare, transportation, or cut costs in any way let us know!

story:
The Chris Holmes Tattoo Project!

Be a part of something special!

A very personal tattoo design has been drawn to incorporate participating fans’ names, spanning the whole of our guitarist Chris Holmes’ left leg as a thank you for your endless support, without which we would never have made it this far.  

Chris explains “I've had an overwhelming response from friends, family and fans regarding the enjoyment they receive from being a part of Sansara. Never have I felt so supported by the people that truly matter to me, those that listen to the result of our creativity and passion. I want to give something back and show you all how truly appreciative I am of your love for real, honest and hardworking musicians. 

“People say that a tattoo should have deep meaning and I feel that you have all become the very core of my life, so it feels right to have a permanent representation of that with me forever. Some may think I’m insane for doing such a crazy thing, perhaps they’re right, but I wouldn't have it any other way. I’m in this for life and if I wish to ‘donate’ my leg to those who've given me so much, then that’s what’s happening.”

Hundreds of fans will have the opportunity to be included in the permanent tattoo design and nothing like this has ever been attempted before. The first batch of names will be tattooed on 19th June this year (Chris' Birthday), so become a part of the Sansara family forever and make history at the same time!

Remember to share this around - The more the project is seen, the faster the design can come together!

Thank You!

Chris Holmes
Guitarist at Sansara
www.facebook.com/sansaraofficial

story:
About us:

Team Rainbow Designs creates unique fashion accessories that incorporate feathers and fiber optic lights.  We were recently extended an invitation into the RAW Artists Network, an International showcase for all forms of art, including fashion, performance, video, sculpture and the like.  Our first event is in Brooklyn on October 20th, and we need your help in order to fund our attendance to the event.  Every little bit counts, and we really appreciate your support!!

Our Campaign:

We need to sell 20 tickets to our upcoming event (or make up the difference ourselves).  Cost of the tickets is $15, but if you don't have that much to spend, we've got other options, and they all come with perks!

The Impact You Will Have:

Your support will help Team Rainbow Designs promote our original artwork, attend this fabulous event, and make us oh so happy! :-) Even if you can't contribute, please inform everyone you know about the event in Brooklyn on October 20th, our original business, and this campaign to raise money.  We hope to be a widely recognized brand someday, and you can help us get there!

story:
flickr

My name is Hana,  and I am the one who started to transform  pieces of Portuguese furniture into book covers. The idea surged probably inspired by the beautiful profession of my husband,  Rúben, who is a restorer of old  furniture and sculptures.

To continue doing what we do and love to do,

we urgently need to construct a new place to work with wood.

We are about to move.



               

                          


The idea of "books with wooden memory" was  been born in the tiny country house that we, as lovebirds rented 10 years ago, just after our studies.  Slowly the book making took over the house - from small stable we created carpentry; our bedroom is used for the paper cutting and storage and tiny living room is my office, photo studio and place where I stitch all the books. Now, together with one friend who helps me.  Portuguese Television made nice report from our current workshop this spring.  


            

Together with two children, that came to join us in this adventure, the house became even more tiny and the alarming security conditions of the house (amateur electrical installation, moldy walls all winter, etc.) became unsupportable. We realized that romanticism has its limits and started to look for something more appropriate.  As asking for a loan in Portugal is impossible, especially as freelancers, it  took us two years to find something we can afford to rent and has soul and space that will allow us to work and live in better conditions. Finally we have got it, but the charming house needs some initial restoration - that´s where our savings will go.



                     

The house we should move into now is beautiful (!), it has a lot of living space for our growing kids and for the bookbinding, but as nothing is perfect, it has no division can be transformed into workshop for our work with wood.



Luckily, it has a lot of land around and we are able and anxious to

One, that we can dismantle and take with us, if we, eventually, need to go once again.  

We need your support now to help us raise funds for such construction.  

As our dreams get bigger with the space, we would like to attract more creative people to collaborate on the reclaiming ideas. There are still precious parts of the old furniture that we have no capacity to transform.  For the bookmaking, we are currently collaborating with some friends and Communidade Vida e Paz but with more space we want to get the place buzzing much more! 

Working with wood is the livelihood for both of us, so it is completely essential to have the studio done before we can move in. Once we get all the materials, the job can be done in three weeks, so we are confident that by the beginning of July, I am  making books again and Rúben has its place to continue  creating his beautiful boxes, boards and tree swing for our shop together with his principal activity - old furniture and sculpture restoration. At this time, our dream of collaborative working platform will have a base to come true.




                                    

The studio will be big enough to store all the precious furniture fragments I collect for years, to fit  all the carpentry machines and tools for wood working. We will create good space  for all the wood cutting, cleaning and sanding and especially a place for all the hand carving of  the personalized covers. It will have two divisions,  one for the "clean" work (waxing, polishing, hand carving, eventually painting)  and part for the "dirty" work like wood cutting, planing, sanding etc..We will be finally able to work on bigger pieces..

Here is the place for our future workshop. The house with its garden  has been abandoned for 9 years,  but with some work  it all gets in place.


The workshop we want to build  will be bigger than our current place and  will finally allow me and Rúben, together with partners we want invite to collaborate, to share one working space in some comfort.  What is also important, the conditions  allow us to have proper electricity in workshop and house.

The estimation cost only for the  materials is 6500 €. If we get less then this amount, the construction will need to be smaller, but some place to work simply has to be built.


                                          

First of all, I want to make sure this isn't just a charity effort, but an opportunity to make some personalized gifts for the amazing people who have supported our work over the years!

As you know, there are no two equal pieces  in our production and we have no stock of the gifts we are about to offer for the contributions, so here comes just overall idea  of what you will get. The types of wood reclaimed from old  furniture vary a lot, so you may receive piece from wood of different color or grain. 

What is guaranteed is that it is made from a material with long, long memory. 

    


Examples of name board


Example of TWO names board



Examples of personalized diary

     

            


Examples of personalized albums





The bookmaking workshops and bookmaking residence scheduling will be discussed individually.

story:
HEY YOU :)

As you know, New York is an expensive city - and this little norwegian-midwestern has a lot of student loans to pay! This makes it very difficult to come up with extra funds for art projects. 

I'm currently working on a 6 piece project that I'd like to have ready for my solo show in January. The main cost is in the printing and the frames - I don't need much! Ten bucks here, 20 bucks there - it makes such a difference! 

I've attached an image of the digital portion of the collages - I want to print them 24x36 and collage/paint/draw over them. I have the collage materials but I do not have the means to print/frame them. 

Thank you for all your help!!

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

ARTIST STATEMENT

My work has always been a reflection of my inner world. It is my attempt to convey in a visual language the deeply spiritual and intuitive impressions I experience through meditation.

Originally from the Midwest, I moved to New York about a year and a half ago. I started my journey here focused on becoming a dancer. My dream was to perform with the Martha Graham Company. Eventually I found my way back to my first love, art. I have been making collages all my life. While I have always cherished the tactile process of creating them by hand, my main focus since moving to New York has been on digital collage. At first this was simply a way for me to work within the space limitations of my tiny apartment. The digital medium, however, has expanded my artistic horizons in ways I could have never imagined.

I use my art to illustrate the visions I have during meditation. Before I start to make a body of work I will often meditate off and on for an extended period of time, losing myself in the visualizations and sensations. Having absorbed as much as I can of these, I sit down and visually process them through my artwork. In this way I hope to teach others what I’ve learned, to stimulate the viewer’s third eye, and ultimately to help the viewer feel more connected within themselves and the universe.

As of right now, I can express myself more clearly through digital collage. Traditional collage is somewhat limiting because you can’t play with transparency as easily. I’m sure I’ll continue to do traditional collages throughout my career, but as of right now digital is what fits me best.

story:
ONCE UPON A TIME…..

I clicked ‘SEND” in the dreamy hope, I’d make it to this beautiful point.

It was a ‘way too early morning’ internet search that tumbled me into and landed me on Arquetopia’s page. During an overload of paper working tasks, for my recent role as an arts project manager… I would often take breaks for my mind, fleeting off into the net, seeking to find dream possibilities that would merge my passions. On that particular 3am-ish, it absolutely occurred.

Did I find it… or did it find me? A center for: creative, cultural and community innovation with a focus on collaboration and positive social action… formed by an industrious, talented and passionate team of individuals…. Who were offering Artist Residencies... For the ‘Day of the Dead/Dia De Muertos’…. In Mexico.  I may have fallen off the chair… I was definitely doing so in my mind, utterly gobsmacked.

Waves of tingling goodness rose within my entire self. Could this be possible for me? Should I apply? Are those even questions?

My interest in Mexican culture, and that of the Latin Americas, may be considered an obsession. If stalking a culture was possible, I’d be jailed.

Initially, through fault of a gorgeous uni tutor I was taught by (Miss Sonya Peters), I was introduced to and spiked by an immediate love and admiration for the works of Mexican Artists & Activists: Frida Kahlo and then, her partner Diego Rivera.

Their bravery in the raw revelation of their most distinct human experience, captivated me. It also led me into a deep line of research regarding the bold vibrancy of life this country beholds, regardless of seriously challenging stories. It is like the more the push against the people, the greater the explosion of creative expression, the more fervent the individual strives to assert themselves through positive practice. I am enamored.

Applying was a must of my heart strings, and as you know from the intro… I clicked ‘SEND’…. And here we now are.

http://www.arquetopia.org/

http://www.elysiumgreene.com/

https://www.facebook.com/handmadechanger

WHO THE HECK AM I?

I am Elysium Greene, and although there are quite a few titles that represent my life undertakings, after being a soul parent to another gorgeous human… I find dubbing myself a Social Arts Activist to be the most fitting.

What this means for me is that my arts practice has basis in two important places: That initiatives and outcomes are aligned with theories of ‘triple bottom line living’ and that they offer those engaged, an opportunity to further recognize the power of their unique and limitless potential.

For those not yet introduced, Triple Bottom Line Living is basically a form of personal and decided accountability in life, not about perfection but presence. To act with awareness toward and responsibility for: economic, social and environmental impacts and outcomes. By doing so we inevitably honour the self, others and our shared spaces.

Stemming from this, in recognizing each person’s unique and limitless potential, we come to a truth that I feel is undeniable in and of life. This being that: there is, was, and will only ever be one of you. Regardless of similarity, no other being can produce any outcome that you will produce in your particular way. For me I feel there is an abolishment of rivalry here, making it possible to honour the individual wholly, whilst also causing greater space for effective and empowered collaboration. We can in duality appreciate fully the self and other for the positive.

Although Aesthetic outcomes are important to me (being the sensory beauty of a ‘thing’) Triple bottom line and self/other honouring, comes first in all that I be and do. I work with a multitude of mediums, considering first the above and then moving into what would fit most conceptually with the narrative I am looking to convey. Sometimes this may be performance orientated, painting, sculpture, music, etc. from my individual self, and at other times it may the creation of initiatives that support the expressive practices of others, as well as providing educative opportunities in the arts for varied demographics. Essentially, I consider all to be vital formations of my practice, which I am truly grateful for.

But rocking onward to the particular business of the awesome opportunity that has been offered to me (and now you)….

WHY IS THIS ARQUETOPIAN RESIDENCY PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT?

Engaging directly with artisans and the Puebla community for Dias De Muertos, means I will be 100% immersed and engaged with a cultural practice that celebrates through resourceful creation and community connection that which is often feared within a large percentage of western cultures, especially my own.

In speaking of this, I am referring to the unavoidable aspect of life, being our mortality. From my subjective experience, I have grown up and into a world faced often with the passing away of those I have loved deeply. As a child I had come to understand this as a mournful and quite dark occurrence, one which was best put aside in life and forgotten as soon as possible in an effort to ‘move on’.

What I have encountered from a far in researching the practices of Dias De Muertos, is a celebration that is embracing of our mortality, enacted annually in honour and mindfulness towards those loved ones as they have left this world. This is not to say that grief and pain are absent here, but that they have the opportunity to be transmuted, through creativity, celebration and connection into positive experience.

WHERE DOES THIS DIRECT RESEARCH LEAD?

It is the way in which these practices allow for the very natural physiological processes of emotion and feeling to be experienced and expressed, that I am most interested in and where the focus of my residency will be based.

For the past year I have been working on, well… several creative outcomes actually, but in regards to this amazing project, what has filled my heart and mind often are the written stories I have created that address simple and fundamental aspects of life toward the greatest possibility for wellbeing.

In research practice I worked with a gorgeous health practitioner (Tania Veronese) during this period to address directly the ‘thought-belief-feeling- action’ cycle of physiology. This practice of conscious self-observance and decided alteration is a form of direct neurological or brain retraining that enables the individual to slowly recondition patterns which do not serve in the fulfillment of a beautiful life (which we are all absolutely deserving of, of course!)

During this time, I also undertook a practice to address the important physical aspects of my lived experience. I did so (and continue) under the teaching of a brilliant Canadian yoga instructor Kelly Korpesio, who served to break down misconceptions regarding my body’s own potential, whilst also dispelling fear and developing instead an understanding of presence and awareness for physiological sensation.

These commitments in combination with past investigations, led me to realize how important such knowledge is for the self. It is the simplified understanding of how we are able to empower ourselves through our choices, by observing, rather than fully attaching to our feeling and physical sensations that I find a most valuable as a change agent.

Although I understand the benefits of activism on a global scale – I do see the biggest agent for change globally as being: self-responsibility, self-awareness and self-love. Without being idealistic, if we are each moved toward this first, a whole lot of positive ripples would occur that could dispel an awful lot of not-so-great happenings that occur on our planet.

WHAT WILL BE THE OUTCOME?

With intention, I imagine a beautiful and vibrant narrative, scientifically and culturally based with a large dose of soulful whimsy. An illustrative publication expressing a possible directive toward how we might meet our rising emotions and feelings with agency, dispelling fear and creating more space for stillness and balance within ourselves. With visuals and text created for both our children and inner children, this authorship would serve to offer assistance in understanding a very natural process of our humanness and how we may harness it.

In Merging with the practices of local artisans, joining with the community of Puebla, in collaboration with other residing international artists and the directors and staff of Arquetopia, brings me to the opportunity of producing this with a multitude of positive outcomes.

In Puebla, I will be connecting to my direct environment, drawing inspiration from all that which is present to me. Like a happy sponge I will open to absorbing every possible goodness available. In doing so the absolute outcome for the visual aspects of the publication are not set in stone. It may be that through my residency I am taken with a practice that moves more toward the development of a sculptural narrative documented through photography or hand drawn illustrations using traditional Pueblan techniques, the potentials here are quite limitless.

What will occur for certain:

·  The creation of a hard copy & EBook children’s publication with content as specified above, delivered as one in English & Española that will be available to the public.

·  This publication will contain the name and location of each individual that has contributed in any sense to the ‘Handmade Change : Cambio Hecho a Mano’ project magnifying the importance and prevalence of collaboration.

·  The authorship sales will also maintain a 30% donation from profit toward the ongoing positive practices of Arquetopia Mexico, which aside from the economic positives – will also contribute to supporting the beautiful bridge of cultural connection and exchange between Mexico and Australia.

WHAT OTHER NIFTY UNDERTAKINGS ARE YOU ACTIVATING FOR THIS PROJECT OF GOODNESS?

Nothing escapes this beautiful path without the side sprouting goodness of something a lil bit special… and to align with that, I will be undertaking a 3rd LIVE ‘Inner Lurve Bird’ conceptual self painting performance at a secret Gold Coast location which will be revealed on the official project pages in a weeks time!

This performance is set to nab the communities lovely attention toward the HAND MADE CHANGE : Cambio Hecho a Mano Residency Project, as well as provide information regarding ARQUETOPIA Southern Mexico. Most importantly though, it is performed with the direct intention of reflecting our individual limitless potential toward our self-experience and expression!

You can view film documentation of past performances through the links below and too, keep a check on the project pages for the performance release date and location!

LET’S GET OUR COLLABORATIVE PERKINESS ON!!

I love the idea that, through asking for your awesome contribution & support with this project, the residencies essence of collaboration begins way before my arrival.

Acknowledging every ‘heart-connected-hand’ that makes any positive outcome possible on this earth, is of absolute importance to me. In this way there is no 'thing' that is devoid of collaboration, even when individual efforts are magnified. We experience a world filled with creative joint efforts, everything we: see, utilize & engage with is the formation of many hands working together for innovative results.

It is kooky but, I often find myself considering such things when the garbage is collected. My perception and cognition is used to the fact that this will occur for me in my particular location, but imagine life without this industrious chain of workers & subsequent events? Every single human that causes that very important public service to occur, so that I (and we) may live within sanitary and beautiful conditions. It is humbling and inspiring that folk would dedicate their 'one time lives' to such practices. So much collaborative creativity in positive action right there!

And so here it is too, although my passion does not seek to provide the vital service that cleanses and beautifies our shared spaces in that particular way.... I am seeking to create an outcome through unity, creativity and mindfulness, which will offer positive expansion for our inwardly experienced worlds, to then further our individual & collective wellbeing.

When you contribute to this project, you are right there with me, another amazing hand creating positive change toward a common goal. We move together, regardless of geographic location, or particular investment, and whatever the outcome maybe, it is formed through 'us', by 'us' and for 'us'. 

SO... WHAT IS FINANCIALLY NEEDED TO GET THIS ALL A HAPPENIN’?

There are several costs involved in undertaking residency with Arquetopia. The organization has been effecting positive change with creative collaboration through residencies since 1996. I find this to be an epic task to succeed with in light of Mexico's economic climate. There is no beating around the bush here, in Australia we are blessed with a different economic experience. One of the first positive ripples of this residency is the effect of being able to contribute economically to the organization itself and thus Mexico, via my placement.

The 8 week period of residency in Puebla that has been offered to me totals: $4537.37 Australian dollars. This is my primary goal and focus for the raising of funds through this campaign and covers:

A. Accommodation and Meals for the period

B. Use of the open artist studios

C. Connection with local artisans or any folk I should need to collaborate with to enable my intended project

D. Full support and assistance in any other way that is possible from the beautiful Arquetopia staff to enable successful residency outcomes. 

I would be completely grateful, touched, humbled, inspired (and all emotions such as this) if we could reach this one goal.

In saying that and believing in all things limitlessly growing in an awesome fashion, if we can reach beyond it, this is how the budget will be utilized:

$4537.37 = Residency Cost Covered!

$6000 = the above + Return flights from London to Mexico City! (Est. $1700)

*I am departing for Mexico from London as I will be taking my beautiful 10 year old daughter Esona to stay with her father & his family in the UK first from Australia.

$7000 = the above + Insurance Protection for my travel period!

$8000 = the above + Consumables & Incidental costs covered for the period!

$9000 = the above + Arrival & Departure accommodation costs pre & post residency, as well as connecting travel needs & residency art materials for period.

$11,000 = A $2000 start-up fund to secure first edition print of the residency outcome for the illustrated publication.

$11,000 & BEYOND = the possibility of extended development, collaboration and residency with Arquetopia in the publication period to enable maximum impact and positive possibilities for project reach.

As you can see, what is needed beyond the goal I have put forward is quite extensive. For this reason I have chosen the flexible platform option. This means, with Indiegogo, if we don’t make it quite to target, it is ok! The funds will still be put toward the project and help immensely – if we should go above & beyond – it is of course, also totally amazing!

I WOULD LIKE TO PERK YOU!

When I considered putting forward this campaign, a very shy aspect of myself piped up to question the ‘should-ness’ of it all. The vulnerabilities emergent from putting ourselves fully out there and asking for support can exist for us all. In these cases, I always feel it’s probably best to tell my mind to take a break and embrace the situation heart first. Also, the essence that this could be the first point of collaboration for the project, enabling my own community and those far reaching to become contributors, far outweighs any rising fears.

And so if all of the above lights up your ‘everything’ as it does mine… and you’re taking this beautiful ride with me, I have so much appreciation for your support! I also have some sweet… sweeeeet… perky-perks to gift back your way!

Every collaborator regardless of support type, will be listed in the final publication, besides which there are: artworks, eBooks, hardcopy publications and the like to choose from in exchange!

If you find yourself in the position of not currently being able to give financially, but have time to be a Handmade Change Sharer…. Please let me know – because this is also completely awesome and highly valuable!

In all other cases, Please see below for the perky-perk gifts on offer for your beautiful support, and thank you so very much for your time!

Big Love to you in every direction

x Elysium.
story_txt:
ONCE UPON A TIME…..
I clicked ‘SEND” in the dreamy hope, I’d make it to this beautiful
point.
It was a ‘way too early morning’ internet
search that tumbled me into and landed me on Arquetopia’s page. During an
overload of paper working tasks, for my recent role as an arts project manager…
I would often take breaks for my mind, fleeting off into the net, seeking to
find dream possibilities that would merge my passions. On that particular
3am-ish, it absolutely occurred. 
Did I find it… or did it find me? A center for:
creative, cultural and community innovation with a focus on collaboration and
positive social action… formed by an industrious, talented and passionate team
of individuals…. Who were offering Artist Residencies... For the ‘Day of the
Dead/Dia De Muertos’…. In Mexico.  I may
have fallen off the chair… I was definitely doing so in my mind, utterly
gobsmacked.
Waves of tingling goodness rose within my
entire self. Could this be possible for me? Should I apply? Are those even questions?

My interest in Mexican culture, and that of
the Latin Americas, may be considered an obsession. If stalking a culture was
possible, I’d be jailed. 
Initially, through fault of a gorgeous uni
tutor I was taught by (Miss Sonya Peters), I was introduced to and spiked by an
immediate love and admiration for the works of Mexican Artists & Activists:
Frida Kahlo and then, her partner Diego Rivera.
Their
bravery in the raw revelation of their most distinct human experience,
captivated me. It also led me into a deep line of research regarding the bold
vibrancy of life this country beholds, regardless of seriously challenging
stories. It is like the more the push against the people, the greater the
explosion of creative expression, the more fervent the individual strives to
assert themselves through positive practice. I am enamored. 
Applying was a must of my heart strings, and
as you know from the intro… I clicked ‘SEND’…. And here we now are. http://www.arquetopia.org/http://www.elysiumgreene.com/https://www.facebook.com/handmadechangerWHO THE HECK AM I?
I am Elysium Greene, and although there are
quite a few titles that represent my life undertakings, after being a soul
parent to another gorgeous human… I find dubbing myself a Social Arts Activist to
be the most fitting. 
What this means for me is that my arts
practice has basis in two important places: That initiatives and outcomes are
aligned with theories of ‘triple bottom line living’ and that they offer those
engaged, an opportunity to further recognize the power of their unique and
limitless potential. 
For those not yet introduced, Triple Bottom
Line Living is basically a form of personal and decided accountability in life,
not about perfection but presence. To act with awareness toward and
responsibility for: economic, social and environmental impacts and outcomes. By
doing so we inevitably honour the self, others and our shared spaces. 
Stemming from this, in recognizing each
person’s unique and limitless potential, we come to a truth that I feel is
undeniable in and of life. This being that: there is, was, and will only ever
be one of you. Regardless of similarity, no other being can produce any outcome
that you will produce in your particular way. For me I feel there is an
abolishment of rivalry here, making it possible to honour the individual wholly,
whilst also causing greater space for effective and empowered collaboration. We
can in duality appreciate fully the self and other for the positive. 
Although Aesthetic outcomes are important to
me (being the sensory beauty of a ‘thing’) Triple bottom line and self/other
honouring, comes first in all that I be and do. I work with a multitude of
mediums, considering first the above and then moving into what would fit most
conceptually with the narrative I am looking to convey. Sometimes this may be
performance orientated, painting, sculpture, music, etc. from my individual
self, and at other times it may the creation of initiatives that support the expressive
practices of others, as well as providing educative opportunities in the arts
for varied demographics. Essentially, I consider all to be vital formations of
my practice, which I am truly grateful for. 
But rocking onward to the particular business
of the awesome opportunity that has been offered to me (and now you)…. 
WHY IS THIS ARQUETOPIAN RESIDENCY PARTICULARLY IMPORTANT?
Engaging directly with artisans and the Puebla
community for Dias De Muertos, means I will be 100% immersed and engaged with a
cultural practice that celebrates through resourceful creation and community
connection that which is often feared within a large percentage of western
cultures, especially my own. 
In speaking of this, I am referring to the
unavoidable aspect of life, being our mortality. From my subjective experience,
I have grown up and into a world faced often with the passing away of those I
have loved deeply. As a child I had come to understand this as a mournful and
quite dark occurrence, one which was best put aside in life and forgotten as
soon as possible in an effort to ‘move on’. 
What I have encountered from a far in
researching the practices of Dias De Muertos, is a celebration that is
embracing of our mortality, enacted annually in honour and mindfulness towards
those loved ones as they have left this world. This is not to say that grief
and pain are absent here, but that they have the opportunity to be transmuted,
through creativity, celebration and connection into positive experience. 
WHERE DOES THIS DIRECT RESEARCH LEAD?
It is the way in which these practices allow
for the very natural physiological processes of emotion and feeling to be
experienced and expressed, that I am most interested in and where the focus of
my residency will be based. 
For the past year I have been working on,
well… several creative outcomes actually, but in regards to this amazing
project, what has filled my heart and mind often are the written stories I have
created that address simple and fundamental aspects of life toward the greatest
possibility for wellbeing. 
In research practice I worked with a gorgeous
health practitioner (Tania Veronese) during this period to address directly the
‘thought-belief-feeling- action’ cycle of physiology. This practice of
conscious self-observance and decided alteration is a form of direct
neurological or brain retraining that enables the individual to slowly
recondition patterns which do not serve in the fulfillment of a beautiful life
(which we are all absolutely deserving of, of course!) 
During this time, I also undertook a practice
to address the important physical aspects of my lived experience. I did so (and
continue) under the teaching of a brilliant Canadian yoga instructor Kelly Korpesio,
who served to break down misconceptions regarding my body’s own potential,
whilst also dispelling fear and developing instead an understanding of presence
and awareness for physiological sensation. 
These commitments in combination with past
investigations, led me to realize how important such knowledge is for the self.
It is the simplified understanding of how we are able to empower ourselves
through our choices, by observing, rather than fully attaching to our feeling and
physical sensations that I find a most valuable as a change agent. 
Although I understand the benefits of activism
on a global scale – I do see the biggest agent for change globally as being:
self-responsibility, self-awareness and self-love. Without being idealistic, if
we are each moved toward this first, a whole lot of positive ripples would
occur that could dispel an awful lot of not-so-great happenings that occur on
our planet. 
WHAT WILL BE THE OUTCOME?
With intention, I imagine a beautiful and
vibrant narrative, scientifically and culturally based with a large dose of
soulful whimsy. An illustrative publication expressing a possible directive
toward how we might meet our rising emotions and feelings with agency,
dispelling fear and creating more space for stillness and balance within
ourselves. With visuals and text created for both our children and inner
children, this authorship would serve to offer assistance in understanding a
very natural process of our humanness and how we may harness it. 
In Merging with the practices of local
artisans, joining with the community of Puebla, in collaboration with other
residing international artists and the directors and staff of Arquetopia,
brings me to the opportunity of producing this with a multitude of positive
outcomes. 
In Puebla, I will be connecting to my direct
environment, drawing inspiration from all that which is present to me. Like a
happy sponge I will open to absorbing every possible goodness available. In
doing so the absolute outcome for the visual aspects of the publication are not
set in stone. It may be that through my residency I am taken with a practice
that moves more toward the development of a sculptural narrative documented
through photography or hand drawn illustrations using traditional Pueblan
techniques, the potentials here are quite limitless. 
What will occur for certain: 
· 
The creation of a hard copy & EBook children’s publication with
content as specified above, delivered as one in English & Española that will be available to
the public. 
· 
This publication will contain the name and location of each individual
that has contributed in any sense to the ‘Handmade Change : Cambio Hecho a
Mano’ project magnifying the importance and prevalence of collaboration.
· 
The authorship sales will also maintain a 30% donation from profit toward
the ongoing positive practices of Arquetopia Mexico, which aside from the
economic positives – will also contribute to supporting the beautiful bridge of
cultural connection and exchange between Mexico and Australia.

WHAT OTHER NIFTY UNDERTAKINGS ARE YOU ACTIVATING FOR THIS PROJECT OF
GOODNESS?
Nothing escapes this beautiful path without the
side sprouting goodness of something a lil bit special… and to align with that,
I will be undertaking a 3rd LIVE ‘Inner Lurve Bird’ conceptual self
painting performance at a secret Gold Coast location which will be revealed on
the official project pages in a weeks time!
This performance is set to nab the communities
lovely attention toward the HAND MADE CHANGE : Cambio Hecho a Mano Residency
Project, as well as provide information regarding ARQUETOPIA Southern Mexico.
Most importantly though, it is performed with the direct intention of
reflecting our individual limitless potential toward our self-experience and
expression!
You can view film documentation of past
performances through the links below and too, keep a check on the project pages
for the performance release date and location!

LET’S GET
OUR COLLABORATIVE PERKINESS ON!!
I love the
idea that, through asking for your awesome contribution & support with this
project, the residencies essence of collaboration begins way before my arrival.

Acknowledging
every ‘heart-connected-hand’ that makes any positive outcome possible on this
earth, is of absolute importance to me. In this way there is no 'thing' that is
devoid of collaboration, even when individual efforts are magnified. We
experience a world filled with creative joint efforts, everything we: see,
utilize & engage with is the formation of many hands working together for
innovative results. 
It is kooky
but, I often find myself considering such things when the garbage is collected.
My perception and cognition is used to the fact that this will occur for me in
my particular location, but imagine life without this industrious chain of
workers & subsequent events? Every single human that causes that very
important public service to occur, so that I (and we) may live within sanitary
and beautiful conditions. It is humbling and inspiring that folk would dedicate
their 'one time lives' to such practices. So much collaborative creativity in
positive action right there!

story:
Short Summary

Today at 3:46 PM 

When I visited my brother who was critically ill, I saw a child with Down Syndrome, sobbing in a corner. I then learnt that the child and his single mother are regular patients of my brother who was a medical practitioner.

I walked up to the boy and asked him 'why are you crying',  he said  'Doctor uncle  is very sick' he couldn't speak well, but I was able to understand.

In order to stop him from crying, I requested him to help my sister-in law who was serving biscuits & tea to the visitors. He obliged and to my amazement he did a superb job which a normal child wouldn't have been able to do. I then told him kindly to have  a biscuit and tea, he said 'No it is bad to eat while serving, I will eat when I am done'. I waited until he completed his task and offered him biscuits, he took one and said 'thank you miss!'

When I visited six months later, I met this boy again and he showed me a Certificate, signed by Sybil Wettasinghe the famous Author and Illustrator,  issued to him for the first place  in years 6 to 10 category, at the ALL ISLAND ART COMPETITION FOR PERSONS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS.

His mother explained to me that his Art Teacher and numerous other persons have urged them to have an exhibition and this has become his passion. However, due to financial restraints she is unable to even to think about it.

That night, when I browsed the internet to learn about the children with special needs, the following caught my attention.

“It is important to remember that while children with Down Syndrome experience developmental delays, they also have many talents and gifts and should be given the opportunity and encouragement to develop them”.

My own brother passed away on 28th July 2014, and I thought my brother too would be happy if he knew I was helping Shemel to fulfill his dreams, and I decided to reach out to my friends and all those who would like to help this wonderful child to make his dream a reality.

Cost of having an exhibition:

Goal is to raise CAD $ 1000

Details of expenses

Hall, Light Stands, Arrangement - SLR 40,000

Sounds   - SLR 10,000

Publicity  - SLR 15,000

Video, Photograph  - SLR 12,000

Other Expenses (Invitations, boards, papers, colors, refreshment, etc.)  - SLR 28,000

Total   SLR 105,000

Equivalent to approximately CAD $ 1000.00

Details of the Shemel

Name: Shemel Andrio Rufus

Date of Birth: 2002-01-09

Class: Special needs Development Unit

School: Christ King College, Tudella, Jaela, Sri Lanka

Address: 247A, Colombo Road, Weligampitiya, Jaela, Sri Lanka

Telephone number of mother: Lalani: 01194 75 7790202

Telephone number of Teacher: 01194 71 3457406

Email address of Principal: silvachanna@gmail.com

The Impact

Your kind contribution will be handed over to the mother to hold the exhibition. This will make a world of a difference to him and encourage him to continue in his field of expertise, although he is a child with special needs.

Please contact me on sarojini@rogers.com if you have any questions.

story:
To My Brothers, Sisters and Family in Christ:


Media is the most influential mission field in the world today;
  • Average time a child spends viewing television: 4 hours/day.
  • Average time a teen spends in media: 75 hours/week.
  • By age 17, that totals 60,231 media hours.
  • Media is the best opportunity for Christians to influence the world for Jesus Christ.    
"The only way to impact the culture for God in a positive way is to be in it, and to be a part of it. And ultimately a small light in a dark place can light a whole room."           —Blaine Barcus, Vice President of A & R, Provident Records.
I have been called by God to the mission field of media, arts and entertainment. Actors, Models and Talent for Christ (AMTC), a 501c3 non-profit ministry, has selected me to be trained and equipped as a talent missionary in the entertainment industry. (See AMTCworld.com for more information on this unique ministry). Will you consider helping to fund my mission? 
I am called to go. As an ambassador of Christ, I will use the talent God has given me to shine for Him. "Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, 'Whom shall I send? And who will go for us?' And I said, 'Here am I. Send me!" Isaiah 6:8 (NIV)
As I rise to call, please consider becoming my Mission Arts Partner (MAP) in two ways: 
  1. In prayer: "The prayer of a righteous person is powerful and effective."  James 5:17 (NIV) Prayer support is vital in this mission field: To be strong, courageous and bold. To not let the culture conform me to its image, but it to His. To act out my calling in love—not judgment. To walk faithfully in trust and beauty.
  2. In financial support - because there is a cost to get ready and go: "And my God will meet all your needs according to the riches of his glory" Philippians 4:19 (NIV)
I'm excited to see the Great Commission of Jesus Christ fulfilled in film, fashion, music and theater. Thank you for being my MAP!

* To be tax deductible, contribution must be made with the understanding that AMTC has complete control and administration over the use of the donated funds. Gifts requested to be used towards a project or account that has achieved complete funding are no refundable and will be redirected to another area of need within the ministry.

story:
Introduction

I’m Jez Dolan, an artist based in Manchester UK. I work with printmaking, installation and performance, and much of my practice as an artist utilises LGBT heritage and archives from which to create new artwork.

My current project is an exploration of George Cecil Ives, who in the late 1890's in London founded The Order of Chaeronea, the modern world's first secret homosexual society. Members of the order included Oscar Wilde and Lord Alfred 'Bosie' Douglas. Ives and The Order are a little known or explored, but a crucial part of a shared LGBT heritage.

I’m interested in exploring our shared LGBT heritage and history, and presenting it in the context of contemporary art. This shared heritage is something which often goes unnoticed and uncredited. 

The resulting exhibition will be presented at Artwork Atelier, Salford in January 2015, and will comprise of installation, sound and printmaking (exact dates tbc).


The Project

The project, and my practice is highly rooted in research. George Ives' papers (he kept a daily diary for 63 years) and the ephemera of The Order are held in the archives of The Harry Ransom Centre, University of Texas at Austin, and I will be undertaking a research visit to the archive in October. Ives' papers in the archive are rarely accessed, and are not available outside of the archive.
I am currently in discussion with a number of curators and gallerists to develop the exhibition further.
I received £10,000 from Arts Council England to enable this project to happen. The total cost of the project is £13,000. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't help financially, it would be great if you could Facebook / Tweet / forward links to this page to anyone else who might be able to. 

    Thanks and best wishes

    Jez Dolan

I’m Jez Dolan, an artist based in
Manchester UK. I work with printmaking, installation and performance, and much of my practice as an artist utilises LGBT heritage and archives from

My current project is an exploration of George Cecil Ives, who in the late 1890's in London founded The Order of Chaeronea, the modern world's first secret homosexual society.
