story:
Funding Information:

I Felt that I needed to add this in so everyone understands why I need this funding and hopefully clarify a few aspects of this campaign. The author Shauna Scheets is an Independent author working on limited funds and I myself an independent voice talent working with limited funds...this audio book is a royalty based project that I have volunteered for, so its success is needed for both of us. I want my voice to be heard and with your help it will happen and know your funds are not being wasted or miss used in any way. This is my entry into a new life and I am excited that I have even gotten this far. For everyone that has read and will read or even donate Thank you. 

Who I am and what I am trying to do:

My name is Kane Silva and I live in Boise which is the lovely Capital of the state Idaho. All I have ever wanted to do in life is be successful, which I am sure everyone on here is attempting. The difference for me is that I truly am running out of options and just about the only thing left is this amazing place called IndieGoGo. 
On the date of February 15th 2014 at approximately 3 am I suffered a severe seizure like spasm while I was driving home, which in turn put me into a concrete barrier at around 80 mph and rolled. This wreck has left me in a state where I have not been able to work due to my injuries. As of right now I have very few options or opportunities for employment which will allow the flexibility I now need. My options being; start my paperwork for disability or hope that a vocational rehabilitation program can find me some kind of work. This wreck has changed my outlook on life as I am sure anyone that has been through the same traumatic experience can attest to. I feel like this is a second life and I am only 27 years old I do not want to sit back and collect a barely survivable amount of money from the government. I need a career that I can be proud of and this is my goal here with you.
This campaign is my chance at a change...a real change that I thought was simply a pipe dream. I want to make this a reality and hope some of you wish the same for me.

Plan for the money:

As I have mentioned in the video I need real and professional studio time to accomplish this goal. I have a local studio offering me time at $40 dollars an hour which is the best deal I can find. Some of the money will go towards buying equipment and software. I don't know how successful this campaign will be so studio time for the book is and will be the first option and equipment/software the last goal.
This audio book will be from the Author Shauna Sheets and the book titled The Tower of Boran.

This book is my first break into the industry as well as an exciting but challenging venture.

    You Impacting my life:

    Everyone has a dream and sometimes life gives a bit of a push to get you to pursue that dream as I know it has for me. I do not want to let this accident beat me so help me fight and stay strong. 
    This IndieGoGo campaign is a dream come true and will forever change my life.  For anyone that gives to this campaign I want to personally say thank you and I don't think it can be said enough. You are all amazing people so I will say thank you again and hope that puts a smile on your face as this has put hope into my heart.

      Pass my story on:

      If I have inspired something in you please pass my story on and I will be further in your debt. As for those that pass my story on to another person or many other people and donate for this new step in life for me, I send my heartfelt thank you one last time.
story_txt:
Funding Information:
I Felt that I needed to add this in so everyone understands why I need this funding and hopefully clarify a few aspects of this campaign. The author Shauna Scheets is an Independent author working on limited funds and I myself an independent voice talent working with limited funds...this audio book is a royalty based project that I have volunteered for, so its success is needed for both of us. I want my voice to be heard and with your help it will happen and know your funds are not being wasted or miss used in any way. This is my entry into a new life and I am excited that I have even gotten this far. For everyone that has read and will read or even donate Thank you. 
Who I am and what I am trying to do:
My name is Kane Silva and I live in Boise which is the lovely Capital of the state Idaho. All I have ever wanted to do in life is be successful, which I am sure everyone on here is attempting. The difference for me is that I truly am running out of options and just about the only thing left is this amazing place called IndieGoGo. 
On the date of February 15th 2014 at approximately 3 am I suffered a severe seizure like spasm while I was driving home, which in turn put me into a concrete barrier at around 80 mph and rolled. This wreck has left me in a state where I have not been able to work due to my injuries. As of right now I have very few options or opportunities for employment which will allow the flexibility I now need. My options being; start my paperwork for disability or hope that a vocational rehabilitation program can find me some kind of work. This wreck has changed my outlook on life as I am sure anyone that has been through the same traumatic experience can attest to. I feel like this is a second life and I am only 27 years old I do not want to sit back and collect a barely survivable amount of money from the government. I need a career that I can be proud of and this is my goal here with you.
This campaign is my chance at a change...a real change that I thought was simply a pipe dream. I want to make this a reality and hope some of you wish the same for me.   Plan for the money:
As I have mentioned in the video I need real and professional studio time to accomplish this goal. I have a local studio offering me time at $40 dollars an hour which is the best deal I can find. Some of the money will go towards buying equipment and software. I don't know how successful this campaign will be so studio time for the book is and will be the first option and equipment/software the last goal.
This audio book will be from the Author Shauna Sheets and the book titled The Tower of Boran. This book is my first break into the industry as well as an exciting but challenging venture.

  You Impacting my life:
Everyone has a dream and sometimes life gives a bit of a push to get you to pursue that dream as I know it has for me. I do not want to let this accident beat me so help me fight and stay strong. 
This IndieGoGo campaign is a dream come true and will forever change my life.  For anyone that gives to this campaign I want to personally say thank you and I don't think it can be said enough. You are all amazing people so I will say thank you again and hope that puts a smile on your face as this has put hope into my heart.
  Pass my story on:
If I have inspired something in you please pass my story on and I will be further in your debt. As for those that pass my story on to another person or many other people and donate for this new step in life for me, I send my heartfelt thank you one last time.

story:
Who am I and why am I doing this?

I’m a photographer from Campeche, at the Yucatan Peninsula, in the Southeast of Mexico. I’ve been active in photography for the last 9 years of my life and I’ve been able to show my work in many collective exhibitions and also individual shows. My photos have been seen in exhibitions in Mexico, USA, Cuba, Austria and Serbia. You can see my work in jpdeberman.com/en

I'm doing this crowdfunding project to make possible my photo exhibition "Here & Now", next September 15th in the main gallery of KC Grad, considered one of the top 10 art spaces in Belgrade, Serbia, and recognized in the whole Balkan region.  

The idea of this photo project, which has 16 pieces at mininum size of 50x70 cm, is to show different kinds of relation that people have with their enviroment. Some of the pics are posed, some not, but keeping an aesthetic that makes the spectator wonder if the subjects are acting or not.

My idea is that we all play different roles in society, in our surroundings. We're always wearing a mask, and depending where we are is the mask we're using.

I like the idea of presenting in this project also these images of people "facing their fate", people who are showed in the way they are, maybe with their natural mask, in an environment where they develop their normal lives.

This project have been developed with analog and digital formats.

Why do I need your support?

  • With your financial support I will be able to make this exhibition possible at all. Serbia (and the Balkans at all) is a difficult place to live from art. You need to do many other things to be able to support yourself as an artist, which means, not having enough time to dedicate yourself to art. Without your help I have to cover all for myself.
  • If the goal is reached, I will be able to exhibit "Here & Now" with high quality prints and present them in lighboxes.
  • I will also print 50 special edition catalog of the exhibition.
  • If more money  than the goal is reached it will be used for starting my next project which is a shortfilm called "One day" that will be also done here in Serbia. 

Your support is very important!

Last year I made my first crowdfunding campaign for my exhibition "Contemporary Landscaping" and thanks to the people's support, special thank to Lucila Rodríguez de Gallegos, it was presented for the first time  here in Serbia, first in Belgrade, then in Pozarevac and soon in Smedrevo.

  • This project is very important for me, becauses it's the end of a year full of work in the photographic field in Serbia. Next August 1st I will open an exhibition called "Imaginary Memories" with all new work. On August 14th I will present a smaller show with previous work in Galerija Zečević, 
  • Your support is very important because if the goal is reached it will be a top exhibition.
  • As I mentioned before, is more than $2, 500 USD is reached it will be used to support the making of "One Day", shortfilm I wrote in Belgrade and I'm planning to direct next Fall.
  • Here are some links about what I've been doing in Belgrade:
    -Beogradfoto.rs
    -"Imaginary Memories" in Belgradian.com
    -Kaleidoskop
    -Exhibition in Ulicna Galerija
    -Paisajismo Contemporáneo (en español) in Eleconomista.com.mx

Risks

If I don't reach the goal the exhibition will be presented in a lower quality. This project was conceived in the way it's described above, so if the goal is not reached, I will probably make some changes about the size of the pics or the lightboxes. 

Other thing would be changed is the quality of the special edition exhibition's catalog I'm planning to do.

How else can you support?

Sharing in Social Networks or by email with all your contacts is also a great way to support this project.

  • You can share from Indiegogo, which would be cool because that sets my campaign in the firsts pages!
  • Get in touch with me if you have any question!

Thanks to everybody for your time and support!

story: What started out as a late night idea, turned into a plan, that plan turned into a mission, and this mission is about to happen with your help! We are college students with low income jobs and not much financial support. A good potter needs his tools, but those tools can be pricey! All of the money we are able to raise on Indiegogo will only go to getting this organization started in the form of pottery wheels, clay, tools, and a firing method. We will then use all of these resources to sell pots and the profits will then go to supporting teen mission trips within our community that travel to other countries, we just need your help!

story:
PLEASE NOTE:

Due to an Indiegogo platform change, our campaign has MOVED.

Visit: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/art-and-community-at-klg-education/x/15638175#/

Thank you for understanding!

Our Mission

Located in the heart of New Haven’s Westville village, Kehler Liddell Gallery (KLG) is a cooperative gallery owned and operated by member artists. Our mission is to represent, present, promote, and sell work of local contemporary artists. As champions of free speech, we do not censor our artists’ work or written statements. We are dedicated to representing critical perspectives that challenge and illuminate our culture and enrich our aesthetic experience.

Our History 

Founded by 8 artists in 2003, KLG is New Haven’s longest running retail gallery to date, though KLG has always been more than just a store. An outgrowth of the Westville-based arts renaissance, KLG has anchored such beloved local arts events as the Westville Artwalk, the Halloween Parade and the Holiday Open House. Additionally, KLG has hosted a wide breadth of public programming charged by the excitement of cross-disciplinary collaborations, including projects with musicians, theatre troupes, filmmakers and authors.

Our Vision

With more than a decade under our belt, KLG is looking to an even brighter future. In addition to presenting monthly high-quality art exhibitions – always free and open to all – we will expand gallery programming with a robust schedule of free and low-cost community arts programs and events for children, young people, adults and families.

Artists will lead monthly story-time events, family movie nights, portfolio review days, artist talks, workshops, demos and more. An apprenticeship program will be established for students seeking to gain experience in a retail gallery. We are also actively seeking out additional partnerships to activate the gallery in new and exciting ways and to offer more artists the opportunity to share in our space for creative expression. In the last several months, we have started to present our ideas to the community. The response has been overwhelmingly positive.

Our Funding Plan

To produce this programming, KLG is partnering with the ArtEcon Initiative, a new neighborhood-based non-profit. We are thrilled to announce our team has been awarded a Mayor's Neighborhood Cultural Vitality Grant from the City of New Haven. This campaign is our next step. Funds will support: part-time Arts + Programming Coordinator ($12,000); artist honorariums ($3,350), free materials and supplies for program participants ($2,200,), outreach and marketing ($800), overhead ($2,500), space use and occupancy ($4,150). Your donations will significantly contribute to our first year of community arts programming.

Our Perks

We are offering some fantastic perks in exchange for your generous support. Artists have donated numerous artworks — many at bargain prices. In addition, our dedicated volunteers are offering curated brunches and cocktail parties at the gallery – all you have to do is show up! 

Please note: We welcome financial contributions in any amount. Any contribution that exceeds the value of the goods exchanged is tax deductible.

See below, visit kehlerliddellgallery.com/programs, or stop into the gallery to view our perks.

​Personal Thank You (email): $10

Personal Thank You (postcard): $25

Personal Thank You (postcard) + KLG Sticker: $35

Artist Postcards, Set of 10: $50

Rent Our Gallery: $500: Events are 4 hours. Dates subject to availability.

Curated Cocktail Parties + Brunches: $500 – $2000: Let us host – and cater – your next event! All you have to do is show up. Events are 2 hours. Dates subject to availability. See below or click HERE for full menus.

Original Artworks: $75 – $1100: See below for thumbnail images. Click HERE for larger images.

Us + You = Love

We hope you will join us as we embark on an enlivened mission to strengthen our impact and grow our community by creating high quality, free and low cost, community arts programming and events for the greater New Haven region. If you are unable to donate, but still want to support our vision, contact us. There are many ways to get involved, and we want to hear from you!

story:
Bringing Cameras to the Claraty Arts Project 

The Claraty Arts Project is teaming up with Courtney Bent, the producer of the award-winning documentary film, Shooting Beauty (see trailer below), and founder of the 100 Cameras Project, to put cameras into the hands of the Claraty artists with intellectual and developmental disabilities.   For many of our artists, this will be the very first time they have ever had the opportunity to take a picture.  Physical restrictions and expense have made it difficult for these individuals to do something many of us take for granted- capture a moment in a photograph.  But with the money raised through this campaign, we will be able to provide a photography workshop and create custom adaptive camera systems for each Claraty artist regardless of their disability, allowing them for the first time to express themselves and share their unique visions through photography.  If successful, the project will not only empower and build confidence in the new photographers, but will stand as an example of the potential of art to heal, to inspire, and to prove to all of us that no matter what our ability levels or differences are, we have more in common than what meets the eye.



Who We Are

The Claraty Arts Project is an arts program and studio in Santa Cruz, CA, committed to the equality and empowerment of developmentally and intellectually disabled people. Our purpose is to support and advance the development of a new, positive, collective identity for developmentally disabled adults via arts education, training, expression and production.  Learn more about us at claratyarts.com

With this campaign, Claraty Arts will raise the funds to bring award-winning photographer and producer Courtney Bent to our organization to conduct a photography workshop with our Claraty artists, similar to her work featured in the film, Shooting Beauty (see trailer below or visit ShootingBeauty.org) . Prior to the workshop, a physical assessment of each participant is conducted to determine what adaptive equipment will be needed to create a camera system that can accommodate each new photographer's unique abilities. Courtney will then travel to the Santa Cruz community and provide a 2-day photography workshop at the Claraty studio that will culminate in an exhibition of photographs.   Courtney will also work with the Claraty staff to develop and on-going photography program at our studio.

The photographs from our workshop will be displayed on our on-line gallery and will become part of a national photography exhibition and awareness campaign, called the 100 Cameras Project (visit ShootingBeauty.org for more info) that will help to amplify these new photographers’ voices, ultimately enabling the broader community to identify with these individuals in a way never before.  

How You Can Help

AND.....we need your help to make this all possible!   The cost for each photographer to participate in the workshop and receive a customized camera system is $850.  In order to successfully launch this project, the Claraty Arts team needs to raise $5,000.   The funds we raise will be matched by a grant from Courtney Bent's 100 Cameras Project Fund.  

The project funds will go towards the cost of all workshop expenses including cameras for each participant, adaptive equipment to allow cameras to be accessible to individuals with even the most significant disabilities, workshop supplies, photographs for exhibitions, national travel expenses for Courtney Bent and production time for the Shooting Beauty team.  We hope you’ll consider being a part of the project!

Check out our thank you gifts- all based on art created by the Claraty Arts artists, more on the gallery tab.

story:
bout This:

Emerging Artist seeking funds for an amazing opportunity to perfect my skills through a professional apprenticeship program.

My name is June Hankins and I'm on a passionate mission to become a master painter in the figurative arts.  I have been accepted into a 3-4 year apprentice program called Ravenswood Atelier here in Chicago. I will be studying drawing and painting from life under 2 master painters, 5 days a week, with only 7 students total in the program. IT"S EXPENSIVE but worth every penny! Each Trimester costs $3200.00 or $9,600 per year.

I have already purchased my supplies and made the down payment....I start April 6th for the spring trimester!

Through  rigorous training in my 3 year apprenticeship and YOUR help I will become a master painter. THANK YOU!

BACKGROUND AND CURRENT WORK

Painting before school 40 X 55 inches oil on canvas

I have tried many art forms but when I started painting 5 years ago, I knew it was my life path. I have been working steadily with a passion to hone my skills as an artist including attending another Atelier school part time that closed after just 12 weeks. 

At SORA (School of Representational Art), the improvements in my drawing skills and the knowledge I gained was immense.  As a tradition, the first 2 years are drawing skills only so I didn't get to the good part ~ Classical training in painting. For the past year and a half I have been hiring the ex staff for critiques, painting as best I know and studying on my own but, it's not enough to get me to the master level.  I'm determined to study at Ravenswood full time to reach my full potential.

CURRENT WORK


  Jack

MY STUDIO


Work in progress


ABOUT THE SCHOOL
Ravenswood Atelier is an ARC approved (artrenewal.org) Atelier school. Dedicated to promote a return of training, standards and excellence in the visual arts.

Student's work from life  and Matt working in his studio

"Ravenswood was established in 2008 by two Florence Academy of Art alumni and former instructors, Matthew and Magdalena Almy.  The school offers a 4 year apprenticeship program centered around the principles of Academic training developed in the late 19thc.,according to the teaching passed down to it's founders in a direct master to student lineage. Ravenswood Atelier's mission is training artists who might one day surpass the former masterworks in skill and execution and serve as examples for future generations to follow".

Model room

    PERKS for YOU

    Pictures inside the school, life drawing sketches and all that good stuff will be available to my supporters on my Tumblr blog! A day in the life. As well as frequent updates here on indiegogo.


    $6400.00 goes to Ravenswood Atelier for the spring and fall trimesters.

    The rest goes back to my supporters : Post card printing, ordering and printing your T-Shirts, Giclee' printing, paper, supplies for portraits and postage for mailing out your rewards.

    In the event I don't reach my goal, I will simply fulfill your rewards first then use the rest toward my apprenticeship.

    If I should over-fund : I will add more perks and prizes for my existing supporters!

    Thanks so much for your help to sustain Atelier schools who are Dedicated to promote a return of training, standards and excellence in the visual arts. There is not that many!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Any way or form you can contribute is so much appreciated! Sharing ON YOUR PAGE with friends on Facebook, any social media or direct email is a huge help!

 was immense.  As a tradition, the first 2 years are drawing skills only so I didn't get to the good part ~ Classical training in painting. For the past year and a half I have
 been hiring the ex staff for critiques, painting as best I know and studying on my own but, it's
 not enough to get me to the master level.  I'm determined to study at Ravenswood full time to reach my full potential.

Work in progressABOUT THE SCHOOLRavenswood Atelier is an ARC approved (artrenewal.org) Atelier school. Dedicated to promote a return of training, standards and excellence in the visual arts.
Student's work from life  and Matt working in his studio"Ravenswood was established in 2008 by two Florence Academy of Art alumni
 and former instructors, Matthew and Magdalena Almy.  The school offers a
 4 year apprenticeship program centered around the principles of 
Academic training developed in the late 19thc.,according to the teaching
 passed down to it's founders in a direct master to student lineage. 
Ravenswood Atelier's mission is training artists who might one day 
surpass the former masterworks in skill and execution and serve as 
examples for future generations to follow".
